story:
The Story

Hello.I am just a guy.A guy that saw a simple dream that sparked me with a wonderful yet simple and i hope do-able idea.I live in Greece where food and the basics are covered but yesterday i saw a child in the streets begging for food.The same night i saw a dream where countless kids where begging for food but everyone who was passing by didn't even looked at them.The morning i woke as a changed man.I took the decision to gather 250.000 dollars to go myself to Africa and open there a charity with food,clean water,vaccines and everything they are in need.I have myself sent food and other handy stuff but this will not make great impact.We need to be together to help those in need.We have food in our tables every day BUT they don't.I have studied economics so i intent to manage the money to be at it's best use.I will do anything to help those starving kids...I am sure you can help me and share this dream with me to make it a Reality.

story:
What You Give is What They Get.

Your contribution will have a direct positive impact on the future of our students.
No tall corporate structures, no indirect funding. Besides the small percentage IndieGoGo takes on this campaign and the cost of the perks, all your contributions go straight to the construction of the school and dormitory.
See the cost analysis below.
As soon as the construction starts, we will provide regular updates on its progress.
So you will be able to follow the project and see the result that your contributions have made possible.

The School

The Msasa Life Skills Primary school is a small educational centre located in Christon Bank, Zimbabwe. We currently hosts 66 students aged between 3 and 15 years old.

With Your Help...

We can finish the construction of the primary school and provide the children with the proper tools and facilities to continue their education.

At the same time the construction of the dormitory will allow us to provide housing and shelter for those children with unfavourable domestic situations, and attract, host and accommodate capable volunteers from all over the world.

Whether we meet our goal or not, every contribution means a step forward in the construction of the school and dormitory.

The Impact

By enabling these children to pursue an education, your contribution will ultimately allow them to break free from the vicious circle of illiteracy and poverty. 

Everyone should be entitled to an education and be given the chance to pursue self-actualisation, and by giving these children that opportunity you don't just give them a chance to help themselves improve their quality of life, but that of their children and children's children.

Perks

As a sign of our appreciation we offer a wide variety of perks for your contributions.
These range from a thank you picture of the children to 3 nights accommodation at a luxurious apartment in Croatia made available by one of our sponsors.

The Future Of Hope Foundation

The Future of Hope Foundation is a philanthropic organization whose mission it is to empower and capacitate young orphans and women to become self-sufficient and engaged agents of change in putting an end to the abuse, poverty, self-pity and victimhood they often suffer.

The foundation fulfills its mission by providing practical and life skills training that provide the basis for food security, healthy living and sustainable development starting from the grassroots. 

This work is carried out in collaboration with communities to create platforms that nurture and promote a culture of shared responsibilities, good ethics, a sound education, good health for all, and care for the natural ecosystems. Ultimately creating a space where young orphans, and other children can thrive in peace, freedom and happiness.

Tax Deductibility (Belgians)

Sadly we can only offer tax deductibility to Belgian supporters for contributions of €40 or higher. Given they make a bank transfer to the following account:
IBAN BE10 0000 0000 0404
BIC. BPOTBEB
With Reference: ***125/0010/00003***
Tax certificates are then automatically mailed to these contributors in February the year after the donation was made. Thus donations made in 2015 can be brought in 2016.
These contributions aren't followed-up by IndieGoGo and it is therefore difficult to attach perks to them. However, if we are able to deduct your contact information from the bank transfer, we will do our very best to try and send the corresponding perk.

Thanks in Advance and Please Share!

story:
Hola,

I am LeShawnda Fitzgerald, owner and founder of Ready For Spanish LLC a Spanish Language School for kids in Nashville, TN.  I started Ready For Spanish in 2010 in the midst of an economic recession after being laid off from my job as a public school Spanish teacher.  As a single mom of two and active foster mom, my desire was to find a way to supoort my family, be actively engaged with my children, as well as finally pursue my dream of being an entrepreneur.  From this came Ready For Spanish, which was the perfect way to share my passion of language learning with children and families in the Nashville area and all over the world.

Why you should be passionate about kids learning Spanish?

The truth is Most K- 8 schools, even high schools are not teaching kids to communicate in a second language. And due to the rapid growth of Spanish speakers in the United States, it's important more now than ever that every child has the opportunity to speak, learn, work and play with their peers without the fear of a language barrier.  I have been given the opportunity to solve that problem, by teaching kids to to actively, speak, listen, read, write, communicate, understand and appreciate the Spanish language.

 


What We Need & What You Get

We need $300,000 to purchase a building to expand our language programs.  Really that's it.  We are currently leasing an office space in a shared building which is not very kid-friendly.  We have found the perfect building in the perfect location to expand our school.

Your gift will help us serve even more students who would otherwise not be able to learn a  second language in this ever growing global economy.  It will directly impact students in our community, city, and with the expansion of our online training nationally and internationally.  If for whatever reason, we don't reach our goal, your funds will  still go directly into the acquisition of our learning center.

We have served over 500 families in the Nashville area and even more through online resources.  You will help us purchase a building to house our school and to better serve even more students in our community, city, and with the expansion of our online training nationally and internationally.  


Why you should contribute?

With the money I currently have, combined with contributions from friends and family, it just isn't enough.  Even with the success, growth, and impact of our Spanish program, the bank said no.  Instead of giving up, I knew that only meant there was a different path to a YES!!!  
Your donation means so much and shows that you not only believe in me and Ready For Spanish, but you believe in our mission, the children that we serve and their futures.


Other Ways To Make an Impact

  • Share! Share!! Share!!! Tell everyone you know about our campaign, our school, and how awesome our students are:)  

  • Donate Now & Tell A Friend!!!

  • Learn More - Visit Our Website & Follow Us on Facebook, Twitter & Google +

40 days to get this done. uno...dos...tres...Vamanos!!!

story:
Since 2008, Stay True has been dedicated to providing students from low income neighborhoods with the knowledge, skills, and confidence they need to become powerful agents of social/political change in their communities.

Since our beginning, Stay True has been helping low income, underpriveledged youth, not only to better themselves and grow as humans, but better their communities and the city as a whole. We do this through community service, the arts and a wide range of experiences our students would not otherwise have, due to their economic status. For instance, our camping trip to Hickory Run State Park in the Appalachian Mountains, where they get to leave the isolation of the inner city and see there is a whole different world waiting for them, and if they work hard enough they can break the chain of poverty and go anywhere!

With your generous donations we will be able to add another key ingredient into the Stay True experience for our students. Along with the arts and community service, we will be able to make parks and recreation beautification projects part of our core program. In ten years time our students will work on at least ten parks and recreation areas that will not only be fixed, but beautified and cared for when they are done. All thanks to the power of your donations.

In our research we have found that due to Philadelphia regulations, overhauling a parks and recreation area can cost between $5,000-50,000 per park. Although we would love to take on the more lofty projects, we understand that we are a small nonprofit, and though our students abilities are endless, it is your hearts and your giving that will determine the amazing things they are able to do.

For the past several years our students have made tangible changes to their communities and the city as a whole and we are now looking to up the ante. That is why we are here asking for your help. 

For those who like what we are doing and are not able to support us monitarily at this time, please see our website at www.stay-true.org and like us on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/StayTruePhilly to help get our message out there!

Thank you!

Stay True

Mark Fonda- Fundraising Director

Christa Merrick-Project Coordinator


.

story:
GAPademics Summer Program

Goal: Employee 10 inner-city high school/college students from the the Hermosa, Belmont Cragin, and Humboldt Park communities serving as teachers/leaders in the GAPademics summer program

GAPademics provides .  

 - A safe educational environment during the summer, eliminating a lapse in learning.  

 - Employment for students in the neighborhood

 - An opportunity for youth to see high school and college student role models from their community

 - Protection from gang and "Street" activity for all involved 

 - Job and life skill training for employees (e.g. balancing a checkbook)

Participates will work part-time, Monday through Friday and receive $1500 for six weeks of work + one week of training.  Additional fundraising to cover fees.

story:
The World Scholars Cup is an academic competition that allows students to showcase their debate, problem solving and collaboration skills. For two days students debate, write essays and take part in a scholars bowl. At the end, if they do well, they are invited to the Global Round to do it all over again. However, this time instead of interacting with 40 schools, the students will be among 2000 of the best students from across the globe.

We have 15 students from Uganda who took part in the World Scholars Cup, East Africa Round, and have been invited to compete once more in Malaysia for the global Round. These students have worked tirelessly to make it to the next round. They gave up their club time and their midterm break just to make sure they were amongst those invited. Because of their commitment and dedication, they returned home with a personal invite to Kuala Lumpur, several medals and a first place trophies for the top out of state team. We also have the junior 2nd place best speaker.

These 15 students would be grateful for your help in funding their trip. The amount we seek will cover all expenses: flight, lodging, food, registration and transportation. We ask that you give what you can along with a prayer.

Thank you in advance for your kindness.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Paul Siegel and I am an English Teacher at Dunwoody High School. I also coach the school's academic team. Academic Team for those not in the know is a lot like HighQ or Academic Decathlon. It covers a variety of academic topics-literature, science, computational linguistics, history- and is competitive. The Dunwoody Academic Team recieves no outside funding from either our home district or the school itself. Ever year we compete try to qualify for the NAQT High School National Championship Tournament, and this year we have! However, instead of asking parents to pay out of pocket, I am asking the students to raise funds. I am starting an online campaign. 


What We Need & What You Get

We need $3000 for 6 players and myself to go to Chicago.  

Airfare is approximately $1500 through Southwest

The registration fee is $650. 

The hotel stay is $750 for enough hotel rooms for the team. 

That runs to about $2900.  I would love to be able to provide a per diem to the students. 

The Impact

Your funds will allow our students to compete on a national stage. Your funds will make a trip possible for someone who it may have been impossible. You will make a difference!


Other Ways You Can Help

Pass the word around! We can always use more press! Feel free to contact me for more information or other suggestions of ways to help.

story:
The House of Panama (est. 1989), also known as the Casa de Panama, is a non-profit 501(c)(3) volunteer-run organization that presents the traditions, music and culture of the Republic of Panama to the public.  It has been working tirelessly for 25 years - to bring the legacy of Panamanian culture to Balboa Park’s more than 10 million visitors annually.  We are drawn together by the love of Panama and desire to share that love with the world.  

Since its inception 25 years ago, the House of Panama has a long history in collaborating with Balboa Park for its Summer Lawn Program, Ethnic Food Fair, Queens Program and December Nights, among other Park offerings; as well as giving back to the community with annual scholarships.  

To mark its 25th Anniversary, the House of Panama was presented with a Resolution commemorating the anniversary by San Diego Council Member Todd Gloria and California Speaker of the Assembly Toni G. Atkins.                                                      

In 2014, the House of Panama expanded its public programming.  It hosted the internationally known Panama Brass band at the Balboa Park Club.  In 2015, it plans to host or co-host events featuring special guests, including:

  • Miss Universe 2002, Justine Pasek 
  • Miss Panama 2014 Yomatsy Hazlewood de la Rosa
  • Panama's Symphony Orchestra Banda Herberto Lopez JDC.  
  • Panama International Film Series
  • Panama City's Mayor Jose Blandon, for the signing of the Sister City Agreement with Mayor Kevin L. Faulconer of San Diego; in collaboration with the San Diego-Panama City Sister City Steering Committee.  The House of Panama, as an active participant on this Committee, is preparing to become the backbone of the San Diego-Panama City Sister City connection in San Diego to ensure its' long term sustainability.  
The House of Panama has been an official member since 1989 of Balboa Park's House of Pacific Relations, International Cottages - a consortium of cottage museums representing 33 nations that are situated at the heart of Balboa Park (http://www.balboapark.org/in-the-park/house-pac...). Nineteen of the 33 member nation groups have a Cottage Museum to share the culture, music,  foods, and arts of their countries.   The House of Panama has a 3 cubic foot display in which to house its artifacts in the Hall of Nations building.

                 

The House of Panama is actively involved in the New International Cottages Committee composed of nine member nations seeking to build their cottage museums adjacent to the existing cottages.  The Mayor of San Diego, Kevin L. Faulconer has expressed his support for the building of these nine new cottage museums for Panama, Colombia, India, Mexico, Lebanon, Palestine, Peru, Philippines, and Turkey.  

                     

The House of Panama is run exclusively by dedicated volunteers, including the Board of Directors below.  Our 2015 Legacy Campaign Team is eager to have you partner with us in reaching our Goal!

                               

                           

For more about the House of Panama and its efforts to build its Cottage Museum, please take a look at these articles:

  • On March 14, 2014, the national newspaper in Panama, La Prensa published an article highlighting the Cottage Museum project (http://bit.ly/1cGAfiX)
  • On January 19, 2015, the VidaLatina San Diego published an article highlighting the new cottages that will be built (http://bit.ly/15rcTKd)
  • On January 26, 2015, KPBS published an article highlighting one of the Houses' efforts to build their cottage museum (http://bit.ly/1G5qDuI)
  • On January 28, 2015, the San Diego Daily Transcript published an article highlighting the expansion of the new cottages (http://bit.ly/1b76erp)


The House of Panama asks for your support to reach our 2015 Legacy Goal! 

Help us reach the $220,000 needed to build the 1st of its kind cottage museum dedicated to Panama in the USA; an institution that will last forever in the hearts and minds of visitors. 

The House of Panama’s Cottage Museum will be nestled in the heart of San Diego’s 1,200 acre Balboa Park; a cultural treasure which debuted for the 1915-16 Panama-California Exposition to celebrate the opening of our engineering marvel, the Panama Canal.

Its time, 100 years later, for the House of Panama cottage museum to be built to showcase the rich and long history between Panama and San Diego… and more… to Balboa Park’s >10 million visitors/year.

Consider making a tax-deductible donation today… and visit our cottage museum of tomorrow!  Set to break ground in late 2015/early 2016, thanks to your contribution!  We’re excited to have you join us in making this journey possible!

The House of Panama Cottage Museum is the first known nonprofit Panamanian museum to be built outside of the Isthmus of Panama. The new 590 sq. ft. cottage museum construction will fulfill the historical architectural restrictions that Balboa Park requires in keeping to period Spanish Revival buildings.  With a basement, the first floor will be the museum and kitchen, and the basement will be used for storage.  The House of Panama will be sharing a restroom and stairway with the House of Colombia as seen in the plan below:  

Visitors to House of Panama's Cottage Museum will get a taste of the vibrant spirit and flavor of Panama, from the historic to the modern Panama of today.  Learn about the deep historical ties between San Diego and Panama; particularly the simultaneous debut of both the Panama Canal and Balboa Park for the 1915 Panama-California Exposition.  Discover the engineering marvel of the Panama Canal, one of the Seven Wonders of the Modern World, in the process of its current expansion; five UNESCO World Heritage Sites (Casco Viejo/Panama Viejo, Portobelo/San Lorenzo, Coiba National Park, Darien National Park and La Amistad National Park), the cultural heritage of seven indigenous groups; the hotbed of biodiversity; the modern Frank Gehry designed Biomuseo; and the intricate handcrafts created by talented artisans.  The House of Panama Cottage Museum will house over 590 square feet of artifacts.  

WITHIN THE WALLS OF HOUSE OF PANAMA'S COTTAGE MUSEUM WILL BE:

  • An interactive display of the Panama Canal
  • Hands-on activities/crafts for children
  • Multiple displays and video of Panamanian culture, arts, history, biodiversity, retirement/tourist/business destination and cuisine
  • Rotating exhibits featuring Panama's talented artists, musicians, authors and athletes, among others
  • Musical workshops and concerts by talented musicians both local and from Panama, our Sister City
  • Culinary tastings 
  • Book signings by Panamanian authors
  • Folkloric presentations by House of Panama's Sonares de mi Tierra and Youth Folkloric group
  • Library of books showcasing Panama
  • Public programming, including hosting of visiting scholars, private tours, field trips/classes, and web-casting of events

Develop an appreciation of a country that, in the words of liberator Simon Bolivar, is "Panama... PUENTE del Mundo, CORAZÓN del UNIVERSO" (Panama, Bridge of the World, Heart of the Universe).  It only takes an hour to travel from the Atlantic Ocean to the Pacific Ocean by car. So cherished is Panama, that in 2014,  International Living ranked Panama the best retirement destination in the world, seven times in a row (http://internationalliving.com/2014/01/panama-worlds-best-retirement-haven-2014/).  

We'll take you inside the heart of this isthmus of Panama...

Who knows, you may want to visit soon!  We can't wait to bring Panama to you!

                  

The House of Panama needs $220,000 total to design and build the Cottage Museum.  To date, the House of Panama has raised $45,000 and received pledges totaling $85,000.  Of the $45,000 it has paid $18,000 for architectural plans and the permit process.  Now we need the remaining $135,000 to break ground, the goal of this IndieGogo Campaign.  

There is great momentum at this moment, as 2015 also marks the year the  Mayors of the Cities of Panama and San Diego will sign an agreement to become Sister Cities; the 25th anniversary of the House of Panama and continuing Centennial celebrations held throughout Balboa Park.

                               


                                                             Perks

All donations to underwrite the cost of design and construction will be recognized prominently inside the new House of Panama Cottage Museum; with the levels denoting unique destinations in Panama.  Sponsors will be recognized in a Legacy Sponsorship Book displayed and/or with YOUR name inscribed as underwriters on the walls of the House of Panama Cottage Museum. 

It will truly be a lasting Legacy.  Your backing of this museum will help ensure the long-term viability of an important cultural institution.

You can help now by donating to the House of Panama via this Indiegogo page; online via PayPal at www.houseofpanama.org; or by sending a check/money order to: House of Panama, P.O. Box 16146, San Diego, CA  92176. 

As a 501(c)3 non-profit organization, donations to the House of Panama are tax deductible, with Tax ID # 71-0954067.

                                                                                                                                                                      

                    


       

The history of Balboa Park in San Diego is directly linked to Panama going back 100 years to 1914; when Balboa Park opened to celebrate the opening of the Panama Canal during its 1915 Panama-California Exposition. The building of a House of Panama Cottage Museum in Balboa Park will cement the historical importance of the completion of the Panama Canal to the City of San Diego’s 1915 Panama-California Exposition.  

Passing on the legacy of Panama’s rich culture will be lasting.  Balboa Park has been around for 100 years and will be here for many generations to come.  

The 10 million visitors that visit Balboa Park annually will have access to the House of Panama Cottage Museum and it's numerous activities at Balboa Park.  

For 25 years, the House of Panama has lacked a physical space in which to expose Balboa Park visitors to its rich culture and history. It has been limited to attending organized events held outside, borrowed space from the House of Pacific Relations and other cottage museums; and a small 3 cubic foot display cabinet alongside 33 other countries in the Hall of Nations.  The Hall of Nations is undergoing a long-term renovation and is currently closed to the public, with the House of Panama display inaccessible to the public.                                   

                                  

With a physical Cottage Museum to call its own, the House of Panama hopes to inform visitors of the richness of the history and link to San Diego, as well as inspire millions of visitors to travel to Panama.   There is great momentum at this moment, as 2015 also marks the year the  mayors of the cities of Panama and San Diego will sign an agreement to become Sister Cities; the 25th anniversary of House of Panama and continuing Centennial celebrations held throughout Balboa Park.

House of Panama is an active participant on the Steering Committee of San Diego-Panama Sister Cities Connection.  Building a House of Panama cottage can help facilitate the exchange of cultural performances, development of a student exchange program, and help solidify economic partnerships among the Sister Cities.

MORE HISTORY:

Balboa Park was named for Vasco Núñez de Balboa, the first European explorer to cross the Isthmus of Panama to the Pacific Ocean in 1513. 

In 1915-1916, Balboa Park in San Diego served as the site for the Panama-Califomia Exposition, a monumental world fair commemorating the completion of the Panama Canal.  The Exposition set the stage for Balboa Park to become the cultural heart of San Diego for locals and visitors from around the world for generations to come.  In 1935-1936, Balboa Park hosted the Califomia-Pacific  International Exposition, the second world fair that included significant construction in the park, including the House of Pacific Relations (HPR) International Cottages Inc.  The international cottages located inside Balboa Park, were the original sleeping quarters to host the Captain and Admiral of the first ships that came through the Panama Canal in 1914. 

                 


A BIG THANK YOU 

Thank you for taking the time to visit us and watching our video; and considering making your donation.  All of this is a labor of love, which we continue to give without hesitation as we seek to share with others our love for Panama.  You do not need to be from Panama to appreciate the enthusiasm and dedication our volunteers have in making this museum possible.  

But to do it--and to make it a fantastic museum space possible--we need your help! 

Risks & Challenges

The House of Panama Cottage Museum WILL be built.  It is one of nine cottages that has gone through a formal process of securing approval by several historical and city committees; and has the support of its mayor Kevin L. Faulconer; who wishes to break ground by late 2015.  With its 25 years of history as an organization, the deep historical ties between San Diego and Panama, collaboration as a team with eight other cottage museums to be built, and the drive of its volunteers, the House of Panama is situated to move forward successfully.  

As with any construction there may be delays due to events occurring at Balboa Park while under construction.  The architects have a plan to minimize the impact on flow of traffic and pedestrians at Balboa Park, and it has been approved by the City of San Diego's Planning Commission.  View the January 22nd Webcast here: http://granicus.sandiego.gov/ViewPublisher.php?view_id=8

Other Ways You Can Help

We accept monetary contributions but are also eager to accept the help of volunteers like you too!  Please ask your friends to like and follow us on social media.
story_txt:
The House of Panama (est. 1989), also known as the Casa de Panama, is a non-profit 501(c)(3) volunteer-run organization that presents the traditions, music and culture of the Republic of Panama to the public.  It has been working tirelessly for 25 
years - to bring the legacy of Panamanian culture to Balboa Park’s more than

10 million visitors annually.  We are drawn together by the love of 





Panama and desire to share that love with the world.  




Since its inception 25 years ago, the House of Panama has a long history in collaborating with Balboa Park for its Summer Lawn Program, Ethnic Food Fair, Queens Program and December Nights, among other Park offerings; as well as giving back to the community with annual scholarships.  
To mark its 25th Anniversary, the House of Panama was presented with a Resolution commemorating the anniversary by San Diego Council Member Todd Gloria and California Speaker of the Assembly Toni G. Atkins.                                                      
In 2014, the House of Panama expanded its public programming.  It hosted the internationally known Panama Brass band at the Balboa Park Club.  In 2015, it plans to host or co-host events featuring special guests, including:


Miss Universe 2002, Justine Pasek 
Miss Panama 2014 Yomatsy Hazlewood de la Rosa

Panama's Symphony Orchestra Banda Herberto Lopez JDC.  
Panama International Film Series

Panama City's Mayor Jose Blandon, for the signing of the Sister City Agreement with Mayor Kevin L. Faulconer of San Diego; in collaboration with the San Diego-Panama City Sister City Steering Committee.  The House of Panama, as an active participant on this Committee, is preparing to become the backbone of the San Diego-Panama City Sister City connection in San Diego to ensure its' long term sustainability.  




The House of Panama has been an official member since 1989 of Balboa Park's House of Pacific Relations, International Cottages - a consortium of cottage museums representing 33 nations that are situated at the heart of Balboa Park (http://www.balboapark.org/in-the-park/house-pac...). Nineteen of the 33 member nation groups have a Cottage Museum to share the culture, music,  foods, and arts of their countries.   The House of Panama has a 3 cubic foot display in which to house its artifacts in the Hall of Nations building.

                 





The House of Panama is actively involved in the New International Cottages Committee composed of nine member nations seeking to build their cottage museums adjacent to the existing cottages.  The Mayor of San Diego, Kevin L. Faulconer has expressed his support for the building of these nine new cottage museums for Panama, Colombia, India, Mexico, Lebanon, Palestine, Peru, Philippines, and Turkey.  





                     
The House of Panama is run exclusively by dedicated volunteers, including the Board of Directors below.  Our 2015 Legacy Campaign Team is eager to have you partner with us in reaching our Goal!









                               
                            
For more about the House of Panama and its efforts to build its Cottage Museum, please take a look at these articles:



On March 14, 2014, the national newspaper in Panama, La Prensa published an article highlighting the Cottage Museum project (http://bit.ly/1cGAfiX)


On January 19, 2015, the VidaLatina San Diego published an article highlighting the new cottages that will be built (http://bit.ly/15rcTKd)


On January 26, 2015, KPBS published an article highlighting one of the Houses' efforts to build their cottage museum (http://bit.ly/1G5qDuI)


On January 28, 2015, the San Diego Daily Transcript published an article highlighting the expansion of the new cottages (http://bit.ly/1b76erp)



The House of Panama asks for your support to reach our 2015 Legacy Goal! 
Help us reach the $220,000 needed to build the 1st of its kind cottage museum dedicated to Panama in the USA; an institution that will last forever in the hearts and minds of visitors. 
The House of Panama’s Cottage Museum will be nestled in the heart of San Diego’s 1,200 acre Balboa Park; a cultural treasure which debuted for the 1915-16 Panama-California Exposition to celebrate the opening of our engineering marvel, the Panama Canal.Its time, 100 years later, for the House of Panama cottage museum to be built to showcase the rich and long history between Panama and San Diego… and more… to Balboa Park’s >10 million visitors/year.
Consider making a tax-deductible donation today… and visit our cottage museum of tomorrow!  Set to break ground in late 2015/early 2016, thanks to your contribution!  We’re excited to have you join us in making this journey possible!




The House of Panama Cottage Museum is the first known nonprofit Panamanian museum to be built outside of the Isthmus of Panama. The new 590 sq. ft. cottage museum construction will fulfill the historical architectural restrictions that Balboa Park requires in keeping to period Spanish Revival buildings.  With a basement, the first floor will be the museum and kitchen, and the basement will be used for storage.  The House of Panama will be sharing a restroom and stairway with the House of Colombia as seen in the plan below:  










Visitors to House of Panama's Cottage Museum will get a taste of the vibrant spirit and flavor of Panama, from the historic to the modern Panama of today.  Learn about the deep historical ties between San Diego and Panama; particularly the simultaneous debut of both the Panama Canal and Balboa Park for the 1915 Panama-California Exposition.  Discover the engineering marvel of the Panama Canal, one of the Seven Wonders of the Modern World, in the process of its current expansion; five UNESCO World Heritage Sites (Casco Viejo/Panama Viejo, Portobelo/San Lorenzo, Coiba National Park, Darien National Park and La Amistad National Park), the cultural heritage of seven indigenous groups; the hotbed of biodiversity; the modern Frank Gehry designed Biomuseo; and the intricate handcrafts created by talented artisans.  The House of Panama Cottage Museum will house over 590 square feet of artifacts.  


WITHIN THE WALLS OF HOUSE OF PANAMA'S COTTAGE MUSEUM WILL BE:

An interactive display of the Panama Canal
Hands-on activities/crafts for children
Multiple displays and video of Panamanian culture, arts, history, biodiversity, retirement/tourist/business destination and cuisine
Rotating exhibits featuring Panama's talented artists, musicians, authors and athletes, among others
Musical workshops and concerts by talented musicians both local and from Panama, our Sister City
Culinary tastings 
Book signings by Panamanian authors
Folkloric presentations by House of Panama's Sonares de mi Tierra and Youth Folkloric group

Library of books showcasing Panama
Public programming, including hosting of visiting scholars, private tours, field trips/classes, and web-casting of events


Develop an appreciation of a country that, in the words of liberator Simon Bolivar, is "Panama... PUENTE del Mundo, CORAZÓN del UNIVERSO" (Panama, Bridge of the World, Heart of the Universe).  It only takes an hour to travel from the Atlantic Ocean to the Pacific Ocean by car. So cherished is Panama, that in 2014,  International Living ranked Panama the best retirement destination in the world, seven times in a row (http://internationalliving.com/2014/01/panama-worlds-best-retirement-haven-2014/).  
We'll take you inside the heart of this isthmus of Panama...
Who knows, you may want to visit soon!  We can't wait to bring Panama to you!

                  
The House of Panama needs $220,000 total to design and build the Cottage Museum.  To date, the House of Panama has raised $45,000 and received pledges totaling $85,000.  Of the $45,000 it has paid $18,000 for architectural plans and the permit process.  Now we need the remaining $135,000 to break ground, the goal of this IndieGogo Campaign.  
There is great momentum at this moment, as 2015 also marks the year the  Mayors of the Cities of Panama and San Diego will sign an agreement to become Sister Cities; the 25th anniversary of the House of Panama and continuing Centennial celebrations held throughout Balboa Park.


                               





                                                             Perks


All donations to underwrite the cost of design and construction will be recognized prominently inside the new House of Panama Cottage Museum; with the levels denoting unique destinations in Panama.  Sponsors will be recognized in a Legacy Sponsorship Book displayed and/or with YOUR name inscribed as underwriters on the walls of the House of Panama Cottage Museum. 




It will truly be a lasting Legacy.  Your backing of this museum will help ensure the long-term viability of an important cultural institution.
You can help now by donating to the House of Panama via this Indiegogo page; online via PayPal at www.houseofpanama.org; or by sending a check/money order to: House of Panama, P.O. Box 16146, San Diego, CA  92176. 
As a 501(c)3 non-profit organization, donations to the House of Panama are tax deductible, with Tax ID # 71-0954067.

story:
"A voice is a human gift; it should be cherished and used, to utter fully human speech as possible. Powerlessness and silence go together." –Margaret Atwood

---

The Short Story

My name is Ronald, or Ssekandi. Four years ago, myself and a group of university students started a non-profit here in Uganda (a registered NGO here). We were driven by our passion for writing, debate and spoken word which had been tools to help us find and use our voices and we believed they could be tools to help a generation of Ugandans find and use their voices, critical thinking skills, and leadership capabilities. We wanted to be a generation of people who were Writing Our World, telling and living our own stories, growing into new stories. 

Today—four years down the road—our dream has blossomed. We run monthly writing workshops in Kampala, Uganda, quarterly writing workshops in Kigali, Rwanda, and an annual debate tournament throughout Uganda.  We’ve engaged with over 10,000 students in Uganda, Rwanda, and Kenya.

Our vision is to see that our young participants can develop critical thinking so that they are able to start engaging head on the many challenges of our society with realistic, local solutions. Our writing, debate and spoken word programs are designed to create space for this kind of development until our schools are able to fill that gap and provide critical and creative thinking, writing, speaking, living, and leadership.


What We Need

In addition to the Uganda National Tournament (run in four regions of Uganda and sponsored by the US Embassy), we have for the past two years been taking the top students from each of these regions to participate in an East African Debate Tournament  exchange program with Kenya and  Rwanda. In this annual event, students gather in that year’s host country for 3 days in which they engage in debate and public speaking competitions, and leadership training.

Below is a photo of me (Ssekandi) speaking before students in western Kenya during a preparation session before last year's East African Debate Tournament.

This year, the 3rd East Africa Debate Tournament will take place in Kigali Rwanda from 21st to 23rd May 2015. As an organization, we are taking 45 student debaters and 15 staff members. These students have shown potential and excellence in our ongoing National Debate Program and were chosen to represent Uganda at the Regional Program. The cost for each student and staff member is $75. This covers three days lodging, food, program costs (each team contributes towards the building space, awards and so forth), and transport (we will rent a large bus, need to pay a driver and for gas, plus border-crossing taxes). For 60 people at $75, the overall budget is $4,500.

This is where you come in. Most of these students have been sourced from different parts of the country basing on merit and not their financial capabilities. Schools aren’t able to provide these sorts of critical extra-curricular activities and most of their parents are already paying large sums in school fees, uniforms, books as we do not have tax-dollar-paid education here.

Can you contribute to sponsor one of the 60 attendees? An amount of $75 would sponsor an individual in full, $37.50 would pay for half of that individual’s sponsorship, and $18.75 would cover a quarter of each individual sponsorship need.

Or give in any amount ($10, $25, $50, $100, $200…) toward the team total of $4,500.

Students will be contributing towards their place in the tournament as they will need to pay the fees to prepare their immigration documents for the border. They will cover these both to keep that item out of our budget as well as on principal that even if they have very little; they still can find a way to participate and that they should participate in their own growth and development. 


The Impact & The Value

Allow me to throw light on the impact and value of investing in these students, in this way. Though, as you know these are people not projects so we can’t promise an outcome, we do believe that investing in youth—especially their critical thinking and ability to speak, finding and using their voice—is of peak importance. Here are some pieces of information to give you a broader picture.

Here are some of the topics these young people are being asked to debate for/against as they participate in the tournaments:

  • African governments should invest in sustainable land use as a measure for mitigating climate change.
  • With the current strategies, we believe Uganda is on course to win the fight against HIV/AIDS.
  • The government should impose a strict taxation policy in order to reduce income inequality.
  • The government should impose a minimum wage in order to improve the welfare of employees.
  • African governments have promoted and protected human and peoples' rights in accordance with the African Charter on Human and Peoples' Rights and other relevant human rights instruments.
  • The current government policy of affirmative action for women and girl child empowerment has uplifted the standards of women and girls at grass root levels.
  • The government of Uganda should put more emphasis on teaching of science and vocational courses over Arts and humanities.
  • The government of Uganda should ally more with the US rather than China as a development partner.
  • The government should shift priority from the Agricultural sector to the Industrial sector in order to transform Uganda from a peasant to a modern and prosperous society.
  • The government rather than the private sector should patron ventures in urban development.

There are many challenging facets of being a youth of East Africa. Here are three of the realities facing these youth--which you may not be aware of--as they make the transition into adulthood and look toward being critical thinkers in their own lives and in their communities:

  1. They live in the most diverse country in the world.
  2. While the country is one of the most politically stable in Africa, they haven’t had a leadership change in almost 30 years. (Next election is 2016).
  3. Youth unemployment is, in varying estimates between 60-80%. (See the Brookings Institution Report, here is a sampling: “Youth unemployment remains a serious policy challenge in many sub-Saharan African countries, including Uganda. In 2013, youth (aged 15 to 24) in sub-Saharan Africa were twice likely to be unemployed compared to any other age cohort. For Uganda, in 2012, the Uganda Bureau of Statistics revealed that the share of unemployed youth (national definition, 18-30 years) among the total unemployed persons in the country was 64 percent. Given the rapid growth of the Ugandan population—three-quarters of the population are below the age of 30 years—coupled with the fact that the youth are getting better educated through higher access to primary and secondary education, a stronger focus on job creation for this cohort of people cannot be overemphasized.”)

In coming days we will add a video here to give you a visual taste of the debate programs, the youth, and the value of developing these critical thinkers, leaders, and creative minds.


Other Ways You Can Help

Please LIKE and SHARE this campaign. Especially if you’ve given, please tell your friends and ask them to join you. But if you can’t give at this time—please still share, spread the word!

If you can’t contribute financially at this time or would prefer to make a contribution in a different way (such as an offline cash donation OR an in-kind donation) please email us to discuss your idea.


What If... (Stretch Goals)

What if? What if something crazy happens and we not only meet but exceed the goal? If we go beyond our goal and raise additional funds, the funds will be used toward the acquisition of office space. Currently the organization runs on such a shoestring that the (full time) staff are unpaid and all of the staff are basically itinerant and travel with all of the documents and supplies they need for each day’s work and each event. An office space could free up a lot of time and mental energy toward the strategic work and implementation of their vision.

The
     government of Uganda should put more emphasis on teaching of science and
     vocational courses over Arts and humanities.
The
     government of Uganda should ally more with the US rather than China as a
     development partner.
The
     government should shift priority from the Agricultural sector to the
     Industrial sector in order to transform Uganda from a peasant to a modern
     and prosperous society.
The
     government rather than the private sector should patron ventures in urban
     development.


There are many challenging facets of being a youth of East Africa. Here are three of the realities facing these youth--which you may not be aware of--as they make the transition into adulthood and look toward being critical thinkers in their own lives and in their communities:


They live in the most diverse country in the world.
While the country is one of the most politically stable in Africa, they haven’t had a leadership change in almost 30 years. (Next election is 2016).
Youth unemployment is, in varying estimates between 60-80%. (See the Brookings Institution Report, here is a sampling: “Youth unemployment remains a serious policy challenge in many sub-Saharan African countries, including Uganda. In 2013, youth (aged 15 to 24) in sub-Saharan Africa were twice likely to be unemployed compared to any other age cohort. For Uganda, in 2012, the Uganda Bureau of Statistics revealed that the share of unemployed youth (national definition, 18-30 years) among the total unemployed persons in the country was 64 percent. Given the rapid growth of the Ugandan population—three-quarters of the population are below the age of 30 years—coupled with the fact that the youth are getting better educated through higher access to primary and secondary education, a stronger focus on job creation for this cohort of people cannot be overemphasized.”)

In coming days we will add a video here to give you a visual taste of the debate programs, the youth, and the value of developing these critical thinkers, leaders, and creative minds.

Other Ways You Can Help
Please LIKE and SHARE this campaign. Especially if you’ve given, please tell your friends and ask them to join you. But if you can’t give at this time—please still share, spread the word!
If you can’t contribute financially at this time or would prefer to make a contribution in a different way (such as an offline cash donation OR an in-kind donation) please email us to discuss your idea.
What If... (Stretch Goals)
What if? What if something crazy happens and we not only meet but exceed the goal? If we go beyond our goal and raise additional funds, the funds will be used toward the acquisition of office space. Currently the organization runs on such a shoestring that the (full time) staff are unpaid and all of the staff are basically itinerant and travel with all of the documents and supplies they need for each day’s work and each event. An office space could free up a lot of time and mental energy toward the strategic work and implementation of their vision.

story: Tinder has a billion users world wide. Tinder is cool but it's time consuming when your just swiping one profile at a time and messaging one match at a time. That is why we developed Fuego Messenger. Fuego Messenger allows you to like multiple profiles at once on Tinder. It also allows you to message all your matches on Tinder at the same time with the same message. You can ask all 300 of your matches "Do you have plans this weekend?" or "we should get together soon!" Get more matches, responses and dates on Tinder with Fuego Messenger.  We have a full beta version of the app for IOS and Android. We are limiting the number of licenses of the app so Pre-register for the app today!

story:
Help Fund the LTG Frank Kearney Room at the Historic Thayer Hotel at West Point 

LTG Frank Kearney, USMA 1976, is the retired Deputy Commander of US Special Operations Command (USSOCOM).  He spent a career in the Rangers and Special Operations commands, parachuting into Grenada and Panama, and then leading in Afghanistan and Iraq.    His lifetime of accomplishments are worthy of a dedicated room at the Historic Thayer Hotel at West Point.   LTG Frank Kearney has also supported rugby for four decades.  This fundraiser is being organized by two of his fellow veterans, John DeBlasio of Bootstrap Capital and Dave Pelizzon of Squadron Capital.   The suite will honor LTG Kearney and half the suite will honor Army rugby.   

Veterans who have served with LTG Kearney, classmates, rugby supporters, and friends of LTG Kearney across the US will hopefully help support this and participate in the room dedication ceremony (spring 2016 date TBD).   

The Historic Thayer Hotel at West Point was built in 1926 and is one of our national treasures, located on the grounds of West Point, high above the banks of the Hudson River.   The 151 guest rooms of the hotel are being dedicated in honor of some of West Point's most famous graduates: Presidents,Generals, Astronauts, Medal of Honor recipients, CEOs, Governors and other distinguished leaders of character.    See the FOX News show that highlights the program:  FOX NEWS SHOW FEATURING THE ROOM DEDICATION PROGRAM

Over half the guest rooms have now been funded by families, friends, classes and corporations including  USAA, Pentagon Federal Credit Union, OshKosh, Remington, Jostens and many other corporations   There are two steps to achieving a dedicated room:  first is a nomination and second is a sponsorship.  First, a committee chooses graduates who are worthy of a room nomination.  Out of 60,000 West Point graduates in history there are many incredible leaders who have shaped our world.   There is certainly no way to provide a definitive list of the top 151 graduates.   Rather, this program seeks to honor a representative cross section from all aspects of leadership.  That list is several hundred graduates long, more than the number of rooms available. 

LTG Kearney is one of those who has received a nomination and is worthy of a room dedication.     So it is important to raise these funds to ensure LTG Kearney gets his room funded prior to all of the rooms being sponsored to other graduates.        

A list of the rooms that have been dedicated can be found here: List of Dedicated Rooms and Explanation of the Thayer Hotel Room Dedication Program 

  • A plaque will go outside of the door with the highlights from LTG Kearney's lifetime of accomplishments.  The current photo of the plaque is only a mock-up, he will provide edits after the room is funded.  
  • The room will be filled with photos and memorabilia chosen by LTG Kearney.  
  • The room will be a permanent testament to the bravery of LTG Kearney and the men and women who he has served with for four decades.     

In order to fund the room and conduct the ceremony

  • Anyone donating more than $300 will receive a ticket to the dedication ceremony.  
  • The first $5,000 raised will go to fund the dedication ceremony.  
  • The rooms are $25,000 for a standard room, $35,000 for an Executive Suite and $45,000 for a Super Suite, plus the $5,000 for the dedication ceremony (Party).    This fundraise is seeking to provide LTG Kearney with an Executive Suite ($35,000, plus $5,000, with 8% credit card and website fee for a total of $43,200).    
  • The Sponsorship plaque will read  "Proudly Sponsored by family, friends and classmates"  
  • If the funds are not completely raised through this site, private donors will be sought to complete the raise to ensure the room is dedicated.  So all funds donated will be accepted.   There is a 5% fee for this site and a 3% credit card processing fee, so the raise is 8% higher than needed in order to accommodate.  If more funds are raised above and beyond the executive suite, those funds will go towards the dedication of other West Point Special Operations leaders as determined by the management of the Thayer Hotel.  

Other Classes Have Already Done This

Several other West Point classes have already led the effort to raise the funds for their classmates rooms.   These include: 

1959:  The Class of 1959 has dedicated several rooms including the 1958 Football Room (the last undefeated Army football team) the Captain Rocky Versace Room (POW/MIA/KIA/Medal of Honor) and several others.  

1960:  The class dedicated the Colonel Nick Rowe room.

1974:  The class dedicated the General Martin Dempsey while he was the Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff. 

1986:   The class dedicated two rooms: Joe DePinto, CEO of 7-Eleven and Steve Cannon, CEO Mercedes-Benz USA.  

There are several other classes who have contributed to the 80 dedicated rooms and who are currently organizing their planned class dedicated rooms.    

The Impact

Thus far the Historic Thayer Hotel has 80 rooms dedicated out of a total of 151 rooms in the hotel.  The remainder will likely be dedicated by the end of 2016.  The dedication ceremony for LTG Kearney is currently planned for spring 2016 if the funds are raised.   

  • By donating you will be helping to ensure the millions of guests who visit West Point will remember LTG Kearney and those who have served with him.   
  • You can currently visit the Thayer Hotel to see other rooms and stay in rooms dedicated to Buzz Aldrin, BG Becky Halstead, Henry O. Flipper (1st African-American graduate of West Point) and other amazing people.  
  • Future cadet candidates, men and women, can come to visit West Point and be inspired by the leadership shown by LTG Kearney and understand the opportunities afforded to them if they are accepted into West Point are limitless. 

Risks & Challenges

The Thayer Hotel management team has already raised the funds to dedicate 80 rooms out of the 151 rooms in the hotel.   They are rapidly dedicating the remaining rooms.  If this and other fundraising efforts are not successful for this particular room, then LTG Kearney will not be honored in a way that they deserve.  

  • Potential corporate sponsors for any of these rooms can contact Dan Rice at danrice88@yahoo.com  

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you can contribute, thank you for making history!  If you cannot contribute, please help get the word out!  
  • This is not a tax deductible contribution and should be considered in a similar way to sponsorship of the naming of a stadium or building.  
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Want to learn the techniques of French Academic painting but can't make it to a workshop or can't afford to attend in person? We have the next best thing! Watch and participate with us from Sep26th-30th, 2016, as we live-stream our popular French Academic painting workshop to a browser near you!

Work alongside Academy of Realist Art's senior instructor Fernando Freitas, in real-time, as he takes you through a step-by-step process of the stages of Academic painting. Watch it Live. Participate and ask questions in real-time, present your finished work for critique, and then access the recorded video post-broadcast. Date: Sep 26, 2016 - Sep 30, 2016

PLUS get access to the forum which will be exclusive to our participants.

About the Instructor

 

The Director and Senior Instructor at the Academy of Realist Art, Fernando Freitas has close to 20 years of teaching experience. He also conducts drawing and painting workshops throughout North America and Europe, as well as works on portrait commissions. Most recently, his work can be seen on the hit NBC show Hannibal. Fernando has produced two highly regarded instructional DVDs & Online Courses: Drawing the Figure and The Bargue Drawing Companion which are available through the ARA website.

Please note that this campaign is for the live-stream broadcast of ONE Workshop which will be held from Sep 26th-30th, 2016 and will cover the fundamentals of French Academic painting techniques.  If you want to watch and work along the live-stream French Academic painting workshop, then the Renaissance package is a good option. If in addition to getting access to our live-stream, you also want to get access to our previously released video workshops at a bundled premier price, then get the other bundled packages like the Caravaggio one.

 

Key Benefits:

  • Watch and participate in the live 5-day broadcast of the workshop from the convenience of your home
  • After the live broadcast watch and practice with the recorded video, any time you want
  • Learn from the video workshop at a fraction of the cost of attending in person
  • Become a better realist artist
  • Learn how to paint like a master and become a skilled draftsman
  • Master proportion, value and perspective in your art
  • Learn how to "see" shapes and values to bring your art to an academic fine art finish
  • Discover the traditional techniques of Old Masters and French Academic masters and apply these techniques to your own art

What Will You Be Learning?

Academy of Realist Art's senior instructor Fernando Freitas takes you through a step-by-step process of the stages of Academic painting.

Starting with the imprematura, the drawing stage, dead colour, first painting, then finally second painting. Student's will gain a greater understanding of oil painting based on old master techniques.

A thorough explanation of lean to fat or fat over lean, the tools and materials, and paint application are covered as well as proportion, values, chroma, and edges.

The Perks

What is Realist Art Online?

  • The only web resource that will give you access to video art instruction and live broadcast of workshops by some of the best realist artists and classical art instructors on the planet!
  • Access the lessons, anytime and anywhere from desktop, mobile or tablet!
  • Upload your work for critique by the instructor
  • Join in the workshop live and get real-time feedback and interaction
  • Connect with fellow artists and show case your work
  • A forum for like minded artists to discuss topics related to realism
  • Learn at your own pace at a fraction of the price

 

What are existing students saying?

 




What do we the need the funding for?

Website: A portion of the funds will go towards building a state-of-the-art membership only website which will host the video broadcasts and allow access to the workshops post broadcast and also provide you the tools you need to learn and get feedback

Artist Fees: We obviously need to pay the artists for their time, and material cost

Studio rental

Video & Audio equipment for filming & live broadcast.

Software for Live broadcast

Video editing and post
 

Share this campaign with your friends!

Hey, if you like this campaign please get the word out to your friends and use the share tools above. Thank you!

story:
A journey for a better future

Hello everyone. Thank you for reading this.Thank you for being the people you are -- people who help entrepreneurs like us get one step closer to building something amazing that helps change the world.

My name is Suryasree, and I am one of the 50 privileged entrepreneurs, who have been selected for the MIT Global Entrepreneurship Bootcamp. II hail from India, the land of diversity. But, before I go about telling more about what the Bootcamp is all about. Let me tell you something about myself.

I am a B.E graduate in Mechanical Engineering with First class distinction under Anna University, Chennai and have a working experience as a Process Engineer for more than 2 years in MAHLE Behr India Pvt Ltd Pune (Anand Automotives). 

During my journey from college to my job till this day, I have had many opportunities to explore, learn and grow. I had initiated the participation of my college in SAE Baja India for two years, my previous employer had encouraged my learning nature by awarding me the Young Techie Award in my batch, and my team and I were the Runner Ups in the 42nd All India Management Association's National Competition for Young Managers. Every single time I tried something new, I faced set-backs, I persevered, I received help and made sure to leave my mark in it. The thrill of learning and growing is something that always sets ablaze a fire inside of my soul.

Now I am on a quest to build a startup to change the lifestyle of people through my knowledge as process engineer.

A journey of a 1000 miles must start with a small step, that's why I have applied for the MIT Bootcamp 2016 this August, where I will get the chance to interact and create something meaningful with 49 other brilliant minds all around the world. I am humbled and immensely excited over the opportunity to be selected for this 3 months intensive bootcamp, which is being conducted by MIT at their campus (Cambridge, MA) and is being guided by the renowned entrepreneurship mentor, Bill Aulet. The bootcamp is a 3-month mentorship program that begins with a one-week, intensive, in-person training and culminates with a reunion at MIT. This is a highly selective program for highly motivated students. 

I am happy to share a copy of my acceptance letter. 

My goal to attend the boot-camp is to:

1. Learn what more I need to do in my business model and product to convert into to a viable business, and most importantly, have a positive impact on our customers.

2. Coming for humble background (doesn't help that Forex is a pain in the neck), getting the right network can be quite difficult. MIT Global Entrepreneurship Bootcamp is the perfect platform for me to connect and network with the world's brilliant mentors, VC and entrepreneurs.

3. Share ideas and thought processing, without a healthy sharing of ideas, it is impossible to grow. What else could be a better platform?

Despite the chance given, I am having problems raising funds. 6000 USD translates to 400,000 INR approx. Then there is the flight tickets which costs 1282 USD (the cheapest), the lodging will cost me another 1200 (for 7 days and six nights), Visa (200 USD), local commute, etc. will cost be 8800 USD approx. I have gone to banks for loan, but they too have refused to process my application. I must admit, with the time ticking I really am beginning to feel the pressure and a bit disheartened. Nevertheless, the silver-lining to my story would be that MIT has generously granted me an extension in time to confirm by participation along with the course fees. However, I cannot confirm without ensuring that I can raise the entire amount. I have gone to NGOs, Trusts, written millions of mails and spammed several government agencies and established Entrepreneurs. So, far I have had no luck in all those department.

Fortunately, I am receiving great support and encouragement from the common people. Yes, people like you. That's why I am still carrying the torch. I have reached 5000 USD after-all. With so many people supporting, how can I give up? So, here I am, asking you to help me not give-up.

Help me take this first step towards my journey!

I was inspired by Adm.McRaven's speech in Austin regarding the 10 life lessons to change the world. One of them made an immense impression on me. It goes something like this, 

"For the boat to make it to its destination, everyone must paddle. You can't change the world alone — you will need some help — and to truly get from your starting point to your destination takes friends, colleagues, the good will of strangers and a strong coxswain to guide them."

That's why I am turning to you, for your support in any amount. Even if each view end up with a contribution of 10$, I can still raise the entire amount and get to participate in this bootcamp. Even the tiniest amount has my gratitude!

Once the campaign ends, the money shall go towards tuition fees payable to MIT Bootcamp, my travel and housing for the 5 days in Cambridge, MA. If I exceed my funding target, I will use it as a seed capital for my startup -- Ideamaginative. 

My startup, Ideamaginative, created with the sole purpose of proactively solving and helping organizations solve process related issues to enhance people's lifestyle. We basically take those solutions and help covert them into a business model with marketing and operation design support. How we do this is through our SaaS product -- CityWiz. The innovation in this product is the R3 architecture that is based on preferential pattern matching engine. This helps us to empirically predict the heterogeneous behavior of our target market (21-28) that can be mapped to business opportunities.

With your support, I can make my vision for tomorrow a reality today

Why me?

Having learnt engineering and how to design the processes of a system through my previous company experience, I wish to apply the same to make some difference in the lifestyle of people. This is how I believe I can truly add value to the community, and thereby, to me. Apart from that, I am honing my skills further through online courses by MIT, Wharton Business school and IE Business School. 

Attending MIT Bootcamp will not only help understand and take necessary steps to build Ideamaginative to a company changing the face of processes in India, but also help me gain the necessary leverage that a person from humble background (retired father, bootstrapping non-IIT/IIM Entrepreneur from India) can't usually get to make their startups come to life.

Ideamaginative has its heart centered around proactively solving process problems that are people-centric. CityWiz too is design based on the same, how to make relocating as a thing people look forward to. Travelling is one of the best way a people can explore, leave their pond, and witness the world as it is. By travelling I don’t mean tourism, I mean really going to a place and staying there long enough to understand the differences in though processing and culture of the same. The fact that it is hindered by the silly reason for lack of proper system and resources in places is, frankly, very annoying to me. CityWiz, I feel, will help anyone who wishes to explore do it, without worrying the sidetracking details. Apart from that, the usage of the technology behind CityWiz can help digitized retails in the Indian market rapidly. In the sense, locating your demand will not be an issue, and small businesses which are being swallowed by internet giants like Amazon will thrive again. 

I will not only learn and grow, but also share the knowledge among my fellow entrepreneurs so that they may be able to build their business to their potential. That's why, I turn to you all to help me bring my idea to life.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to help me financially, no worries, first let me thank you for reading though my campaign. Second, you could always:

  1. Spread the word about my campaign 
  2. Sponsor in–kind donations
    (air miles, hotel points, flights, accommodation, rides to & from airport etc)
You can find out more about me in my LinkedIn profile. You can find more about my startup through Facebook page, LinkedIn page and Twitter.

If you have any questions at all please drop me a mail in suryasree@ideamaginative.com.

A journey for a better future Hello everyone. Thank you for reading this.Thank you for being the people you are -- people who help entrepreneurs like us get one step closer to building something amazing that helps change the world.
My name is Suryasree, and I am one of the 50 privileged entrepreneurs, who have been selected for the MIT Global Entrepreneurship Bootcamp. II hail from India, the land of diversity. But, before I go about telling more about what the Bootcamp is all about. Let me tell you something about myself.

I am a B.E graduate in Mechanical Engineering with First class distinction under Anna University, Chennai and have a working experience as a Process Engineer for more than 2 years in MAHLE Behr India Pvt Ltd Pune (Anand Automotives). 
During my journey from college to my job till this day, I have had many opportunities to explore, learn and grow. I had initiated the participation of my college in SAE Baja India for two years, my previous employer had encouraged my learning nature by awarding me the Young Techie Award in my batch, and my team and I were the Runner Ups in the 42nd All India Management Association's National Competition for Young Managers. Every single time I tried something new, I faced set-backs, I persevered, I received help and made sure to leave my mark in it. The thrill of learning and growing is something that always sets ablaze a fire inside of my soul.
Now I am on a quest to build a startup to change the lifestyle of people through my knowledge as process engineer.



A journey of a 1000 miles must start with a small step, that's why I have applied for the MIT Bootcamp 2016 this August, where I will get the chance to interact and create something meaningful with 49 other brilliant minds all around the world. I am humbled and immensely excited over the opportunity to be selected for this 3 months intensive bootcamp, which is being conducted by MIT at their campus (Cambridge, MA) and is being guided by the renowned entrepreneurship mentor, Bill Aulet. The bootcamp is a 3-month mentorship program that begins with a one-week, intensive, in-person training and culminates with a reunion at MIT. This is a highly selective program for highly motivated students. 
I am happy to share a copy of my acceptance letter. 


My goal to attend the boot-camp is to:
1. Learn what more I need to do in my business model and product to convert into to a viable business, and most importantly, have a positive impact on our customers.
2. Coming for humble background (doesn't help that Forex is a pain in the neck), getting the right network can be quite difficult. MIT Global Entrepreneurship Bootcamp is the perfect platform for me to connect and network with the world's brilliant mentors, VC and entrepreneurs.
3. Share ideas and thought processing, without a healthy sharing of ideas, it is impossible to grow. What else could be a better platform?
Despite the chance given, I am having problems raising funds. 6000 USD translates to 400,000 INR approx. Then there is the flight tickets which costs 1282 USD (the cheapest), the lodging will cost me another 1200 (for 7 days and six nights), Visa (200 USD), local commute, etc. will cost be 8800 USD approx. I have gone to banks for loan, but they too have refused to process my application. I must admit, with the time ticking I really am beginning to feel the pressure and a bit disheartened. Nevertheless, the silver-lining to my story would be that MIT has generously granted me an extension in time to confirm by participation along with the course fees. However, I cannot confirm without ensuring that I can raise the entire amount. I have gone to NGOs, Trusts, written millions of mails and spammed several government agencies and established Entrepreneurs. So, far I have had no luck in all those department.
Fortunately, I am receiving great support and encouragement from the common people. Yes, people like you. That's why I am still carrying the torch. I have reached 5000 USD after-all. With so many people supporting, how can I give up? So, here I am, asking you to help me not give-up.
   
Help me take this first step towards my journey! I was inspired by Adm.McRaven's speech in Austin regarding the 10 life lessons to change the world. One of them made an immense impression on me. It goes something like this, 
"For the boat to make it to its destination, everyone must paddle. You can't change the world alone — you will need some help — and to truly get from your starting point to your destination takes friends, colleagues, the good will of strangers and a strong coxswain to guide them."
That's why I am turning to you, for your support in any amount. Even if each view end up with a contribution of 10$, I can still raise the entire amount and get to participate in this bootcamp. Even the tiniest amount has my gratitude!
Once the campaign ends, the money shall go towards tuition fees payable to MIT Bootcamp, my travel and housing for the 5 days in Cambridge, MA. If I exceed my funding target, I will use it as a seed capital for my startup -- Ideamaginative. 
My startup, Ideamaginative, created with the sole purpose of proactively solving and helping organizations solve process related issues to enhance people's lifestyle. We basically take those solutions and help covert them into a business model with marketing and operation design support. How we do this is through our SaaS product -- CityWiz. The innovation in this product is the R3 architecture that is based on preferential pattern matching engine. This helps us to empirically predict the heterogeneous behavior of our target market (21-28) that can be mapped to business opportunities.



With your support, I can make my vision for tomorrow a reality today



Why me?
Having learnt engineering and how to design the processes of a system through my previous company experience, I wish to apply the same to make some difference in the lifestyle of people. This is how I believe I can truly add value to the community, and thereby, to me. Apart from that, I am honing my skills further through online courses by MIT, Wharton Business school and IE Business School. 
Attending MIT Bootcamp will not only help understand and take necessary steps to build Ideamaginative to a company changing the face of processes in India, but also help me gain the necessary leverage that a person from humble background (retired father, bootstrapping non-IIT/IIM Entrepreneur from India) can't usually get to make their startups come to life.
Ideamaginative has its heart centered
     around proactively solving process problems that are people-centric.
     CityWiz too is design based on the same, how to make relocating as a thing
     people look forward to. Travelling is one of the best way a people can
     explore, leave their pond, and witness the world as it is. By travelling I
     don’t mean tourism, I mean really going to a place and staying there long
     enough to understand the differences in though processing and culture of
     the same. The fact that it is hindered by the silly reason for lack of
     proper system and resources in places is, frankly, very annoying to me.
     CityWiz, I feel, will help anyone who wishes to explore do it, without
     worrying the sidetracking details. Apart from that, the usage of the
     technology behind CityWiz can help digitized retails in the Indian market
     rapidly. In the sense, locating your demand will not be an issue, and
     small businesses which are being swallowed by internet giants like Amazon
     will thrive again. 
I will not only learn and grow, but also share the knowledge among my fellow entrepreneurs so that they may be able to build their business to their potential. That's why, I turn to you all to help me bring my idea to life.



Other Ways You Can Help



If you are unable to help me financially, no worries, first let me thank you for reading though my campaign. Second, you could always:

Spread the word about my campaign 
Sponsor in–kind donations(air miles, hotel points, flights, accommodation, rides to & from airport etc)

You can find out more about me in my LinkedIn profile. You can find more about my startup through Facebook page, LinkedIn page and Twitter. 
If you have any questions at all please drop me a mail in suryasree@ideamaginative.com.

story:
Where does your money go?

Your money goes towards school bus fees for the children for an entire academic year, 2016-2017.

One month of bus fees for all twenty children is $300.

Ten months (an academic year) is $3,000.  This is our target!


Who do you help?

20 wonderful children of the Syrian refugee camp in Barsa, Lebanon. The children and their families have now been in Barsa for five years. We want to carry on supporting their education to help them achieve their dreams.  When we were together for the first time two years ago, we were embraced with their beauty, intelligence and resiliency. Let us help them get the education they deserve.

"Learn as if you were to live forever." - Gandhi



To see our beginnings, a link to our previous campaign is: https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/school-tuition-fees-for-25-syrian-children

For more information and to see our history, please see our website: http://mayoub9.wix.com/anaanta
