story:
WE NEED YOU

Why this mobile movement?

The Mobile Minaret, with a profound message at its core, is vital to counter what is currently dominant in cyberspace on the Quran. It is best suited to carry the message of understanding HOW the Quran itself teaches critical thinking and I need your help to do it. 

Through the Mobile Minaret we move the minaret or “lighthouse” from its frozen-in -time architecture to the open mobile space calling to Muslims to wake up because it is not our faith that has been seized, but the radical interpretation of the Quran.

Critical thinking is known as discernment (furqan) in the Quran. Quranic thinking becomes critical when it evaluates the reasoning of a verse or sign (ayah): Such evaluation must, however, as Islamic scholar, Mohammad Hashim Kamali, points out,  “be carried forth in a constructive manner. The purpose of critical thinking is to achieve understanding, evaluate viewpoints, ask questions and solve problems. In general, our thinking is likely to become critical when concrete learning experiences precede abstract thought, that is, when there is thinking wedded with wisdom (hikmah).” 

We best develop Quranic critical thinking skills through dialogical learning, learning that takes place through dialogue. Through dialogue with the Quranic text with neighbors, with classmates, with a teacher or mentor, through a sharable video, a Facebook page, through a Twitter message or SMS text message, our goal is take back the Quran

You can help by contributing what you can and by joining our movement against radicalization:

Discovery and Design phase (April-August) 

1  Approach the problem from a human-centered perspective.

2  Engage Islamic scholars

3  Engage technology partners 

4  Identify goals and challenges and iterate.

5  Design a solution with capacity for social change.

We need you to help us to spread the word to hit this goal!

We have an awesome range of perks available including EARLY ACCESS TO THE SOFTWARE before anyone else, be able to be first to try it in your school or community.

We don’t just want you to back the movement against radicalization though, we want you to join our community and be a part of making history. 7 ways in which you can help our campaign today!

Launch the Mobile Platform

1  Train 

2  Market

3  Digital engagement

4  Media outreach

The Impact

Join Our Community

Community is at the heart of the Mobile Minaret campaign and we are building a global community that will work together to help this incredible opportunity to bring active thinking in Quranic studies to people across the world.

We don't just want you to support the campaign by getting a perk, we want you to be a part of making history. We have 7 awesome ways in which you can help our campaign today!

With just a $250 donation, you can get the opportunity to have EARLY ACCESS TO THIS SOFTWARE before anyone else. See the perks!

Explore More

We Need You • The Perks • Where the Money is Used

Join Our Movement • 7 Ways to Help • FAQ

 

 

Featured In

Religion News Service

http://www.religionnews.com/2016/02/26/mobile-minaret-is-mightier-than-the-sword-facebook-twitter-youtube-snapchat-periscope/

Washington Post

 https://www.washingtonpost.com/national/religion/a-mobile-minaret-is-mightier-than-the-sword-commentary/2016/02/26/3a4fe1d8-dc98-11e5-8210-f0bd8de915f6_story.htm

www.religionnews.com/.../mobile-minaret-is-mightier-than-the-sword- facebook-twitter-youtube-snapchat-periscope/

www.religionnews.com/author/lbakhtiar/

www.religionnews.com/series/combating-online-hate-speech/

www.religionnews.com/tag/islam-2/

www.religionnews.com/tag/isis/


HOW YOU CAN CONTRIBUTE

We’ve put together an exciting set of perks around our movement. Show your support of the Mobile Minaret:

WHERE THE MONEY IS USED

Every dollar that you pledge will go towards producing and marketing the Mobile Minaret movement to ensure it is as successful and impactful as possible.

The money will be used in four primary areas:

•  Wider testing with more Muslim students in more towns and communities – we want to ensure the software created by teams gets as much testing and feedback in the field as possible. Your contribution will fund the development of the youtube videos, software and a popular game in more towns and communities.

•  Helping teams to be successful – the success of the teams that compete in this campaign are critical to our overall success. Your tax deductible contribution will help create an environment for teams to be successful, including development resources and more. 

•  Creating a global Mobile Minaret community – beyond the teams that are participating, we are trying to face the grand challenges of our time. Your contribution will help create this community by providing tools and more. Come and join us at mobileminaret.org!

•  Creating Quranic educational technology – the proposed mobile multimedia devices will create a remarkable educational foundation for Quranic studies. Your contribution will be an investment in this education, as well as ensuring that the technology can live and grow as we continue to get feedback.

Importantly, your money will NOT be used in the following areas:

•  Rent or Non-project Expenses.

•  Fundraising activities and events.

If you have any further questions or queries about how the money is spent, feel free to share your questions on mobileminaret.org

Join Our Community

Community is at the heart of the Mobile Minaret campaign and we are building a global community that will work together to help this incredible opportunity to bring active thinking in Quranic studies to people across the world.

We don't just want you to support the campaign by getting a perk, we want you to be a part of making history.

We are building a community of advocates, developers, teachers, scientists, business-people, artists, designers, translators and more. This community is coming together to bring their skills and talents to the table; we believe that everyone can put their brick in the wall to eradicating passive Quranic thinking.

We have only just started, and we already have a global spread:This community is forming on a brand new forum that helps us to get to know each other, brainstorm, collaborate on projects, and more! It is a shared family, passionate about bringing real, practical change to the world.

7 WAYS TO HELP

There are many ways in which you can play an essential role in the success of the Mobile Minaret campaign:

•  Contribute! A great place to start is to buy one of our awesome perks. Scroll up to find out more!

•  Join the Community: Come to the website mobileminaret.org and share ideas, brainstorm, and collaborate around new ways to introduce the learning experience.

•  Refer Friends so they can participate in this remarkable adventure.

•  Create and Share Digital Content: We are encouraging authors, developers, content-creators and more to create content that will spread the word about Quranic critical thinking, and more!

•  Share and Tag Your Top 5 Children's Books: Which children's books have been the most memorable for you? Share your Top 5, complete with a link to mobileminaret.org and tag 10 friends to share theirs too! When using social media, be sure to use the #mobileminaret hashtag.

•  Create Your 'Learning Moment' Video: Record a video and share on a video website (such as YouTube) about how learning has really impact your life. Give the video the title “Mobile Minaret: My Learning Moment". Be sure to share your video on social media too with the #mobileminaret hashtag!

•  Organize a Local Event: Create a local event to share the Mobile Minaret initiative. 

•  Remember, if you have questions, be sure to join the Mobile Minaret community at mobileminaret.org


$150,000 STRETCH GOAL

Build the Mobile Platform (August-December)

1 Write and produce Quranic critical thinking content for mobile

2 Design and develop code

3 Build and test a prototype with the community 

4 Design analytics and metrics for success

$400,000 STRETCH GOAL

Launch the Mobile Platform 

(expected January 2017)

1 Train 

2 Market

3 Digital engagement

4 Media outreach


FAQ

Why are you doing this?

This Indiegogo campaign is designed to further enhance the community, team collaboration, practical field-trials and testing, and other areas that are part of the Mobile Minaret initiative. We believe the power is in our community, but not just in the teams who create the technology to develop this project, but many other people who want to play a role in solving this grand challenge.

Crowdfunding is a great way in which the general public can help contribute towards making the Mobile Minaret as successful as it can be both in terms of raising resources as well as raising awareness. We believe that everybody, from our backers on this campaign, to teams, to members of our new community, can make a real difference.

Why the $63,900 figure?

After breaking down the costs of the many moving parts associated with deploying, testing, and tracking this technology as well as with establishing an infrastructure, and platform, our team determined that this money will cover many of these initial costs.  

This is really just the first step. The more we raise, the more we can do – let’s raise 10x that this amount so we can further facilitate success of this the Mobile Minaret Movement. Help us spread the word!

How do we know this will be successful?

The team has consulted with a global team of experts in structuring the requirements for how the Quran teaches critical thinking. This process takes into account the growth of technology, where we expect technology to be in the next five years, the extent of the problem (e.g. how many Muslims do not know HOW the Quran teaches critical thinking), and how attractive this would be to prospective teams.

With these exhaustive considerations accounted for, we are very confident that the Mobile Minaret is going to net incredible results. If we didn't have confidence in this, we wouldn't launch it in the first place.

How much money from the crowdfunding actually goes to Mobile Minaret campaign?

With the exception of the Indiegogo/FirstGiving fees, every dollar goes towards the campaign.

What payment methods do you accept?

We accept major credit cards.

Can I donate from outside the USA?

Absolutely!

When will my perk prizes be delivered?

We are currently estimating shipping in January 2017.

I love what you are doing! How can I help?

Great question! Go and see the 7 ways in which you can help, all listed above. Also be sure to come and join the community at mobileminaret.org and find out more.

Is shipping included in the perks?

Yes.

Can I write-off my contribution with my taxes?

Yes. You will receive a letter confirming your donation.

I am a celebrity or public figure and would like to endorse the movement or help in some other way. How do I get in touch with you?

Please email Laleh Bakhtiar, our Sr. Dir. Community who can discuss this further with you.

story:
We Need Your Help to Bring This App to Life!

Your contribution will be used to finalize the development of this radical technology that benefits students and all of society.  


No More Hounding Kids to Do Homework!

The Incentify app manages the student's entire learning process, so that parent's no longer have to push their children to do their dreaded homework.  Instead, students become naturally motivated by the incentives which impel students to want to do homework on their own!


Incentivized Education

It's about time! Kids are chomping at the bit to get this app in their hands. Imagine an app that automatically tracks the student's achievements (not just grades, but also study time, how much they've learned, etc.), and instantly rewards them each week with micro-scholarships (cash & gift cards) right to their phone. The more the student learns, the more they earn. It's that simple. The results are higher grades, increased confidence, smarter students, and a more productive world. 



The Core Problem

Motivation is the crucial ingredient that unleashes productivity in all humans. Unfortunately if a student is not motivated to learn, they will never reach their highest potential. In other words, there is an underlying core problem in education which needs to be addressed. It's motivation! When this issue is resolved, students thrive abundantly.


The Solution

The Incentify app inspires students to want to learn, by utilizing weekly micro-scholarships which draws out the student's highest quality learning performance. 

The student's educational achievements are tracked and automatically awarded to their mobile wallet, providing the student with instant gratification.  They keep coming back for more and more and more!


Results

Incentify is a conduit for education dollars to be spent on what matters the most: Results! Our technology ushers in a much needed "results based education", where no money is transacted until the student has performed.  In other words we only pay for achievement!  No waste occurs here, only phenomenal results. We like to think of Incentify as "The Cure For The Common Core" by assisting students, teachers, schools, and the nation & world as a whole, with helpful education tools to bring up grades & performance.  


Who Pays the Students?

Corporations, foundations, government, and schools are already handing out scholarship money to incentivize and promote education.  Incentify automatically connects students to these and many other benefactors, which radically inspires them to learn.  Important to note: Neither the student or parents have to apply for the micro-scholarships; Incentify manages and rewards them automatically based on the student's performance!  Of course mom's & dads, aunts & uncles, and grandparents are encouraged to incentivize the students as well.  

Instead of games, texting, and social media, their mobile phones will be used for learning!

Social Family Network

Incentify is bringing the family back together again by providing a social family aspect like no other app.  Local and distant family members use the app to encourage and cheer-on their loved ones, helping them reach their highest potential.

Studies show that active, adult family member involvement in a child's education is vital to that child's development and learning. The Incentify app is the essential family hub needed to nurture each child's education. Together we will bring out every child's inner Einstein!


The World's Greatest Education Content

Incentify links students to the top education apps and e-Learning websites, for FREE. Quality learning content is essential to a student's ultimate success. We supercharge those apps with our A.I. (Artificial Intelligence) learning systems to provide a tailored learning experience that matches each student's abilities & need.


Automatic Achievement Tracking

Incentify automatically tracks each student's achievement milestones, using the  advanced e-learning apps, to trigger the weekly release of their incentive rewards. Everything is tracked, including semester grades, test scores, extra weekly study time, eLearning, mobile learning apps, micro-learning blasts, etc. Little Einsteins are all around us, we just need to motivate them to exercise all of their mind's potential!  


Our Mission

Education is the solution that lifts people out of poverty. 

"Give a man a fish and you feed him for a day. Teach a man to fish and you feed him for a lifetime." - Lao Tzu (601-531 BC)

Incentify is donating more than ten percent of it's revenues, and implementing vital partnerships with corporations and foundations to deliver new & recycled mobile learning devices to students in developing world, as well as WiFi download hubs to retrieve their free education apps & weekly study materials. Additionally we are providing incentive cash to keep these children motivated and fed. A few dollars a week in incentive cash goes a long way to help each struggling family. Your participation empowers the world one child at a time, with residual & generational impact.


Status of Development

We have completed 75% of our development phase. This is a WINNING campaign to back, and the most VALUABLE to society! We are on the cusp of rolling out the most radically innovative education technology that has ever impacted the world.  We need your help to push us over the edge. Indiegogo backers (and their student family members) will be the first in the world to benefit from this ultra-motivating, advanced technology.


Our Development Timeline

We have covered a lot of ground on our own, completing most of the heavy lifting. Now we need your help to finalize the last bits of development to get the Incentify app into the hands of your family members, as well as those in need throughout the world. Incentify is a worthwhile project to back!  


How Your Contribution Will Be Spent:

Your monetary contribution to the Incentify technology will be appropriated and accounted towards development and completion of the Incentify app, while adhering to our development timeline and objectives, to deliver the most radical app into your hands and those you love, and those you desire to give the gift of learning to.  Your investment will impact the world for generations to come.


Team

Incentify is being developed by a high level team of executives, engineers, developers and advisors who come from major enterprise technology corporations. (many need to remain anonymous due to their current employment)


Perks

The most valuable perk is the satisfaction of giving the gift of education to the world. Your donation will make the world a better place, bringing smiles to faces in need.  We also have some unique and cool personalized perks to show off your support with.  Each Incentify backer is assigned a sequential founder ID # that is printed on the customized perks (excluding t-shirt & travel mug).  Keep this in mind: The Incentify technology is breaking new ground with a seriously disruptive technology


International Media Coverage

Incentify is certain to attract the media's attention around the world, due to it's newsworthy first-of-a-kind innovation in the education technology sector, as well as it's radically potential impact upon millions of students worldwide.  Indiegogo visionaries (backers) will be recognized & proudly displayed by Incentify as the champions of education who've endeavored to change the world. Your name will forever be associated with Incentify in the website, software credits, and even in our customized perks you choose, which you can proudly display in your office or home.


Three Reasons to Back Incentify:

1) Our cause is awesome!
2) Our technology is revolutionary.
3) Together we will impact the world for generations to come.
To be an Indiegogo visionary, make your donation to the campaign today!

In a Nutshell...

Students download the free Incentify accelerated learning app, then begin studying using the world's top e-Learning apps for free, like Khan Academy. Incentify tracks all of the student's learning progress in order release their pending rewards. Multiple benefactors comprised of corporations, foundations and family members provide cash and gift-card micro-scholarships, deposited directly into the app, for the student to go and spend (just like the Starbucks app). The net effect is students become ultra-motivated to study more, resulting in higher grades and measurably smarter people on the planet!

Back this technology to give your children, grandchildren, nieces & nephews, and every child in need, the opportunity to grow smarter, faster.


Furthermore...

You will be impacting millions of students worldwide to become little Einsteins.  Imagine what a couple dollars a week will do for a child in an impoverished country, and the positive impact that will have on their life.  Not only will their bellies be full, but they will also garner the skills and abilities necessary to lift themselves out of poverty; creating a much more productive world.

If there were ever a campaign, and cause, worthy of backing, Incentify is it!       - Patrick Leddy, CEO of Incentify


...The New Cool!

We make studying the new cool. Students can't wait to learn & earn cash rewards through the Incentify app! Indiegogo visionaries like you, will make it a reality.  

Please visit us at incentifyed.com for more information about Incentify.

For media inquiries contact patrick@incentifyed.com

For investor inquiries contact colin@incentifyed.com

story:
Subversive Festival: Create Freedom

"Muscles are surer than prayers to us!
We won’t pray for aid any more!
We - Each one of us -
Holds in his grasp
The driving reins of the world!"

About us

Subversive Festival is a unique platform where theory and activism converge, where dialogue is established, and where pluralism and a critical approach to society are fostered. Within our conference and film programs, during nine years of our existence, we have hosted contemporary intellectuals such as Oliver Stone, Slavoj Žižek, Terry Eagleton, Yanis Varoufakis, Tariq Ali, Gayatri Spivak and many others.

This year's Festival will take place 1 - 16 May 2016, in Europa Cinema, Tuškanac Cinema and MM Center, Zagreb, Croatia.

subversivefestival.com

Subversive festival (YouTube channel)

CALL TO ACTION!


INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE

Since its foundation eight years ago, the International Conference within the Subversive Festival has soon become an unavoidable place for critical theory not only in Croatia and wider East European region, but also worldwide. Zagreb has become a traditional meeting point for leading philosophers, economists, theorists and feminists from around the globe, such as Slavoj Žižek, Gayatri Spivak, Chantal Mouffe, Tariq Ali, Zygmunt Bauman, David Harvey, Antonio Negri, Michael Hardt, Gianni Vattimo, Renata Salecl and many others. The Large Hall in Cinema Europe is often too small to accommodate the whole of the interested public, while we get extensive news coverage in regional, but also European media of lectures and discussions taking place in Zagreb. In the first three years the conference was dedicated to different anniversaries (’68, the Chinese Cultural Revolution, the Non-Aligned Movement), while the last five festival editions (2011-2015) covered contemporary themes such as the Arab Spring and the Future of Europe and have hosted the architect Remo Koolhaas, economists Yanis Varoufakis, Costas Lapavitsas, and Steve Keen, the theorists Naomi Klein and Judith Butler, the anthropologist David Graeber, the green activist Vandana Shiva, LGBT pioneer Boris Dittrich and many others. The topics which the conference covers year after year include the defence of the commons, workers' solidarity, the idea of Europe, heterodox economy, intercultural bonds, green economy etc. 

SUBVERSIVE FORUM

Subversive Forum is the activist part of the Subversive Festival, fostering discussion and debate, which complements the International Conference. While the conference takes place in the evening, in the form of keynote lectures or round tables, the idea behind Subversive Forum is to provide space for dynamic discussion with the audience, and not only between speakers. With the average attendance of 70-150 visitors per debate, and being the Festival's „youngest child“, Subversive Forum has in a very short time become a platform for theory and activism recognised by the World Social Forum. Moreover, Subversive Forum is involved with other European mobilisation fronts such as the European Altersummit or Firenza 10 + 10. It has also established partnerships and long-term collaboration with the European Transform Network for alternative thinking and political dialogue, CADTM (Committee for the Abolition of the Third World Debt), Eurozine (the network of 80 European magazines), Rosa Luxemburg Stiftung, Heinrich Böll Stiftung and other active participants conceptualizing the program, panels and debates. One of the most important parts of Subversive Forum is Balkan Forum, which gathers 40 different organizations from the Balkans. As from this year, we have also launched the Mediterranean Forum which will deal with the important topics of the region.




Subversive Film Festival

Since its foundation in 2008, Subversive Film Festival has proven to be an interdisciplinary, hypertextual and political attempt at demystification of visual taboos, analysing the most powerful art forms of today and criticising the existing value system and institutions in the context of science, philosophy and modern art. Within the Film Festival we have screened hundreds of activist and artistic feature, documentary and short films, as well as masterpieces by renowned film directors.



WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET

This year's festival runs under the topic of Politics of Friendship, and in order to keep it going, we need your help. This is because Subversive Festival doesn't work with sponsors, but is dependent on The City of Zagreb and Croatian Ministry of Culture's financial support, which was severely cut this year not only for our festival, but for other civil and activist non-profit organizations and associations as well, due to the change in political paradigm. We have thus decided to show it will not stop us from holding the 9th edition of the festival, uniting with other solidary individuals and associations, and keeping the festival going. 

Help us reach the goal of $9,000 to make Subversive Festival take place this year in its largely free admission form, despite the deep cuts in funding by the city and state institutions. 

The raised money will cover venue fees, travel and accommodation costs for our visiting lecturers, the building and maintenance of the festival website, printing and marketing expenses, and other operating costs.

In return, besides knowing you supported a worthy cause, we've prepared these thank you treats for our contributors: a film festival pass, meeting our guests, dinner with our keynote speakers... Some of these are available only during the Festival, ie. 1 -  16 May 2016, so hurry up!

*If you don't feel like choosing a perk, you can define the sum yourself and donate :)

Or donate directly to the White Wave Association's account (Ilca 203A, 10000 Zagreb, Zagreba?ka banka): HR3923600001101515081 (state it's “for crowdfunding”).



Follow Subversive Festival on Facebook and Twitter!

story:
La Fe Model of United Nations (siglas en inglés) surge en el año 2013 ante la inquietud de un grupo de jóvenes cursantes del 5to año de bachillerato (11vo Grado) de formar un modelo interno, que hasta ese momento no existía.

En el año 2014 se conforma el SENIOR STAFF de LAFEMUN, en conjunto con clases de entrenamiento para delegados y se conforma la I EDICIÓN como un modelo interno. Para el año 2015, la II EDICIÓN pasa a ser un modelo abierto a todas las instituciones del estado Carabobo, contando con 2 comités y una participación de más de 100 delegados.

En el año que transcurre, se celebrará la III EDICIÓN del modelo, tras la dedicación de los jóvenes se ha expandido nuestra delegación a 30 visitando otros modelos, cosechando grandes logros. LAFEMUN 2016 contará con 5 comités y una participación estimada de 250 delegados, observadores y faculties, demostrando el constante crecimiento de este proyecto que busca alcanzar los más altos niveles en la región.

Se cree oportuno explicarles en que consiste este Modelo, a los efectos de que conociendo los beneficios que esta iniciativa proporciona a la formación de nosotros los jóvenes venezolanos, empeñados en la búsqueda de una mejor Venezuela, puedan ustedes, colaboradores contribuir con un evento educacional y de preparación de una juventud pujante y decidida en un país donde lastimosamente se ha perdido la esperanza.

Pues bien, el MODELO DE NACIONES UNIDAS DEL COLEGIO LA FE (LAFEMUN) consiste en una simulación de la Organización de las Naciones Unidas, con la representación diplomática de diferentes miembro de dicha Organización (ONU), cuyas delegaciones estarían conformadas por estudiantes de diferentes Colegios de la zona, quienes durante los tres días del referido evento tratarán diferentes tópicos de economía, política y cultura en general; con el objetivo de debatir entre ellos para llegar a soluciones positivas de los conflictos, logrando así que los jóvenes participantes puedan investigar previamente sobre esos diferentes temas a tratar y luego defender sus posiciones, dentro del marco de la tolerancia y respeto. Esta actividad nos deja grandes enseñanzas y nos fortalece de manera extraordinaria en nuestra formación como el futuro de nuestro país.

Uno de los factores más importantes y una de las que más nos diferencian del resto de Modelos de Naciones Unidas, es nuestra preocupación por nuestras instalaciones y la gente que hace vida en el mismo, incluyéndonos a todos los estudiantes. LAFEMUN 2016 ante un cambio en su metodología, en sus planes está retribuir en obras tanto de caridad como en físico a nuestro colegio, donde debido a la situación del país hay grandes carencias y deficiencias en los servicios.

Entre nuestra primordial obra caritativa, se encuentra la recuperación del área de descanso de más de 10 trabajadores de limpieza y mantenimiento de nuestro colegio que se encuentran en una precaria situación, sumado a la compra de una pizarra acrílica, pinturas para retocar paredes y reparación, compra y mantenimiento de las mesas y pupitres de estudio de más de 700 alumnos.

Ayudarnos a hacer este sueño realidad sería una colaboración muy grande a la formación de jóvenes venezolanos, además de apoyar un evento educacional de alto nivel preocupado por las personas que han hecho posible esto.

un modelo interno. Para
el año 2015, la II EDICIÓN pasa a ser un modelo abierto a todas las instituciones del estado Carabobo,
contando con 2 comités y una participación de más de 100 delegados.
En
el año que transcurre, se celebrará la III EDICIÓN del
modelo, tras la dedicación de los jóvenes se ha expandido nuestra delegación a 30
visitando otros modelos, cosechando grandes logros. LAFEMUN
2016 contará
con 5 comités y una participación estimada de 250
delegados, observadores y faculties, demostrando el constante crecimiento de este proyecto que busca alcanzar los
más altos niveles en la región.Se cree oportuno
explicarles en que consiste este Modelo, a los efectos de que conociendo los
beneficios que esta iniciativa proporciona a la formación de nosotros los
jóvenes venezolanos, empeñados en la búsqueda de una mejor Venezuela, puedan ustedes, colaboradores contribuir con un evento educacional y de preparación de una juventud pujante y decidida en un país donde lastimosamente se ha perdido la esperanza.
Pues
bien, el MODELO DE NACIONES UNIDAS DEL
COLEGIO LA FE (LAFEMUN) consiste en una simulación de la Organización de las Naciones Unidas,
con la representación diplomática de diferentes miembro de dicha Organización
(ONU), cuyas delegaciones estarían conformadas por estudiantes de diferentes
Colegios de la zona, quienes durante los tres días del referido evento tratarán
diferentes tópicos de economía, política y cultura en general; con el objetivo
de debatir entre ellos para llegar a soluciones positivas de los conflictos,
logrando así que los jóvenes participantes puedan investigar previamente sobre
esos diferentes temas a tratar y luego defender sus posiciones, dentro del
marco de la tolerancia y respeto. Esta actividad nos deja grandes enseñanzas y
nos fortalece de manera extraordinaria en nuestra formación como el futuro de
nuestro país.Uno de los factores más importantes y una de las que más nos diferencian del resto de Modelos de Naciones Unidas, es nuestra preocupación por nuestras instalaciones y la gente que hace vida en el mismo, incluyéndonos a todos los estudiantes. LAFEMUN 2016 ante un cambio en su metodología, en sus planes está retribuir en obras tanto de caridad como en físico a nuestro colegio, donde debido a la situación del país hay grandes carencias y deficiencias en los servicios.Entre nuestra primordial obra caritativa, se encuentra la recuperación del área de descanso de más de 10 trabajadores de limpieza y mantenimiento de nuestro colegio que se encuentran en una precaria situación, sumado a la compra de una pizarra acrílica, pinturas para retocar paredes y reparación, compra y mantenimiento de las mesas y pupitres de estudio de más de 700 alumnos.Ayudarnos a hacer este sueño realidad sería una colaboración muy grande a la formación de jóvenes venezolanos, además de apoyar un evento educacional de alto nivel preocupado por las personas que han hecho posible esto.

story:
Presidential Candidate in Somalia

Yassin Mahi Mallin 2016
YOUR EFFORTS MAKE DIFFERENCE

My name is Yassin Mahi and would like to thank all my follow friends for their support and endorsement to run for president in the upcoming election in 2016.

Having observed the hostile political situation in Somalia over the last two decade, I engaged actively in a political campaign to enhance democratic process in Somalia.

My vision is to find suitable solution to eradicate the self-destructive culture of tribalism in our nation, which will be a pragmatic and continuous process.

I encourage you, for the sake of a prosperous Somalia, to engage actively in our campaign and contribute to the success of our candidate. By doing this you contribute to a clan-free, safe and democratic Somalia.

How to become a sponsor

Welcome as a sponsor of my presidential campaign. I run the campaign on a voluntary basis and need all the support I can get to make changes for the future of Somalia.

Our aim is to reach 300 individuals who can support us financially $100 by 31 July.
Pleas you can donate $1, $5, $10, $25, etc US dollar. This is how you can support us financially.

You can also choose a perk to get an inspirational message, receive Book, and certificate signed by me, You will also receive a personal call by me, the Presidential Candidate.

The Impact

our campaign  is about to work rescue and development of Somali people from bad circumstance by promoting Democracy , improving humanitarian needs and  their livelihoods, protecting human rights, and fighting against ignorance and discrimination,  through Openness, Honesty & Integrity and Cooperation, Collaborating and Communicating

Openness, Honesty & Integrity- we can obtain our political campaigns if everyone is to be open and honest with each other, be committed, be courageous, and be resilient.

Cooperation, Collaborating and Communicating - it is very important to us the contribution of the people in our community, their desire to help  and share information and ideas.

Risks & Challenges

It is very clear that serving in Somalia will not be easy.  There will be challenges and obstacles.  But when there is a problem there is a solution

Serving Somali community indefinitely comes with challenges like security challenges, Political disputes, road blocks, less resource, and frustration. There are political and economic domination.  There are many mindsets that avoid change.  There are many ineffective and inefficient procedures and processes. 

To solve these problems We have planned to requesting help from the community!  There may appear to be a lack of resources but there is no lack of will in our community which may help us go above and beyond what we think is possible.  There may appear to be a lack of money but there is no lack of people willing to collaborate.  There may appear to be a roadblock in the path forward but through communication we can find people on the other side of the road block to guide us around.  There may appear to be a political disputes but we can solve our disputes through reconciliaction and mediation. There may appear to be a security challenges in but through collaborating  with security men they can secure our security 

Other Ways You Can Help

You can contribute in many ways!

  • If you can't financially contribute, you can share this video!
  • If you can't share this video, you can spread the word to your family and friends!
  • If you feel inspired, make your own video to encourage others to join our campaign for change

AF-Somali

Aniga magaceeyga waxaa la yiraahdaa Yaasiin Maaxi Macalin waxaan ahay musharax madaxaweynaha dawlada federalka Soomaliya doorashada soo socoto sep 2016.

Waxa aan go`aansaday In aan safka hore aan u is taago si aan ugu qayb qaato sidii loo heli lahaa Midnimo Soomaaliyeed.

Insha Alaah waxaan si hagar la’aan ah u balan qaadayaa dhisida bulsho aaminsan horumar sinaan cadaalad, midnimo iyo ciribtirka qabyalada.  waxaan kaa codsanayaa inaad taageerto sidii Soomaaliya aay horumar iyo barwaaqo ugaari lahayd.

Sidaas awadeed tartanka doorashadaan 2016 waxaan u galayaa si mutadawacnimo ah ama Voluntery ah hadaba waxaan taageeroyaasheeyda ka codsanayaa in midkiiba igu taageero dhaqaaale ah $1, $5, $25, $40, sidaas waxaan ku gaari karnaa Himilada aan Hiigsanaayno 2016.

Hadafkeenu wuu yahay inaan 300 qof oo taageerayaasheeyda ah igu taageeraan qofkiiba 100 doolar.

Waxaa sidoo kale dooran kartaa dhaqalaha qaaska ah adiga oo helaayo  Email, shahaado sharaf, Buug, ama aad musharaxa madaxweynaha oo taleefoon qaas ah kuu soo dir si uu kaaga mahad celiyo tageeradaada Mahadsanid. Qofka soomaaliya jooga aanan haysan hab uu u soo diro wuxuu ku soo diri karaa Harmuud telefonnr. +25261 771 20 08.

Waxaa jira dariiqyo kala duwan oo aad nagu caawini karto: hadii ay noqon lahayd, in qaarkeen mutatawacnimo kaga qayb qaadano, qaar kalen waxay ololohood kaga qayb qaadan karaan ayaga oo faafiya websidka ama Vidiowga.

Mahadsanidiin.

story:
Who Are We?
The Florida Paddling Trails Association (FPTA) was established in 2007 as a 501 (c)(3) non-profit organization dedicated to the stewardship of Florida's paddling trails.  Our mission is to be a resource and voice for paddlers, to develop water trails, and to protect the environment.  In our recently updated strategic plan, one of our goals is to make FPTA a resource for partner-based youth education,

Project Introduction

Few things in life are more memorable than our first trip floating down the shady corridor of a twisting river or skimming along a sunny coastline. Many of us equate our first significant experience in the outdoors with the first time we dipped a paddle, hoisted a sail, or connected with flowing water as children. And we feel gratitude towards those who led us there and helped kindle a life-long relationship with nature.  Many of us who are fortunate to have had these experiences feel a need to reach out and share similar opportunities with younger generations. One way to share your passion for paddling with young paddlers of the future is by supporting the Florida Paddling Trails Association’s Legacy Fund Initiative.

What We Need                                                                                                  

We need your donations to help fund summer paddling camp scholarships for needy kids in Florida.  FPTA has identified three outfitters with established youth paddling programs in the Jacksonville, Miami/Keys, and Indian River areas.  Most of the summer camps last 5 days, approximately 8 hours per day, and take 10-12 students per session. Students are drawn from the outfitters' local communities.

The Impact

Combining grant monies with the donations we raise, we want to support scholarships for up to 40 students. These would be 40 students who are not inside watching television or computer screens; who are outside for at least one week of the summer, learning about the natural environment along their regional waterways while paddling. Forty students who, 20-30 years from now, may be scientists, teachers, legislators, lawyers, and certainly voters who pay attention to Florida’s waterways and are willing to fight to protect them because one time they were given the opportunity to attend a paddling camp when they were young. 

Call to Action

We value your contributions, no matter what you can give!  Please make a tax deductible donation online through our Indiegogo campaign today.  Or if you prefer to handle things via snail mail, please make your check payable to the FPTA and note Legacy Fund in the lower left corner.  Send it to: Florida Paddling Trails Association, PO Box 142082, Gainesville, FL 32614.  Time is of the essence since summer is right around the corner and camps will be starting soon.  Please make your contribution no later than May 31st.  

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you're not in a position to make a donation yourself, please share our project campaign with your paddling friends and family who might be interested.  Together we can help create the next generation of Florida's water stewards!

story:
The Magic Cool Bus

We (Beth and Jurgen - lovers and friends - dreamers and activists) will be travelling Africa in our self-renovated VW camper van spreading information, education and inspiration on; 

  • Sustainable living and permaculture farming
  • Circular economy and technologies 
  • Minimizing waste, recycling and up-cycling
  • Harvesting, cleansing and recycling water
  • Alternative, natural energy sources
  • Earthship building (free, efficient housing solutions)
  • Alternatives to plastic and destructive chemicals
  • Local economy and independent community development 
  • Free workshops on all the above as well as; art, drama, movement, yoga, meditation,  and breathwork with the focus on self-realization and motivation 

We will also be producing an amazing theatre production (that transcends language barriers) to the express the importance of inter-connectivity.

 The wheels on the bus...

Our baby is a VW LT28 Westfalia style camper van. We will be using it as model for off the grid, sustainable living. It will be our portable home, classroom, theatre stage, library and workshop.

The funding will be going towards;

  • Diesel for the van (The more we get, the further we go!)
  • Mechanical maintenance and spare parts
  • New set of wheels capable of traversing the diverse landscapes
  • Solar panels, wind turbine and fog harvester
  • Visas, insurance, translators/guides, toll gates and other travel expenses
  • Medications, vaccinations and first aid
  • Workshop materials and hardware
  • Props and costumes for a fully portable theatre show

Please look at our list at below for specific items that we need, that can also be gifted.

Whether or not we reach our funding goal, we will be embarking on this journey, trusting that we will be provided for. We will be furthering our journey by hunting, fishing and foraging, as well as trading various skills and crafts along the way.

Check out our wild perks from under the African skies...

The Impact!

After years of experimenting, attending workshops/events ourselves and especially thanks to the internet – we now have an abundance of information on how to use what is available to live more sustainably and more efficiently. We want to share this with our fellow Africans who may never hear about it otherwise.

Africa can be a thriving paradise once again, let’s be the ripple effect. Each one teach one! 

Risky business

Africa can be a rough place. Yes, there are pirates, marauders, rebels and warmongers. The landscapes can be challenging and cultural barriers will sometimes be difficult to overcome. This will by no means be an easy endeavor - and that is why we deserve your funding.

What we bring to the table is our courage, knowledge, skills and the willingness to go the extra mile (or 10000).

Our wish list

For the van:

  • Tyres
  • New windshield
  • Jerry cans
  • Alarm system
  • Cam belt, tapid gasket cover, diesel injection belt and diesel pump seal
  • Solar panel – convertor and battery
  • Fog harvester

Contact us for part specification numbers.

For survival:

  • Hunting knives, compound bow and arrows
  • Straight razor
  • Waterproof hiking boots, thermal jackets and other useful
  • Magnesium flint stick
  • Wood carving tools
  • Leather, wax string, glue, Pratley’s putty (making crafts for trading)

For the journey:

  • Offer us a place to; park off for the night, trade our skills and crafts or to do a workshop and/or our theatre performance
  • Tell us about a place we have to see or someone we have to connect with

Support, share and follow our journey

Instagram: www.instagram.com/moyomti/

Facebook: www.facebook.com/Moyomti-102136546620974/

www.moyomti.com – coming soon!

Contact us on: moyomti@gmail.com

Everything can be recycled, all processes can be in harmony with nature, all energy generated from the elements and all enterprises can be for the greater good of man, animal and plant kingdoms.

The dawning of a new day. The Golden Age!

story:
Our History

  • We are a fiscally sponsored project of the San Francisco Filipino Cultural Center, a non-profit 501c3. Your donation (if from the US) is tax deductible.
  • Since 2008, Returning Wave has been recycling your old surfboards so kids in the Philippines can have free access as incentive for staying in school.
  • The generosity of our California surf community has kept us with a steady influx of surfboard donations. We host surfboard repair and packing parties to get these boards fixed/boxed up & ready to be shipped out.
  • By donating as little as $40, you can help 1 surfboard reach the Philippines so a kid can be riding the waves at their home break and achieving success in school.

What We Need

  • There are 25 surfboards ready to be shipped out in San Francisco = $1000
  • 25 more boards await shipment from a generous donor in Malibu = $1000
  • Because of the extra length, each longboard costs approximately $65 to ship, we have 15 ready to ship = $1000

The Impact

  • Instead of old surfboards going to landfill, they are empowering youth who will be enjoying the healthy sport of surfing while improving their performance in school.
  • Since 2008, we have shipped out 100+ surfboards to the Philippines and introduced the sport of surfing to 400+ youth at 7 different locations
  • Your contribution will help us get more kids in the water having fun!

How We Operate

We've had the fortune from individual donors to recycle so many surfboards for kids to re-use. The quiver is kept under the care of a local surfer who organizes borrowing time for the kids while checking their school attendance from the local teachers. Being an all volunteer grassroots org, 100% of your donation in this campaign is going towards the shipment of surfboards.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you aren't able to contribute, please help us by spreading the link and re-posting to reach your circle of community.

    Read more about us here http://returningwave.org

story:
Have a professional pinball machine in your home for only 1,200 Dollars and build your own scenario.

My name is Jonerlam.

I am graduated in industrial automation and work designing industrial machinery for over 12 years. I can say that pinball machines are one of the great inventions that have led me into the field of mechatronics. They are amazing!

These machines bring together all technologies: Mechanics, Electrics, Electronics and Programming.

Beyond that pinball joins technology with art.

Each scenario tells a story. And it is this magic that I want to share with you. We will develop pinball machines with many playing fields and you will create your story with 3D model, collections, and plastic models.

Further, you will be able to add sound effects and score images. Each pinball will be unique just like your creativity!


The funding

We need 50,000.00 dollars to develop the entire production chain. The funding will cover all expenses on molds, machinery and technical staff.

Initially, we will develop three game themes: Heroes, Cars and Airplanes.

Each theme will comprise a set of stickers for applying on the playing fields and on the sides of the pinball machine. Of course, if you wish, you can even make up your own stickers and drawings for a variety of themes. We would support such initiative with prizes!


The developed pinball machine will be a professional machine, with proper dimensions and professional components such as: slingshot, bumper, flipper, ball shooter, etc.

The funding will help us develop a professional machine.

If you are a programmer, we have yet another surprise: Raspberrypi will be responsible for controlling the entire game logic.

With HDMI output e 1080p resolution, this platform has got all we need. The Python code will be provided. Feel free to modify it as you wish.

PERKS T-SHIRT



Pinball Models Features

Dimension:

  • Cabinet - 560 x 400/600 x 1300 (mm)
  • Playfield - 541 x 1300 (mm)

Minimal Parts Playing Fields:

  • 60x Outputs (actuators-lamps/coils)
  • 30x Inputs (sensors-contacts)
  • 1x Ball Shooter
  • 2x Flipper
  • 1x Ball Trough
  • 3x Ball
  • 2x Bumper
  • 2x Slingshot
  • 2x Wire Ramp

Video/Audio Output

HD 1080p video
Composite video (PAL/NTSC) output
HDMI 1.3 & 1.4 video/audio socket
3.5mm 4-pole audio/composite video out jack socket

Risks & Challenges

Our experience in manufacturing industrial machinery provides us with confidence when developing the project, since we have to deal with many technical responsibilities in the scope of technical automation:

·  Ergonomics

·  Safety

·  Ease of assembly

·  Ease of transportation

·  Ease in cleaning

·  Durability

·  Reproducibility

·  Low maintenance

·  Test routines for quick identification of defects

·  Connections and devices identification

·  Replacement parts

In addition to having experience in manufacturing complex machines, the staff is also experienced in using suitable computer tools such as: 3D modeling software, software for electrical schemes and documentation, software for programming microcontrollers, software for manufacturing printed circuit boards.

Developing machines for the entertainment field will be our challenge!

Timeline

Team

Other Ways You Can Help

Did you find the project interesting but cannot contribute to the funding of the campaign?

Then help us spread the word!

Show our project to your friends and family. Tell everybody about the project on Indiegogo!

Our goal is to bring forth a great community of enthusiasts... pinball, action figures, plastic models, technology, programming, and cooperation enthusiasts!

story:
Just as we teach our children about road safety and water safety, teaching them about body safety is important, especially our little ones who just want to be good and do what the 'big person' says. But, how does one put across a topic like this to them? 

Children love to hear stories, right? What better way to do so than through storytelling?

Following research and discussions with counselors and parents, this interactive storybook app ”Dancing Spiders," is being created to enlighten children about inappropriate touch and to alert them to a danger point - like refusing to go with a stranger who offers to show the child something attractive. It is a simple, non-threatening storybook app but the knowledge a child gains from it is very powerful. This knowledge just may prevent a child from a lifetime of trauma. 


Message within an enchanting story

Dancing Spiders will deliver a magical experience with touch-triggered animation, narration, music and sounds for young readers. 

The story is fun and engaging; it is set in a magical forest where a group of children play and mingle with their magical friends and creatures. One of the children is lured away from his friends. The interactivity of the app empowers the reader to think about the situation in the shoes of the character and decide which path to take to progress with the story - like saying “no” to touching that makes him uncomfortable. 

The book has been written and illustrated in a way that is neither frightening nor confrontational. To address the sensitivity of the topic, the creators use magical creatures in the story and yet, convey the message. Like have you seen a magical horse grazing in the forest? :)

The illustrator has cleverly worked around the difficult parts in order to make the app wholesome and suitable for young children. There is nothing in the book that is scary to the child, because nothing is explicit, Check out the sneak peek of a section of the app below.

Features

  • Touch-triggered animation
  • Narration, music and sounds 
  • Readers will have the option to take them through the story, or read the story themselves.

PLUS  ....  

The storybook app helps the readers to develop thinking skills.  The reader has to make a decision in the shoes of the character to handle a danger point in the story. The reader will have two options to choose from. How the story turns out depends on the decision taken. This allows the reader to understand the consequence of each of the decision, and hence, the sensible action to take. It reinforces learning. 




The app can be downloaded on the Apple app store and Google Play. It’s a must for parents, doting uncles and aunties, schools, childcare givers … Or anyone who wants to help kids live smart. 

Knowledge is powerful and to be forewarned is forearmed.


Plus, Plus ....

The creators have sneaked a little interactive game into the storybook app too.. so that reading can be more enjoyable!


UPDATE!

We have added a new Early Bird Special perk. For only $3 - You will enjoy your Dancing Spiders app at a special price before anyone else!


We need your support to bring this entertaining and interactive storybook app to life. 





Every contribution helps in getting this storybook app out to help young children.

The funds will be required for professional copy-editing, illustration, artwork, narration, voice over talents, recording, rental of recording studio, animation and programming to produce the English-language version of this app. 

(A stretch goal will be to print this book to benefit more children, especially those who do not have a mobile device.)

We hope to attract not just support and funding, but like-minded adults to come forward to share our passion to help children pick up life skills, share their stories and be involved in future book projects. 


We'd like to reach out to you to help our children 'live smart'. If this book helps a child and from being scarred psychologically, we'll have one more happy child among us. 

Join in to help our kids live smart. Thank you!


The Perks!


Please share this project with friends and family. 

Facebook: Dancing Spiders Facebook Page

Twitter: livesmart @DancingSpiders

#helpkidslivesmart #dancingspiders


The story has been written, the characters created and their reference models for animation completed. We only need to complete the sound recording, narration, and the programming of the app.

We anticipate that the storybook app will be ready in 4 weeks after campaign completion.

If there are production delays, we will let our backers know!


   Feel free to contact us at helpkidslivesmart@gmail.com with any questions or        feedback. We'll do our best to respond within 3 business days.

   You can also help by sharing these links on your blog, social media account or             personal website:

    Website.      Indiegogo Campaign.      Facebook.       Twitter.     Google+.

    Hashtags: #helpkidslivesmart #kidslivesmart #livesmart #dancingspiders

story:
Imagine this: you're walking down the street in your neighborhood. Its a sunny day, the birds are chirping, the squirrels are chattering & the narrative in your mind is running something like this, "Wow, look at how nicely that skullcap is growing; its been such a great year for dandelion; can't wait to come back & collect those cleavers!" How connected & empowered do you feel?


All of these plants are ones we can find in our urban environments that are not only potential sources of food but of medicine. We Take Care! will be offering homeless & low-income children a chance to experience the world from a place of empowerment & understanding as they learn how they can support the health of themselves & their families through easily accessible, affordable means. 


The weekly, month long gardening program will be for children enrolled at Ephesians Childrens Center, a non-profit day care that has been serving some of Berkeley's most vulnerable residents for 40 years. The program will be taught by Spiral Gardens, a non-profit food justice farm & nursery also located in Berkeley, and coordinated by Moon Wise Counseling & Life Hacking, which offers low cost life counseling & workshop facilitation to promote resiliency & support people living in oppressive circumstances. 

By participating in the program, gaining hands on experience with the identification & care of plants, children will be able to:

- understand the life of plants & how plants fit into the larger planetary life cycle,

- care for a plant, 

- identify which plants are food, which plants are medicine & how to find these plants in their environments. 

The children will also be able to visit the Spiral Gardens Community Food Security Project where they will be able to learn about urban farming. The Spiral Gardens facility includes a working garden, chicken & duck coop, greenhouse & a nursery.

The program will culminate in a planting day celebration & the creation of “ I Can Take Care of Myself!” kits for the children to share with their families for the treatment of common minor ailments such as colds, congestion, muscle cramps, stress, cuts & scrapes. All kits will be filled with plants the children learned about during the program, harvested from the Spiral Gardens or wild crafted from nature walks throughout the Bay Area. 

Parents, as well as other immediate family members, are highly encouraged participate in this program as they are able. 


What We Need & What You Get

We need:

- containers for I Can Take Care of Myself! kits

- pouches for travel I Can Take Care of Myself! kits

- planters

- children's gardening gloves

- personnel expenses

- Planting Day Celebration supplies

- soil

- transportation costs

All funds raised will go directly towards providing the children with tools & access necessary for them to create substantial self-care kits & to support the Planting Day Celebration. 

As an expression of our gratitude for your contribution we will be offering a variety of perks ranging from Thank-You cards based on the children's artwork, or your very own I Can Take Care of Myself! kit for you & your family, to an invitation to a special dinner prepared with foods straight from the garden! 

IndieGogo currently only provides credit card transactions for 501(c)3 organizations, but there are other ways to donate. If you would like to donate with PayPal you can send a transfer to: jihan.mcdonald@gmail.com. You can also send a check or money order to: 

Ephesians Childrens Center

P.O. Box 3215

Berkeley, CA 94703


The Impact

Ephesians Child Care Center has been providing quality child care free of charge for homeless & low-income families in Berkeley for 40 years. This place has become an institution in the community & has been an unceasing advocate for the right of all people to have access to the quality services they need to sustain a healthy life for themselves & their families. 

Spiral Gardens Community Food Security Project was created in two vacant lots that lie along the old Santa Fe Railroad line and has served as not only a nursery & farm, but a learning center & community resource that has introduced a bounty of organizations & individuals to the potential of urban gardening & farming. 

Moon Wise Counseling & Life Hacking serves marginalized communities and offers resources for healing while increasing essential life competencies, such as increasing awareness of our reality as Earth-based creatures. All of these organizations provide unique & valuable contributions to communities that are traditionally systemically neglected. 

Together these potent organizations will provide children in difficult circumstances with an invaluable opportunity to learn about:

- how to recognize beneficial plants in their natural, urban environments

- how to use these plants for food & medicine

- how to care for these plants to sustain their personal health & the health of their families & communities.

Using this information, they will then be able to share with their families & friends outside of the program, serving as seeds themselves, to spread this knowledge through communities in need of accessible & affordable forms of self care.



Potential Risks

The only real risk is not having enough resources for all of the children to have a quality experience. The collective expertise of Spiral Gardens, Ephesians Children Center and Moon Wise ensures for the safety of the children at all times. 

"I Can Take Care of Myself!" kits will be carefully marked and come with important information about the herbs included to prevent any harmful chemical interactions from their use.  Children will be instructed to always let an adult know when they use their kits and to consult the information included for safety. 


Other Ways You Can Help 

There are always ways outside of direct money that can help. 

- If you have extra planters, gloves, etc. around your house, please bring them over! we'd much rather up-cycle than use unnecessary resources

- If you have some extra time one afternoon to be a chaperone on a nature walk, please let us know!!

- If you can volunteer with set-up or clean-up for the Planting Day Celebration, give us a holler!

- And last, but certainly not least, SPREAD THE WORD! We want this program to become an at least yearly endeavor, and to hopefully develop a school-year long program. We are applying for a grant to expand the program to include cooking & the larger families; letting people know this exists can help us reach our goals not just in the present but the future!

story:
Hi Precious People,

My name is Theresa Guinasso and I have created a non-profit organization called Girl Power that is dedicated to informing, empowering and encouraging women (especially young women) who are suffering from low self-esteem and possibly suicidal thoughts. We teach them how to be holistically healthy with a strong sense of self-esteem so they can live beautiful, productive lives that contribute positively to our society. 

When I was in high school I became very depressed to the point of considering suicide as a way out. At that point my mother gave me a book that talked about the mind/body/spirit connection and something clicked inside. Next I read You Can Heal Your Life and got involved in a spiritual community. These things catapulted me into a completely different state of mind and I began to heal. It took many years and many more books, therapy (both traditional and alternative) to really get me on track, but I got there.

Eventually I majored in Art and minored in Psychology at Cal Poly, SLO, got married, and had a daughter, now 20 and attending Cal Poly herself. While she was growing up I worked slowly and therapeutically on my Master's Degree in Transformational Studies and Integral Psychology. So now, after 30+ years of personal growth and development work I really want to help young women like myself.

About 5 years ago I almost died from gall-bladder disease and 4 years ago I got a divorce, between the two I re-evaluated everything. I did have a private practice life coaching and doing cranial-sacral therapy but during those situations it dissolved. Then I was offered an opportunity to own a yoga studio. I had always wanted to create a healing center so I gave it my all, unfortunately that didn't work out. (Long story) None-the-less, I am still all about healing and supporting those on their path.  Healthy and strong  at this point I got involved in a great business coaching program that really encouraged me to work with young women, they could see I was passionate about it and I had all the right stuff. The past 2 years I have poured my heart and soul, not to mention, all of the finances I had, into it. Now I am at a crossroads and praying for a miracle. Would you consider being part of that miracle? It would mean everything to me but far more importantly it would make a huge difference in the lives of many young women.

The Program Works!

I have been running it now for the past year and the feedback has been tremendous. Just listen to what this letter says: 

      “I believe this program has changed my life permanently. Introducing this resource to others like me could be a HUGE help. My thinking process has been altered in a beautiful & positive way. I can sleep at night, my panic attacks are less frequent and I can finally see the light! I’m learning to love myself and respect my body, and I am learning to live a positive and healthy life. This program has showed me how to address challenges with a completely different approach.

       I have gone through the traditional mental care process, attended group therapy, gone to counseling, and taken Prozac, but Nothing has been as inspiring or helpful as Girl Power. When I am here I don’t feel alone.”  -M. Livermore, CA

For more letters from girls and pictures of us in activities please see our website. 

Meanwhile here is the program in a nutshell:

Week 1: Self-Discovery, Personal Values  & Getting to know One Another

Week 2: Creating a Healthy Relationship with Yourself

Week 3: Taming Your Gremlin (that negative inner voice)

Week 4:  The Power of Choice & Gratitude, Learning How Affirmations Work

Week 5: Creating Healthy Relationships with Others                                                    (non-violent communication and boundaries)

Week 6: Body Image & the Messages of Media  (music, movies, ads etc)

Week 7: Your Body is a Temple (Nutrition & Exercise for a Healthy Life)

Week 8: Stress, Organizational Skills, and our Personality Type

Week 9: Becoming a Leader & Using Your Voice
  Graduation ceremony

Each week there is an art project associated with our learning and some type of movement like yoga, qi gong or dance, as well as meditation. The girls are introduced to new concepts, new ways of thinking and dealing with emotions and taught skills that help them cope with life. It has been so powerful that some girls have shared that they have stopped drinking, cutting, eating poorly or not at all and hating themselves. (Which of course touches me deeply) Most of the girls want to continue meeting and are asking for the program to continue. But unless I get some support soon I will have to find other work. I am not opposed to working hard, mostly I put in very long days and spend extra hours giving out my time counseling girls who call. At this point I have been doing everything: Program creation, marketing, accounting/bookkeeping , gathering materials and supplies, renting venues until the schools will have me on campus, filing all tax forms and most importantly running the actual program (gratefully with a volunteer assistant from time to time).

What We Need & What You Get

We need (for the upcoming year):
External Bookkeeping service, approximately $12,000 a year
Tax Preparation service $2000 (if we're lucky)
Non-Profit filing $800
Legal Zoom fees $595
Materials & Supplies for the Program approximately $1500
My salary (I'm not doing this to be the wealthiest, I feel rich and blessed) $50,000
Marketing Budget $5000 (I would really like to get the word out in a bigger way)
Renting Space $35 a day x 10 weeks+ $350 per group (9) $3,150
Scholarships for girls that cannot afford the $300 per 9 wk pgm or 1 week camp
       at least 6 for the coming year out of anticipated 90 girls for the year = $1800
Start up fees already spent $5000
Grand Total: $81,845
But, at this point we are shooting for only $20,000 in order to keep things going.

For your contribution you get a receipt that is good for a tax write-off and the satisfaction of helping a very worthy cause. There are a few other benefits depending on how much you choose to give.

If we don't reach our entire goal the funds will go first to Non-profit filing, Legal Zoom, and fees already spent on scholarships and starting up. After that hopefully we can get the program rolling again and funds would go towards supplies, marketing on a small scale and running a new group or two. At this point anything and everything will help and I am grateful for it all. I really want to serve these amazing young women, our community and God.

The Impact You Can Make is Invaluable!

Every life is so precious and unique, we never know just how beneficial a life invested in, cared for and loved can be. Certainly more than if left alone. Our future is so important and it is going to take healthy women that are strong and wise and that's what this program helps create. But we need your help. I cannot do this alone.

Just imagine, your $$ could go to some young woman who really needs support maybe someone who has been using drugs to deal with their issues, or cutting themselves, or berating themselves rendering them inept, sad and lonely. Your investment can allow them to realize there is another way and they are not alone.

    I Know There are Risks & Challenges

    I have overcome many already both personally and professionally but I actually practice what I preach to these girls and I see a bright future and a way to carry this program forward with your help. Together we are strong and can make a difference.

      Other Ways You Can Help

      Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

      Please share this with everyone you know, I would really love to take the program nationally and train others to do what I do. Use the Indiegogo share tools! Call or email me with your thoughts and suggestions, I am open, grateful and flexible. :-)
story_txt:
Hi Precious People,

My name is Theresa Guinasso and I have created a non-profit organization called Girl Power that is dedicated to informing, empowering and encouraging women (especially young women) who are suffering from low self-esteem and possibly suicidal thoughts. We teach them how to be holistically healthy with a strong sense of
self-esteem so they can live beautiful, productive lives that contribute
positively to our society. 
When I was in high school I became very depressed to the point of considering suicide as a way out. At that point my mother gave me a book that talked about the mind/body/spirit connection and something clicked inside. Next I read You Can Heal Your Life and got involved in a spiritual community. These things catapulted me into a completely different state of mind and I began to heal. It took many years and many more books, therapy (both traditional and alternative) to really get me on track, but I got there.
Eventually I majored in Art and minored in Psychology at Cal Poly, SLO, got married, and had a daughter, now 20 and attending Cal Poly herself. While she was growing up I worked slowly and therapeutically on my Master's Degree in Transformational Studies and Integral Psychology. So now, after 30+ years of personal growth and development work I really want to help young women like myself. 
About 5 years ago I almost died from gall-bladder disease and 4 years ago I got a divorce, between the two I re-evaluated everything. I did have a private practice life coaching and doing cranial-sacral therapy but during those situations it dissolved. Then I was offered an opportunity to own a yoga studio. I had always wanted to create a healing center so I gave it my all, unfortunately that didn't work out. (Long story) None-the-less, I am still all about healing and supporting those on their path.  Healthy and strong  at this point I got involved in a great business coaching program that really encouraged me to work with young women, they could see I was passionate about it and I had all the right stuff. The past 2 years I have poured my heart and soul, not to mention, all of the finances I had, into it. Now I am at a crossroads and praying for a miracle. Would you consider being part of that miracle? It would mean everything to me but far more importantly it would make a huge difference in the lives of many young women.

The Program Works!
I have been running it now for the past year and the feedback has been tremendous. Just listen to what this letter says: 


      “I believe this program has changed my life permanently.
Introducing this resource to others like me could be a HUGE help. My thinking
process has been altered in a beautiful & positive way. I can sleep at
night, my panic attacks are less frequent and I can finally see the light! I’m
learning to love myself and respect my body, and I am learning to live a
positive and healthy life. This program has showed me how to address challenges
with a completely different approach. 
       I have gone through the traditional mental care process,
attended group therapy, gone to counseling, and taken Prozac, but Nothing has
been as inspiring or helpful as Girl Power. When I am here I don’t feel alone.”  -M. Livermore, CA
For more letters from girls and pictures of us in activities please see our website. 
Meanwhile here is the program in a nutshell:
Week 1: Self-Discovery, Personal Values  & Getting to know One Another
Week 2: Creating a Healthy Relationship with Yourself
Week 3: Taming Your Gremlin (that negative inner voice)

Week 4:  The Power of Choice & Gratitude, Learning How Affirmations Work
Week 5: Creating Healthy Relationships with Others 
                                                  
 (non-violent communication and boundaries) 

Week 6: Body Image & the Messages of Media  (music, movies, ads etc)

Week 7: Your Body is a Temple (Nutrition & Exercise for a Healthy Life)
Week 8: Stress, Organizational Skills, and our Personality Type

Week 9: Becoming a Leader & Using Your Voice  Graduation ceremonyEach
 week there is an art project associated with our learning and some type
 of movement like yoga, qi gong or dance, as well as meditation. The 
girls are introduced to new concepts, new ways of thinking and dealing 
with emotions and taught skills that help them cope with life. It has
 been so powerful that some girls have shared that they have stopped 
drinking, cutting, eating poorly or not at all and hating themselves. (Which of course touches me deeply) Most of the girls want to continue meeting and are asking for the program to continue.
 But unless I get some support soon I will have to find other work. I am
 not opposed to working hard, mostly I put in very long days and spend 
extra hours giving out my time counseling girls who call. At this point I
 have been doing everything: Program creation, marketing, 
accounting/bookkeeping , gathering materials and supplies, renting 
venues until the schools will have me on campus, filing all tax forms 
and most importantly running the actual program (gratefully with a volunteer 
assistant from time to time).What We Need & What You Get
We need (for the upcoming year):External Bookkeeping service, approximately $12,000 a yearTax Preparation service $2000 (if we're lucky)Non-Profit filing $800Legal Zoom fees $595Materials & Supplies for the Program approximately $1500My salary (I'm not doing this to be the wealthiest, I feel rich and blessed) $50,000 Marketing Budget $5000 (I would really like to get the word out in a bigger way)Renting Space $35 a day x 10 weeks+ $350 per group (9) $3,150Scholarships for girls that cannot afford the $300 per 9 wk pgm or 1 week camp       at least 6 for the coming year out of anticipated 90 girls for the year = $1800Start up fees already spent $5000Grand Total: $81,845
But, at this point we are shooting for only $20,000 in order to keep things going.For your contribution you get a receipt that is good for a tax write-off and the satisfaction of helping a very worthy cause. There are a few other benefits depending on how much you choose to give.If we don't reach our entire goal the funds will go first to Non-profit filing, Legal Zoom, and fees already spent on scholarships and starting up. After that hopefully we can get the program rolling again and funds would go towards supplies, marketing on a small scale and running a new group or two. At this point anything and everything will help and I am grateful for it all. I really want to serve these amazing young women, our community and God.

Every life is so precious and unique, we never know just how beneficial a life invested in, cared for and loved can be. Certainly more than if left alone. I cannot do this alone.Just imagine, your $$ could go to some young woman who really needs support maybe someone who has been using drugs to deal with their issues, or cutting themselves, or berating themselves rendering them inept, sad and lonely. Your investment can allow them to realize there is another way and they are not alone.
