story:
My name is Liliya Murdock; I am an early childhood educator with a Bachelor’s Degree in Early Childhood education from Chestnut Hill College, and I’m also a new mom. I have 5 years of experience as a teacher in Bala Cynwyd School for Young Children that is a highly reputable preschool in the greater Philadelphia area, and the topic of childcare and quality parent-child time has interested me since I first studied early childhood education.

I strongly believe that children learn through play; unfortunately, unless they are enrolled in a high quality childcare facility, I have seen that there are not enough opportunities for children to develop their social and emotional skills and reach other important developmental stages.

This realization has inspired me to contribute my talent and experience to provide high quality services and a safe and creative environment that will be beneficial for both parents and children. I have been working with children for more than ten years, and I have provided exceptional education and service to families I have worked with one-on-one as well as in school and preschool settings.  Through Play-Date Café, I can reach many more families, introduce important skills to children, and share critical educational knowledge with parents and caregivers.

The idea for the Café came about as a solution for my own dilemma: what to do with my children when the weather is too cold, too rainy, too hot, or on days that I can’t entertain them at my own house? I also know many stay-at-home/work-at-home parents who wish there was a place for their children to be engaged and entertained so they can get their work done without worrying about safety, learning materials, tools and other creative enhancements.

I selected Bucks County PA as the location for the Café based on my research of other spaces that offer recreation and education to children and their families. Unfortunately there are not many to choose from: local libraries, Bounce U, Little Gym, and the Philadelphia or Elmwood Park Zoos, which are not conveniently located for many people. There is a great opportunity for indoor space with safe equipment, toys, classes, and a warm, family-like atmosphere.

In order to provide this solution to the community, I have set a fundraising goal of $25,000, which will go towards the first two months of rent and utilities, equipment, toys, licensing, certifications, advertising, permits, furniture, and supplies for the Café, mini-office, and soft-play area.  I am offering a 10% discount towards a reserved birthday party for each family who contributes to the campaign. Come and celebrate your child’s birthday at our Play-Date Café indoor playground!

We would love to open the doors to the Play-Date Café in time for the winter holidays, so families throughout the Northeast Philadelphia area can make use of our services and keep us in mind when they are looking for places to bring their children. Now we need your support to make this a reality, and we invite you to participate in our fundraising! If you are unable to contribute yourself, we hope that you will share this invitation with others who may be able to support our idea and help us to make this dream a reality.

Thank you!

Sincerely, Liliya Murdock
story_txt:
My name is Liliya Murdock; I am an early childhood educator with a Bachelor’s Degree in Early Childhood education from Chestnut Hill College, and I’m also a new mom. I have 5 years of experience as a teacher in Bala Cynwyd School for Young Children that is a highly reputable preschool in the greater Philadelphia area, and the topic of childcare and quality parent-child time has interested me since I first studied early childhood education.
I strongly believe that children learn through play; unfortunately, unless they are enrolled in a high quality childcare facility, I have seen that there are not enough opportunities for children to develop their social and emotional skills and reach other important developmental stages.

Thank you!
Sincerely, Liliya Murdock

story:
The One-of-a-Kind Microfiber Cloth from South Sudan that is Educating a Generation!

It's a Business With A Purpose
 
After 55 years of war, South Sudan is realizing peace. But that war took a terrible toll. With some of the world's highest illiteracy rates, child mortality rates, non-existent infrastructure, and 90% unemployment, the stress of paying school fees is crushing.
 
But Now there is a solution!
 

The Problem in South Sudan

The women of South Sudan are industrious. Take Agnes for example. She buys bags of sweet potatoes and hires men to carry them across the border into Congo. There, they trade them for teak poles which are then loaded onto trucks back in South Sudan and driven to Kampala, Uganda. Agnes then hires a car to beat the trucks to market, where she then sells the teak poles. The funds from the sale are now reinvested into used clothing which she ships to South Sudan and markets through her three local retail stores. Profits from the sale of the clothes are then used to hire boys to make bricks, which she builds into a basic house that is then rented out.

All of this to make enough money to pay the school fees for her children. If enough money does not come in, the girls are the first to lose out.

The Problem in the US

Mobile phones with larger screens, iPads, laptops, hip new glasses; they all need to be cleaned. T-shirts will clean today's screens but will also scratch them. That's why we use microfiber cloths. They do a remarkable job, however, we are often losing them. If we are going to have them all over the place, why not make a bold statement with them also?

Now there is a solution. A win-win for everyone.

Introducing the tye-dyed microfiber cloth that is educating a nation!

That's right! For the first time, the incredible tie-dye art of South Sudan is being applied to soft, scratch-free, microfiber cloth, just like your optometrists sells. The money a mother receives from making one cloth will pay for a month of school! Buy five, and her daughter's fees are covered for an entire term! Watch the awesome UN video below to learn more about education and girls in South Sudan.

 

So how does this all work?

  1. We import high quality, super smooth, soft microfiber cloths to South Sudan.
  2. Then the woman, the mothers, the young moms, the grandmothers, the widows take each cloth and apply their own artistic gift to each tie-dyed cloth. 
  3. After careful drying and quality checks, each one of a kind cloth is packed up.
  4. Hope Cloth now purchases the entire lot and imports into the U.S.
  5. We then distribute  exclusively through Amazon.com, right to your door or to whomever you send as a gift

This is your chance to get a unique, one-of-a-kind, hand-dyed microfiber cloth, that empowers women entrepreneurs in South Sudan who will, in turn, be able to support their girls' education. It really is that good!

Listen to AnneGrace tell the story of how producing Hope Cloths is changing women's lives.

 

The Bottom Line, "Show Me The Money"

The $10,500 we want to raise here and now will:

  • Pay for our initial start-up costs.
  • 100 cloth pilot (complete)
  • 1,000 cloth launch perk 
  • 2,000 initial production run
  • Website develpment (complete)
  • AMAZON site development
  • Packaging and distribution system
  • Oh, and 100 semesters of girls education!

Let's Get This Done!

Who is Steve Roese?

Steve Roese is an out of the box thinker who wants to change the world by connecting dots, and people, to make things happen that others do not expect to succeed. He has traveled much of the world, is burdened for and amazed by the people he knows there. Married 30 years to a highly gifted and talented wife he has 3 adult kids who he happens to really like.  Whatever It Takes for him is more than a tagline, it's his tattoo and its how things change. Impatient with the status quo his focus is on both the haves and have-nots of society and whose cultural ethos is to do whatever it takes to collide the lives of both. Steve co-founded Water is Basic, an indigenous borehole drilling organization in South Sudan. Steve's work as a catalyst has given him a front-row view of the current grassroots peace process in South Sudan. You can find out more about that at SouthSudanNow.com.

story:
Sci-gasm Podcast

It is becoming more and more obvious in recent months that the world needs Skepticism, Science and Satire. Sci-gasm Podcast's audience has dramatically increased, and in the past few months this has motivated us to further promote Sci-gasm's message to the masses. However, as our audience has grown exponentially- so have the running costs and the time spent ensuring that the quality of the program is worthy of our listeners and of our cause.
 

What We Need & What You Get

We are only asking for a small amount of funding to assist with the cost of ensuring that the show is promoted and is of a quality that maximizes our listening audience. The amount we are asking for certainly does not cover all the running costs. However, it will give the Sci-gasm Podcast some financial support. To listen to the episodes you can go to Soundcloud: http://tinyurl.com/zghyf7d or iTunes: http://tinyurl.com/jzgstct

If the goal is not reached you can be assured that the funds will still go into the running costs of the Podcast. Every cent gained from this crowdfunding effort will continue to help Sci-gasm promote our message of Skepticism, Science and critical thinking.

We did not want to create memberships or have exclusive content as we strongly feel that Science should be available to everyone regardless of their financial situation. 

 

Rewards

Pledge $ 20 -A shout out on a Sci-gasm episode.
We will shout your name into a microphone in one of our episodes.

Pledge $100 A Signed 'Dick Pic'
Byrne and Wade will send you a picture of Richard Feynman with a personalized message on the back.

Pledge $500- A Skype session with Sci-gasm
Have a Skype session with the Byrne & Wade.

Pledge $1,000-  Your own personal episode
Sit back and let Wade and Byrne do the research for you on a Science topic of your choosing

story:
BACKGROUND

Once upon a time, fashion design was viewed as a low-caliber career, up until a few years ago. If you went into the fashion design business, people concluded that you were a failure in school and that the only option left was designing. Today, however, Fashion Designers and more specifically African Fashion Designers are positioning themselves as creative and innovative professionals with a well-spring of talent that can serve the domestic, regional and global markets.  

INDUSTRY INSIGHTS- EAST AFRICA 

A study review of the East Africa region has established that there is a limited number of national and regional institutions that offer practical and refined training in fashion design that is relevant and responsive to the job market.

By investing in a Middle Level College recognized and approved by the Ministry of Higher Education, Science and Technology (MOHEST) under the Technical, Industrial, Vocational and Entrepreneurship Training (TVET), MEFA Institute of Design will provide a career focused education system with training programmes targeting the post-secondary clientele, thus bridging the skills gap between supply and demand of fashion design training not only in Kenya but across the East African region. 

It was noted that in Kenya, the universities enrolled about half the total number of students for courses related to the textile and clothing sector, while the others were distributed among other tertiary institutions that supplement the universities in providing career focused education and training programmes to the post-secondary clientele. This has also led to a demand for tertiary education

It is noteworthy that most students that undergo fashion design training are well equipped in the theoretical aspect of training, but lack practical skills, because of inadequate training. This can be attributed to the fact that most of the training programs emphasize fashion design, which attracts the younger population in Kenya and east African region, while overlooking basic skills associated with production technology and processes, equipment maintenance, and multi-skilling where there is a great deal of demand for skilled workers. The use of outdated equipment and / or inadequate amounts of appropriate equipment facilities and infrastructure also contribute to the skills gap.

To address this, MEFA Institute of Design shall capitalize on modern training tools, the use of the latest technology, hands on skill projects and hire highly experienced and well-trained staff to offer training.

The institute will also create a chance for the youth to work on what they are passionate about, develop their untapped skills and talents hence positioning them competitively in the marketplace against their University counterparts.

PROJECT DETAILS

Category:                               Education

Project Location:                Inside Hekima University, Riara road, Nairobi

Funding Duration:              60 days

Fundraising Amount:       We seek to raise $100,000 to make the dream come alive.

HOW WILL YOUR MONEY BE USED?

IMPACT

Through your support, talented youth from underprivileged backgrounds who have a passion for fashion will get an opportunity to build a career in the fashion and design discipline.

By empowering the youth, they will achieve economic independence and be able to empower their families and society. 

PERKS

To show our gratitude, you will receive a special gift designed and made by Akinyi Odongo mentees.

BEYOND MONEY, HOW ELSE CAN YOU SUPPORT?

  • Share this campaign on social media; Facebook, Twitter and Instagram to your friends and family using the hashtag #PassionforFashion
  • Inform a friend or relative who is looking to study fashion design to check out MEFA Institute of Design website and social media pages for more info.
  • Support us by ordering an Akinyi Odongo inspired outfit on her website http://akinyiodongo.co.ke/  and through this, you support her mentoring efforts

story:
Introduction

Sanaa is the swahili word for work of art.

Sanaa Music Workshop is an education program that provides young musicians with the tools to thrive in the ever-changing musical landscape. Traditionally, music programs focus solely on artistic development. While this is absolutely necessary, it is only half of what is required for a successful career in the performing arts. Sanaa immerses students in exercises that focus not only on improving musicianship but also on the processes of marketing, selling and branding what is being created. With Your help, we can bring this program to the music students who need it most. 

Sanaa Music Workshop

It is our goal to merge the worlds of music and business. Most, if not all arts programs, ignore the monetization process and focus solely on performance and technical musical ability. For example, standard arts programs teach students how to paint, play, and create beautiful art but fail to teach students how to make a living using their skill sets. We believe that we are here to enrich this community with a different type of arts program. We are passionate about improving students’ odds for a successful, lucrative and fulfilling career in the arts. We’ll do this by giving them a complete set of skills and always looking ahead to innovations and tools that will help them and us learn and progress.

Sanaa Music Workshop and The New Orleans Jazz Market

Sanaa Music Workshop is proud to call the Peoples Health New Orleans Jazz Market home. We are excited about the partnership and looking forward to growing our program with their help. The Jazz Market is located in a thriving area that bolsters the community around it. 

What you can do to help.

By contributing to this project you will directly affect a student's life. We will use the funds collected to provide scholarships, financial aid, lunch, and pay for other operating expenses. Reduced rates and scholarship opportunities will be available to students who qualify because you have decided to be a part of the solution. Dismantling financial barriers for arts education is one of the many obstacles we intend to fight. In order to do these things, we need to raise 20,000 dollars. This money will fund the camp for two years and allow us to provide a high-quality educational experience for little to no cost.

The Impact

Your contribution will help us prepare a generation of students for the challenges they will face in today's marketplace. Hopefully helping them to realize the potential they have for monetizing their creations and skill sets. By allowing students to apply their creativity to developing marketing, branding, and selling skills, we can eradicate the "Artist Myth". A line of thinking that relegates artist to a life of poverty.

 Problem and Solution

No program exists in the southern United States offering instruction that merges Arts Education with business strategy.

Our Solution

Daily lectures from music and business industry leaders 

Various classes on Marketing, Branding, Publishing, and other practical tools

One on one instrumental instruction

Built-in mentorship programs

Diverse and need-blind enrollment process

Other Ways You Can Help

You want to help, but may not be able to do it financially? No problem, there are a number of ways to help with this initiative, one of the first is to get the word out. Share with your friends, co-workers, social media followers, wherever and whoever you can think of. Help us spread the word about what Sanaa Music Workshop is doing, and don't forget Indiegogo has awesome share tools to help spread the message as well. Volunteers! We value the work and the energy that volunteers bring to the world. Community is a  valuable part of what and why we do the work that we do. Bring out your community groups to join us for a week of fun and excitement.  For more information, visit us at SanaaMusicWorkShop.com.

story:
ABOUT THE AUTHOR, TEAM, YOU, AND CAMPAIGN

Jeff Glass was raised by an entrepreneur since the age of 5 and has a background working with children for the past 20  years. With a background in psychology, investing and running over 12 small businesses, Jeff has written social and cognitive programs designed for youth, writing, teaching and testing entrepreneurship curriculum for schools and the juvenile justice system. He recently shifted his focus to children's literature and teaching platforms to bring the  entrepreneur mindset to cities: parents, schools, businesses, and social care systems. He now serves as a husband, parent, author, and executive director of Youth Entrepreneur Syndicate in the state of Nevada. 

  • This campaign gives rise to the greatest project for youth of Jeff's career. This 7 book series on entrepreneurship is designed for parents, kids (ages 3-12), teachers, and mentors. The series unpacks principles that have a track record of success in major companies, organizations, and the daily lives of people. Generosity, Courage, Teamwork, Leadership, Stewardship (Time and Money), Innovation and Honor. These social entrepreneur skills create cultures of sustainability, happiness, loyalty, and co-worker engagement. 
  • Education begins in the home. It starts with the parents. These core values have been tested with students over the past few years; they have exhibited a deeper appreciation of their mentors and teachers as well as an understanding of their education and how it applies to the marketplace. 
  • This campaign is a social entrepreneurship effort. It is designed to engage with YOU, Parents, families, communities, schools, businesses and cities, to invest in the most important people of all: our children. 

YOUR INVESTMENT 

Whether you invest financially or by spreading the vision to your friends and family, your generosity to this campaign will have a compound effect on the education, influence, and lives of our children. Our goal is to raise 20k per book to complete the artwork, production, marketing, and distribution needed to have the entire series ready by 2017! 

THE IMPACT WE WILL MAKE TOGETHER 

We believe modeling is the BEST teacher. Jesse and The Lion Share is the first book of the series written about the core value of generosity.  We are putting this value into practice. 51 percent of all profits from this book will be invested back into our youth facing challenges in the social care system. We are creating scholarships for students in our entrepreneur programs to start their own companies.  Education alone is not enough. We, and that includes YOU, are providing the next step to change the lives of our kids and impact our economy. Our goal is to set up as many scholarships and opportunities for youth as possible. 

Every dollar contributed will be applied to the production of our series. Your financial contribution makes our book series and scholarship programs possible. We also need your VOICE. We need your help to reach 1 million people with OUR VISION. We teach our kids to DREAM BIG, so we must go first and do the same!

We appreciate you!!

Jeff Glass & The Amazing Book Series Team
story_txt:
ABOUT THE AUTHOR, TEAM, YOU, AND CAMPAIGNJeff Glass was raised by an entrepreneur since the age of 5 and has a background working with children for the past 20  years. With a background in psychology, investing and running over 12 small businesses, Jeff has written social and cognitive programs designed for youth, writing, teaching and testing entrepreneurship curriculum for schools and the juvenile justice system. He recently shifted his focus to children's literature and teaching platforms to bring the  entrepreneur mindset to cities: parents, schools, businesses, and social care systems. He now serves as a husband, parent, author, and executive director of Youth Entrepreneur Syndicate in the state of Nevada. 
This campaign gives rise to the greatest project for youth of Jeff's career. This 7 book series on entrepreneurship is designed for parents, kids (ages 3-12), teachers, and mentors. The series unpacks principles that have a track record of success in major companies, organizations, and the daily lives of people. Generosity, Courage, Teamwork, Leadership, Stewardship (Time and Money), Innovation and Honor. These social entrepreneur skills create cultures of sustainability, happiness, loyalty, and co-worker engagement. 
Education begins in the home. It starts with the parents. These core values have been tested with students over the past few years; they have exhibited a deeper appreciation of their mentors and teachers as well as an understanding of their education and how it applies to the marketplace. 
This campaign is a social entrepreneurship effort. It is designed to engage with YOU, Parents, families, communities, schools, businesses and cities, to invest in the most important people of all: our children. 
YOUR INVESTMENT Whether you invest financially or by spreading the vision to your friends and family, your generosity to this campaign will have a compound effect on the education, influence, and lives of our children. story:
We are Fortune and Friends Theatre and we are taking our show 'Finding Uhuru' to schools in Tanzania. 

We are a new company based in London and aim to specialise in creating theatre for children around the world. This is our first venture out and we decided why not go large the first time round. There are lots of ways to learn about doing something and one of those is simply getting out there, and getting on with it. We are fortunate enough to be sponsored by Anada Overseas Education based in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania. 

Our company (From left to right) consist of:  Jamie Littlewood (Director), A sulky looking Brian Chandrabose (Uhuru), Imran Momen (Sound and Tech) and Alexandria Anfield (Cordelia)

 

This campaign is to help us get the equipment to make a documentary about taking our show to Tanzania.

The Impact - What are we doing?

Along with schools in Dar es Salaam will also be travelling outside of the main towns and cities and performing in some of the poorest regions of Tanzania, where most likely this kind of venture will never have been experienced before. 

Our play focuses on:

- Bullying
- Gender equality
- Professional aspirations 

We hope to inspire the children of Tanzania and show them that despite their perceived limitations, they have the capabilities to excel in whatever they choose in life. They are the future of Tanzania and the world as a whole. 

After each performance the team will run an hour workshop with the students to explore the themes of the play, what they have learnt and most importantly how they can apply it to their own lives. 

Brian Chandrabose (A Tanzanian National) will be leading part of the workshops and is a fluent Swahili speaker. 

The Process - How are we doing it. 

We face the challenge of making sure that the children of Tanzania understand our show. To solve this problem we will have the show performed in both English and Swahili with subtitles projected in both languages.

The play follows the journey of the two characters; Uhuru and Cordelia, as they learn about each other's cultures through language, music, dance and storytelling. All perfect ingredients to make an entertaining and engaging show for the kids.

The Reason - Why do we want to do this?

We want to document this to show people how beautiful Africa (Tanzania)  is and why there is so much potential there that cannot be ignored. Hopefully, shedding light on one little corner of the world will inspire people, maybe you, to seek out the other wonders of the globe and appreciate it for what it is.

In the current climate, where division of countries and cultures, and fear of others because of their differences seems to be becoming the norm, this project stands to challenge these notions as we combine our collective experience of life in Britain and Tanzania.   

Through the film we hope that you will be transported to Tanzanian life and join us on our journey of discovery. In addition, this film will help us fund future projects that we hope to take elsewhere and also serve as a resource for others.


We have managed to pay for everything from flights, to accommodation, to travel itself on the road (won't be walking hundreds of miles with a show to put on everyday). However we still have some way to go before we can achieve our goal of recording our endeavours so we can spread the word and in order to take you along on our awesome trip, we need your help. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

"So what do we need specifically? Well, a ton of stuff to be honest; and to keep costs down we are mainly sourcing used equipment.

The most pricey components are the Camera and a lens or two to go with it.

Black Magic Pocket Camera (Around £700)

Tokina 11-16mm (Around £300) That's only one. We are working on basics here.

But its a start, we also need power (Batteries) to last long days of travelling and away from the mains. £50-100

Storage: Hard Drives and SD cards - there will be a lot of footage from a month of travelling and it all has to go somewhere, with no iCloud we need physical storage space ;) about £300's worth.

Sound equipment: One of the most crucial aspects of any film. Bad sound equals unwatchable film, its as simple as that. Something along a Rode Video Mic and Tascam recorder £150-250

Accessories - All the little bits that connect everything and allow us to store all this stuff. And that's just a glimpse into the equipment we need. 

Camera Cage: £150

Follow focus: £50

Camera Stabilisation: £200

Neutral Density Filter: £150

The list goes on.

The reason we decided to set the target here is in order to acquire the most vital equipment, ultimately some things we can do without, which in turn will affect what we can create but that's expected. 

Rewards: 

So what do you get?

Well along with the usual suspects such as a heartfelt thank you on social media, there will be some exclusive rewards that will come directly from Tanzania... even a film premier invitation. 

Examples include personalised post cards, with photos taken at various locations such as the schools themselves as we travel from one city to another. (With a personal message to boot) 

On top of that there are some mystery gifts that we'll come across as we travel. (Give us a hint in a message and we'll try our best to look for something in that region.) Do you fancy a chance to learn some basic Swahili? Then we have that covered too. 

"You may be wondering, 'what happens to all this kit once we have returned and shot the documentary?'" Well for starters it will be useful for shooting our next adventure in another part of the world. Secondly we will be running a poll with all kinds of small and yet to be established charities and whichever tops the list, we aim to work hand in hand and create a documentary from start to finish free of charge for them. Providing a chance for a good cause to get some much deserved attention. 

 

Risks & Challenges

 

As mentioned above the challenges we face are making sure of that the children of Tanzania understand our show. To solve this problem we will have the show performed in both English and Swahili with subtitles projected in both languages. 

Brian Chandrabose (A Tanzanian National) will be leading part of the workshops and is a fluent Swahili speaker. 

We may not succeed in acquiring all the equipment we would ideally need in order to create the best possible film, and that's a reality we are prepared to face. In response to that we are adaptable enough to create something exciting with what we do get. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We are aware that not everyone can help on a monetary basis, and if you are in that position but do share our vision then you can still help us out by spreading the word!! 

- If you can please share our campaign with your friends, family and even co workers.

Here is our campaign link for easy sharing on Facebook and Twitter

https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/finding-uhur...

Facebook Page

https://www.facebook.com/Finding-Uhuru-17494208...

Twitter Page

https://twitter.com/FindingUhuru

Please feel free to ask any questions on any of those platforms.

And finally if you have any surplus bits of tech as Alex would say 'GIVE US YOUR OLD SD CARDS AND STUFF YOU HAVE LYING AROUND.' 

Thank you

story:
Campaign Overview

Our mission is to change the negative narrative of black fathers.  This photo book will take the perspective of fatherhood from 10 Awesome Black Dads and capture those perspectives in a way that will provoke thoughts and conversations that are necessary in our communities.  

Short Summary

The images in our community that are used to paint the picture of black men, particularly black fathers, largely have a negative context. This is simply not the whole truth. As the father of two young boys, I know more committed black fathers than not who are committed to raising their children. Those fathers are also able to testify the same truth. There are more positive committed black fathers than what is displayed in the media.  

We need to show our kids the other side of being a black father: the beauty, the connection, and the struggle. We need to show them the value of fatherhood and what it means to us.  It is a process that will be passed to the next generation. But we need to start now. There is no middle ground on this: we must communicate the right image of fatherhood to our community, because nobody else is going to do it for us. 

To change the narrative, Awesome Black Dads is currently working to put together a limited-edition coffee table photo book. This book will provide an authentic look at contemporary black fathers. Our goal is to provoke positive dialogue within our community that sparks an action to create better images of us using other media platforms.  Mainstream media is filled to the brim with negative portrayals of black fathers, and if we want to leave behind a better legacy that we know and love, we must do so on our own terms. Awesome Black Dads understands that this isn’t a complete solution but we truly believe this book is a start to something bigger and better. 

We have selected 7 Black fathers with varying backgrounds to share their respective stories.  The last 3 spots are reserved for a social media contest that will allow the Awesome Black Dad community and the social world to choose once the campaign is successful.

OWN THE BOOK, GIFT IT, OR DONATE IT TO YOUR LOCAL LIBRARY!

  

The Team

Awesome Black Dads – Project Creator

Awesome Black Dads is a media collective dedicated to curating content that will plans to change and more importantly the narrative of Black fathers.

 

My Bounce Media – Head of Photography

My Bounce Photography is an experienced photography company that is collaborating with Awesome Black Dads to create the first ever coffee table book that captures the essence of black fatherhood.

http://mybouncephotography.com

 

What We Need

We need your help. We need to raise $5,500.  This startup capital will cover the costs of developing, publishing, marketing, distributing, and licensing the first coffee table book dedicated to telling the story of Fatherhood through the eyes of black fathers that are committed to the journey of being awesome.  We cannot do this without you. Your contributions are appreciated. Thank you.

50% - Development, Publishing

30% - Marketing

20% - Distribution

 

The Impact 

Fatherhood: Through the Eyes of Black Fathers will feature the perspective of fatherhood from 10 black dads and capture their perspectives in a way that will provoke thoughts, conversations, and behaviors that are necessary in our communities.  Our mission is to begin to change that negative narrative that is being told about black fathers and to become a better representation of what it truly means to be awesome. 

Once this book successfully goes into production Awesome Black Dads will donate 10% of the profits from each sell to a local charity dedicated to helping build better communities by building better men and woman.  Your contribution to this campaign will touch the lives of many in so many ways.  So, when you ask what kind of impact this collection of images will have; I say to you lets create something positive together and watch the fruits grow into something better.

 

Risks & Challenges

The risk is minimal. Supporting this book is an opportunity to sow into a project that will change lives. Though deadlines may change, this project will get done with your help. However, given the amount of time between now and Father’s Day 2017 scheduling would seem to be amiss, but coordinating 10 fathers can be a bit more challenging than most would think.  The scheduling would seem to be our most significant challenge.

Please note that the specifications may be subject to minor design tweaks during the production process, but if there are any significant design changes or any unforeseen complications we will keep all backers informed via Indiegogo and through our social media /subscriber network.


Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that it may be difficult to support an awesome project financially, but there are others ways that you can help Awesome Black Dads achieve our desired goal. 

  1. Share this project with your network of friends that would have interest backing this campaign.
  2. Share the campaign on your social media platform using the share tools available through the campaign page.

Shoot us an email to tell us other ways that you would like to contribute.

story:
Take it from me...

My name is Frank Vaughn and I am a college graduate.  Finally.  I was raised by a hard-working father who had to sacrifice his dream of being our family's first college graduate when life made him a single father.  Our life was hard as I grew up, and I never considered attempting college until my junior year of high school.  We didn't have the money for me to go and while my standardized test scores indicated future success in academics, my GPA spoke of a lack of ambition.  I decided at the last moment to go anyway, thinking I would figure it out as I went. 

I battled personal financial difficulty, adjustment to a life of previously unheard of freedom, marriage and divorce, and two wars around the world.  My refusal to give up--along with a willingness to amass a huge amount of debt--kept me in the game until I finally finished 17 years later.

This campaign is my attempt to pass on the hard lessons of life that I learned on this journey.  My sincere hope is that I can save at least one person the heartache of making the mistakes I did.  College is hard enough, but it's nearly impossible when you can't get out of your own way.

I am grateful to anyone who makes the leap into partnering with me to help college students find a more productive path to realizing their dreams than the one I traveled.


What We Need & What You Get

I am launching this campaign to raise at least $5000.00 to cover the cost of editing and publication.  I want to get this book into the hands of parents, college students, and any other dreamers who might benefit from my lessons learned as cheaply as possible.
 

Perks for contributing:

$5 or more:  You will receive a handwritten note thanking you for partnering with me on this project.
$10 or more:  You will be acknowledged by name in the book itself.
$20 or more:  You will receive a copy of the book, along with your name in the acknowledgements.
$25 or more:  You will receive a signed copy of the book, along with your name in the     acknowledgements. 
$50 or more:  You will receive a signed copy of the book with your name in the acknowledgements, along with a Skype or other video-based call from me to personally thank you.
$100 or more:  You will receive the above perks, plus an engraved plaque commemorating your contribution.

Even if we don't reach our goal, the project will still move forward.  Anyone who contributes can rest assured that this project will happen.  It is too important not to.
 

The Impact

Have you ever had a dream that went unfulfilled?  I hope the finished product of this project will be an encouragement to you and to anyone who is considering giving up, or who is discouraged by life circumstances.

Risks & Challenges

Undertaking a major writing project carries a definite risk--especially financially.  The challenges, though can be overcome with partnership and encouragement.  I have been writing for a long time, mostly telling other people's stories.  I feel deeply moved now to tell my own, and I pray that others can learn from my life and improve upon their own.

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can give money, and I completely understand that.  I support campaigns now when I can, but I was not always able to.  If you are that person, there is still a way you can help!  Almost everyone has Facebook these days, and Instagram, Twitter, Snapchat, and other social media are wildly popular these days too.  Please help me get the word out about this campaign using your social media!

I am launching this campaign to raise at least $5000.00 to cover the cost of editing and publication.  I want to get this book into the hands of parents, college students, and any other dreamers who might benefit from my lessons learned as cheaply as possible. 
Perks for contributing:
$5 or more:  You will receive a handwritten note thanking you for partnering with me on this project.$10 or more:  You will be acknowledged by name in the book itself.$20 or more:  You will receive a copy of the book, along with your name in the acknowledgements.$25 or more:  You will receive a signed copy of the book, along with your name in the     acknowledgements. $50 or more:  You will receive a signed copy of the book with your name in the acknowledgements, along with a Skype or other video-based call from me to personally thank you.$100 or more:  You will receive the above perks, plus an engraved plaque commemorating your contribution.Even if we don't reach our goal, the project will still move forward.  Anyone who contributes can rest assured that this project will happen.  It is too important not to. 
The Impact
Have you ever had a dream that went unfulfilled?  I hope the finished product of this project will be an encouragement to you and to anyone who is considering giving up, or who is discouraged by life circumstances.

Risks & Challenges
Undertaking a major writing project carries a definite risk--especially financially.  The challenges, though can be overcome with partnership and encouragement.  I have been writing for a long time, mostly telling other people's stories.  I feel deeply moved now to tell my own, and I pray that others can learn from my life and improve upon their own.

Other Ways You Can Help
Not everyone can give money, and I completely understand that.  I support campaigns now when I can, but I was not always able to.  If you are that person, there is still a way you can help!  Almost everyone has Facebook these days, and Instagram, Twitter, Snapchat, and other social media are wildly popular these days too.  Please help me get the word out about this campaign using your social media!

story:
Toddlers on the Hill Lower Income Scholarship Fund:

TOTH provides an early learning Montessori experience  striving to instill independence, confidence, and creativity in 1-3 years olds impacting them for a lifetime.  Find out more about TOTH, Montessori and our scholarship program by watching this video.

THE IMPACT:
Harvard University’s Center on the Developing Child has found that early childhood experiences, especially between 0–3 years, actually alter gene expression, shape brain architecture, and affect long-term development.  According to the Nobel  Prize-winning University of Chicago Economics Professor James Heckman:

•  “Early learning confers value on acquired skills, which leads to self-reinforcing motivation to learn more."

•  “Early mastery of a range of cognitive, social, and emotional competencies makes learning at later ages more efficient and therefore easier and more likely to continue.”

•  “Intervening at an early enough age can actually raise the IQ of the participants.”

MAKE SOME NOISE!
Use Indiegogo’s share tools on the left of this page to invite others to support this cause!

If you, your business, or your family would like to learn more about our scholarship, contact Joy Wilder.

​Special thanks go to the Capitol Hill Community Foundation for awarding us grants over multiple years.  Also, Steve Leroy and Libby Quaid for contributing Music Together Classes directly benefitting the scholarship.  Finally, to all of our parents and friends of TOTH for their generous support!

story:
What is interpretame.com?

Interpretame.com is a platform that will transform the process of interpreters' training as well as the entire approach to the teaching and learning of interpretation, allowing for the first time a personalized experience.

Interpretame.com believes in customized learning and fosters self-paced and self-monitored practice, supported by a community of peers.

Its beta version is already up and running. You can visit it at https://www.interpretame.com. 

Who is interpretame.com for?

  • Interpreting students: Learn by doing and feel like an interpreter from the safety of your own home, until you are ready to get into the booth and apply what you've learnt. You'll be able to offset the anxiety so typical of interpreting students with unlimited practice and will benefit from the knowledge of more experienced interpreters and interpreter-trainers.
  • Professors and universities: Improve your teaching experience by letting technology enter your classroom. Send out, receive, and grade assignments, implement virtual rooms for the teaching-and-learning dialogue, foster peer-to-peer cooperation, and monitor your students' progress. This innovative software will compensate for the reduced contact hours and help your interpreting students gain autonomy.
  • Interpreters: Prepare yourself easily before any conference and be the most well-fitted professional any client could ask for. A cost-effective preparation tool specially suited to enhance the performance of freelance interpreters who offer their services in different fields and have to master a new topic every month.
  • Language learners: Speak like a native, exposing yourself to real speeches and actively working on them through shadowing and retour interpreting. New language learning techniques for people with advanced skills who have been stuck at a level in which there is no more grammar to learn but still plenty of room for improvement in expression and new vocabulary acquisition. 

Why is interpretame.com different?

Interpretame.com is a comprehensive software that allows you to go through all the steps to train interpreting from beginning to end:

  • Finding speeches
  • Recording yourself while interpreting them
  • Listening to your performance
  • Filling-in self-assessment sheets
  • Grading yourself
  • Asking other users for feedback
  • Creating glossaries
  • Memorizing new vocabulary
  • Testing your new knowledge
  • Sharing resources
  • Discussing interesting topics with your peers
  • Improving interpreting-related skills such as mental readiness, bidirectionality, context inference, rewording or improvisation.

In addition, it uses gamification  as a powerful mean of making the learning process fun

  • Challenge users to impossible speeches
  • Accept challenges and prove your skills
  • Share memory games

​You will not need any other resource.

Being a user-centered platform, it makes possible for every person to design their own exercises, and choose topics to prepare, as well as the mode in which to do so. In addition, it allows you to choose between going through the entire process independently and keeping your files private, or relying on peer-assessment and share your files with them. 

Other platforms provide downloadable activities and offer general guidelines, which means limited resources and the risk of getting out of date if the owners don't add new activities regularly. Contrary to that, in interpretame.com you will not find prepared activities to fill in, print or solve — you'll be given a tool to customize your own interpreting training that suits your needs, plus a community of peers to support you through the whole process. 

On top of that, it is a tool for the interpreting classroom that can be used by professors and universities to monitor their students' progress by granted administration rights.

    How does it work?

    If you are a university, academy or professor who wants to use interpretame.com as an interpreter-trainer or entity, our Campus account will grant you administration rights over a given number of students' accounts, which you'll be able to monitor, edit and delete, and whose work you'll be able to grade through a private grading system. You'll also get room to add private sections not visible to other users or entities.

    If you're a student or an interpreter, simply register at interpretame.com. You can do that already and get instant access to your customizable profile, your private storage space, and a public forum with different rooms.

    Your private profile contains different sections that will guide you through the whole training: from obtaining a speech, to recording your interpretation, assessing it, or sharing it. Interpretations stored by users are called Prets — we encourage you to go to our site right now and create your first one to get a taste of the platform. How? Since an image speaks a thousand words, we'd like to invite you to check the following short video-tutorial:

    The video-tutorial depicts the beta version, which is already available and functional, but is only a sample of Interprétame's potential — with your help, we can take it to a whole new level.

    We'll be able to host thousands of users, offer unlimited storage space, make it available in other languages, implement the feedback function, adapt it for professors and universities, develop a mobile app and desktop application that will allow you to train offline and improve all the sections to make a good product amazing. 

    Types of accounts

    When interpretame.com is fully ready, it will offer three kinds of membership.

    • Basic account: It is free and allows you to store up to 30 minutes of audio, split into up to three Prets, which can be reused by deleting old audio and freeing storage space. It allows you to send one feedback request per month. One personal glossary with as many terms as needed. 
    • Premium account: For only 7.99 euros per month, you'll be able to store unlimited minutes of audio in an unlimited number of Prets, up to 25 GB. You'll be able to send unlimited feedback requests. You'll have the possibility to sort glossaries according to both topic and language and have the testing software examine you accordingly, plus you'll have the possibility to share glossaries and download them in Excel. 
    • Campus account: We offer a special package for universities, academies, professors and libraries that will grant administration rights over student accounts. Specially designed to improve the teaching experience, this tool allows for the sending of assignments and the tracking of students' progress. It offers the possibility to add private channels in the forum. Cooperative glossaries can be accessed, modified and downloaded by a group.
      Storage space and pricing will vary according to the number of student accounts linked to the master account.

    Our campaign

    What do we need and what is in it for you?

    We've adjusted our costs and have calculated that with only 8,000 euros (8,700 USD) we can utilize more powerful servers to host a greater number of users, and offer unlimited space. In addition, we'll be able to implement an accounts system to suit your needs, develop a Campus account for universities and professors to monitor their student's progress, eventually making the platform available in other languages (starting with English). Lastly, we'll develop the desktop and mobile app, and implement all planned extra functions.

    What will your help make possible?

    • More powerful servers > Unlimited users, unlimited storage space.
    • Internal net and evaluation system > Feedback function.
    • Desktop application > Continue your training even offline.
    • Mobile app development > Use your commuting time to train. 
    • App rights > Acquisition of Apple and Android licenses for phone app.
    • Website translation > Make it international (first English and later on other languages).
    • Campus account > Improve your teaching experience and monitor your students.
    • Improvement of existing sections > Download and share your glossaries, and more.
    • New sections > See new sections such as Challenges come to live.

     

    From idea to reality 

    The origin of a dream 

    Interprétame was born from the needs of a student trying to make it through her interpreting exams at university. Insufficient and too scattered resources made self-training a rather complex process depending on many external factors. That student was me, Alba Collado, and, like many Interpreting students, I had to juggle speech-providing platforms, with a recorder, printed self-evaluation sheets copied from a book, excel/word-created glossaries, and the availability of other people in order to assess myself and test my recently learnt vocabulary. How would it be possible to go through this process independently? Why wasn’t there an easy-to-use application available, that would allow all of the aforementioned factors to be united in an all-in-one platform?

    This question frustrated me throughout my studies, and while I was writing my final thesis I set my mind to design such a tool. My tutor loved the idea, yet she thought it was too big a project for a graduate paper, so she advised me to keep it and see if in the future I wanted to make it my PhD thesis. Those were my initial steps in the formation of my idea.

    I put my sketches in a drawer, graduated and jumped into the working world.

    Some years later, while living in Hamburg (Germany), I shared an apartment with a brilliant Computer Engineer with whom I quickly became friends. One night, talking about our dreams and aspirations and how we imagined our future, I shared with him this vision of a self-learning platform for interpreters and how I wished I could implement it someday, and to my surprise, he took a great interest in the idea. He encouraged me to pursue this dream, and not only offered to build it, but also added some great ideas to make it more attractive through gamification. I though at the time that it was just talk between roommates, but a week later we were checking if there was something similar to this on the market, one month later we had acquired interpretame.com and stepped into the exciting path that brought us here today. My partner is Marco Antonio Pajares, with whom I have been working with for the last two years.

    Our journey

    For the past two years, we have had to combine our jobs with the developement of our dream, so we have been working slowly but steady.

    We have two very different minds that complement each other perfectly. 

    Moreover, we learnt a lot from fields unknown to us before, and along the way, we encountered wonderful people that with their little gestures helped us make big steps.

    Creative souls that helped us take professional pictures for the website and banners, and designed exclusive T-shirts for interpretame.com; skilled minds that helped us improve the quality of our videos; great advisers we turned to for a fresh perspective; volunteers who tested new functions and gave us feedback, enthusiastic friends who believed in us and encouraged us pursue our dream. Amazing unselfish people who don't probably grasp the significance of their good deeds, and to whom we can't say thank you enough.

    What else could you do to help?

    We'd love to add your face to this initiative. Contributing financially to our campaign is one way, but there are others. We need motivated people to help us spread the platform and share our content, and we are going to need testers in the following months to give us feedback about our new system and sections. In addition, we'll need website translators to make it international, and content writers that help us set in motion the English forum with relevant interpreting topics — especially the Digital magazine section — until people catch up on it. 

    We truly believe in synergy, the power coming from a group of individuals that, when working together, is much greater than the total power achieved by each one working separately, so we'd love to have you no matter what and to hear what you have to say, because any little contribution, idea, comment or share counts. 

    Join us, talk to us, and share the platform. Help us reach universities, professors, students and interpreters. You can start by sharing our campaign right now through any of the social media share-bottons Indiegogo makes available. The butterfly effect is very powerful, and you can never know the impact of a little gesture or a simple suggestion. As an example, one of our Twitter followers, Guillermo VG, sent a simple Tweet to a master's university in Spain recommending our platform. Weeks later, the dean of this university himself contacted us very interested in finding a way to cooperate. We still don't know what will come out of it, but it could actually be something huge, and it all started with a simple Tweet. 

    Rewards

    For all of you that decide to support our campaign, we have some great rewards ready that we hope you will enjoy. From Premium accounts, to exclusive T-shirts and notepads, to an online note-taking seminar in Spanish (by Tragora Formación) or a copy of Primeros pasos hacia la interpretación Inglés-Español, a great book by professor and researcher Mª Amparo Jiménez Ivars to guide you through your interpreting learning with great explanations of the evaluating system which our self-assessment sheets are based upon. 

    Universities will benefit from a unique deal with a Campus account half the price what it will cost after the campaign. This offer is only available for backers and will give access to up to 20 students over which a professor will have administration rights. Reduce the time you invest preparing your lessons while enhancing productivity, send and grade assignments easily, promote peer-to-peer assessment and turn your students into more independent learners and start doing all that now at a price you can't say no to.

    Shipping costs are included in every reward send to any country within the EU. 

    Interpretame.com impact

    In the few months that our beta version has been online, people from all over the world have visited the platform:

    Over 500 users have joined us. Have a peak at the top ten countries they come from:

     

    We've received very positive feedback and helpful recommendations from other professionals within the field.

    In addition, we have even been invited to present our platform at the next 2017 LiLETRAD Congress that will take place in Seville (Spain) from the 5th to the 7th of July.

    With your help, who knows where we can get!

    Thank you very much

story:
We are Nature's Way Montessori School

Our well-used and well-loved wooden playground structure has come to an end after serving kids ages 2 - 13 for thirty years.  We are in need of a new, safe play structure that will last another thirty. The placement of this structure will be within a wooded area filled with cedar trees and imagination. 

We have numerous volunteers who will be installing our new play structure, with the goal of having the new play structure installed before the school year ends on May 23rd. Funds have already been raised from bake sales, cookie dough sales, homemade wildlife t-shirts, and parent donations to pay for the delivery of the materials. 

The Design

The Upper Elementary students were given the task of creating a map of the current playground.  Based on the map the students created their "dream playground." This project included measuring and surveying and a lot of collaboration.  Students also interviewed current staff and students in order to initiate memories of play spaces, and asked them to visualize the play space they desired. The end result was a series of thoughts and feelings they had during play, childhood memories growing up on our current play structure, and pictures that span the last thirty years.  These memories will be incorporated into our new play structure.

The Details

The total amount needed to purchase the new play structure is $16,000.  The delivery cost of $2,500 has already been raised through smaller school-wide fundraisers.

As our way of saying thank you, you will receive one of the perks based on the amount of your donation.  All perks will be delivered in May 2017.

We are very excited for our community members, big and small to create new memories on our new "epic" play structure.

Thank you for your support!

P.S. Please share our campaign far and wide using the Indiegogo share tools (Facebook, Twitter, YouTube, and Web)!
story_txt:
We are Nature's Way Montessori School
Our well-used and well-loved wooden playground structure has come to an end after serving kids ages 2 - 13 for thirty years.  We are in need of a new, safe play structure that will last another thirty. The placement of this structure will be within a wooded area filled with cedar trees and imagination. 
We have numerous volunteers who will be installing our new play structure, with the goal of having the new play structure installed before the school year ends on May 23rd. Funds have already been raised from bake sales, cookie dough sales, homemade wildlife t-shirts, and parent donations to pay for the delivery of the materials. 
The Design
The Upper Elementary students were given the task of creating a map of the current playground.  Based on the map the students created their "dream playground." This project included measuring and surveying and a lot of collaboration.  Students also interviewed current staff and students in order to initiate memories of play spaces, and asked them to visualize the play space they desired. The end result was a series of thoughts and feelings they had during play, childhood memories growing up on our current play structure, and pictures that span the last thirty years.  These memories will be incorporated into our new play structure.
The Details
The total amount needed to purchase the new play structure is $16,000.  The delivery cost of $2,500 has already been raised through smaller school-wide fundraisers.
As our way of saying thank you, you will receive one of the perks based on the amount of your donation.  All perks will be delivered in May 2017.
We are very excited for our community members, big and small to create new memories on our new "epic" play structure.
Thank you for your support!
P.S. Please share our campaign far and wide using the Indiegogo share tools (Facebook, Twitter, YouTube, and Web)!

story:
What & Why

I have been playing violin since I was 11. I always dreamed of becoming a performer. I went through 2 music degrees and countless festivals and teacher training seminars. I always knew that I wouldn't make money as a musician but I was passionate enough about performing that it felt worthwhile to me. When I got out, I realized that performing was only a small part of my daily life. I wanted a career where I would be respected and financially stable, while still doing something creative.

In October of last year I started to teach myself how to code. I already had some background with HTML/CSS so I worked on learning C, Javascript, and React. I was totally hooked and spent every morning practicing and coming up with projects. You can see what I've been up to here: www.kaitlinmoreno.com

My goal was to apply for a coding bootcamp that could bring me to the next level and prepare me for real job interviews. Many of them are not very hard to get into, and only require that you show interest and have the cash to back it up (usually around 10-20k.) As a musician, I knew that I wouldn't be able to pay this kind of tuition up front while not working. 

I started to look for programs that were more competitive and offered deferred tuition. That's when I found Grace Hopper. This bootcamp is part of Fullstack Academy and was created with the goal of eliminating the disparity of women in technology by providing a debt-free system. Students pay for their education only after receiving employment. 

The application process was pretty rigorous. I had to complete essays, take a coding exam, and go through a 2-part technical interview. I studied every day for months, went to meetups, and met tons of other code newbies online that gave me advice and helped me through the process. In March 2017 I found out that I was accepted!

Grace Hopper is a 13 week course (10 hours a day, 6 days a week) and provides extensive job search assistance. The program culminates in hiring day, where employers will see the projects I've been working on and I can connect one-on-one with companies. They have a large network of tech-entrepreneurs and startup leaders that will meet with graduates looking for their next career move. There is a dedicated placement team who will help improve my resume and online presence, prep for interviews, and connect with the right person inside companies I am interested in applying to.

What I Need & What You Get

This fund is for my living costs. I have saved enough for rent, but I'll need help with food/necessities/transportation in the city. It breaks down like this:

  • $2275 = $25/day groceries x 91 days
  • $363 = $121/month metro pass x 3 months
  • $362 = Help subsidize the rent I still have to pay back home in DC

I want to work for this. So I'm offering a couple of cool things:

  • $25 One logo design for your site
  • $50 A mini photoshoot at my location in Petworth. One person, 30min, 5 photos. Perfect for headshots.
  • $75 Logo design with 3 options. You get 1 edit.
  • $100 A single page responsive website. You send me all your material and I'll put it together.
  • $150 A 1 hr photo session, any location, up to 2 people, 15 photos.
  • $250 A 2 hr photo session, any location, up to 6 people, 50 photos. Great for family shoots.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this with anyone you think might be interested in some high quailty photos or logo design!

story:
Leadership Summer School:

 Where the magic happens!

 

Leadership Summer school is a dream that comes true. An innovative idea, an inspirational event that started from the burning desire of a few NGO members who wanted to empower their origin NGOs and its members with skills that will allow them to embrace their true potential and lead their NGOs.

Leadership Summer School (LSS) started the summer of 2008. Its first edition took place in Ankara where 60 participants and 15 trainers from different student Non-Governmental Organizations shared and learned from each other for 10 days.

Since then, LSS has continued taking place despite the challenges that occurred. This year, the 11th edition of LSS will take place next to Puvociai, Lithuania in the National Park of Dzūkija.

 

During 10 days, participants of LSS experience more than 50 hours of training and workshops designed to match their needs. The event has 4 distinct pillars:

1. Self leadership: Focus on the (leader) attitude, as well as the skills --> Self-reflection, discovering my passions, my strengths and my personal vision

2. Leading people: Focus on relationship building, trust and personal well-being of team members --> Emotional intelligence, (understanding others, giving emotional support), coaching, communication and motivation

3. Leading organizations/task/process: Focus on tools for leadership, skills needed for completion of tasks, accomplishment of goals, and the general effectiveness of the work group --> Group dynamics, project management, change management, public speaking, inspiring others and visionary thinking

4. Exchanging ideas: Focus on inspiring, empowering and challenging each other, providing participants opportunities to exchange ideas and to network --> Open space, LSS Inspire (LSSx), Inspirational session, time for socializing, post LSS activities (reunions etc.)

 

The best time to plant a tree is now!

Each year LSS has a different theme and a different goal to achieve. The 11th edition of LSS has the theme: “The best time to plant a tree” and the goal to transform the current event to a full learning experience for participants.

To achieve that goal the Supervisory Board of LSS would like to invite guest speakers who are innovative, inspirational and empowering prominent leaders to deliver a speech or a workshop and challenge the LSS participants beyond their limits. 

In order for us to achieve our goal, we are going to need YOUR help & support.

We would like to invite LSS fans/members from different student and youth organizations/former LSS trainers & participants/every single person on earth who likes or would like to get to know more about non-formal education to show us your Support by selecting one of the pledges you can see on the right side of this page.

Your support will help us cover:

  •   The travel expenses of 4 guest speakers up to 200€ and
  •   Their lodging for 3 days in Puvociai during Leadership Summer School 2018

In case, we won’t be able to achieve the goal we’ve set, we will still receive the funds donated from you and try to make the best out of them.

If you want to get to know us better:

LSS:
Youtube, 
Google+
Facebook

 

LSS as an inspirational empowering event for leaders and future leaders of international student organizations results in building of networks and makes positive societal impact.

LSS reach

Since 2008, the LSS project has reached about 500 participants from 50+ countries. We still have a lot of ground to cover but we are moving towards that direction.

 

Field of studies

Applications and participants of LSS come from various fields of studies.

The main ones being:

1. Engineering: 30%

2. Health (Medicine / Pharmacy): 30%

3. Bio-Engineering (Food, Forestry, and Agriculture): 10%

4. Business and Economics: 10%

5. Social sciences (Literature, Psychology): 10%

6. Others: 10%

 

NGO and Leadership Summer School

The organizations represented by the LSS participants throughout the years went up to 23. In total, LSS trained leaders for 45 different organizations since its creation.

After attending LSS, board members from EPSA, ESTIEM, IAAS and CFES were inspired to create an internal training system for their organizations.

 

Other Ways You Can Help!

Anyone and everyone can make an impact.

  • Make some noise about our project: like us on Facebook and tell your friend
  • Please also use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you, to each and every one of you for taking the time to read about LSS!

story:
For the Record: Activism and Civic Engagement

Austin Bat Cave is throwing a three day writing workshop for kids centered on op-ed writing with the intention of engaging our local youth community with ideas, information, questions, and discourse around journalism, activism, and civic engagement! The workshop will end with a panel Q&A featuring journalists, writers, and activists.

  • Panelists include activist DeRay McKesson, Washington Post Senior Editor at Large Ann Gerhart, and Pulitzer Prize-winning Chicago Tribune reporter David Jackson.
  • Contributors to this campaign will provide food for kids, access to the Texas Tribune newsroom and their journalists, and bring renowned journalists and activists to Texas to teach the students.
  • ABC has strong partnerships with local schools and nonprofits engaging with students from traditionally underserved and marginalized communities. We always seek to amplify their voices through our publishing platform. Select student pieces will be published on the Texas Tribune's op-ed section, TribTalk, and other pieces will be published in our annual anthology.

Panelists include activist DeRay McKesson, Washington Post Senior Editor at Large Ann Gerhart, and Pulitzer Prize-winning Chicago Tribune reporter David Jackson.
Contributors to this campaign will provide food for kids, access to the Texas Tribune newsroom and their journalists, and bring renowned journalists and activists to Texas to teach the students.
ABC has strong partnerships with local schools and nonprofits engaging with students from traditionally underserved and marginalized communities. We always seek to amplify their voices through our publishing platform. Select student pieces will be published on the Texas Tribune's op-ed section, TribTalk, and other pieces will be published in our annual anthology.

story:
We are the Contemporary Art, Photography, and Film departments at Etobicoke School of the Arts in Toronto, Ontario, Canada.

We have worked incredibly hard for the past seven years to build something thousands of people are very proud of - something widely considered to be the best in the world.  We are asking for your help because we have exceeded our ability to support our students' phenomenal growth.

Every year we host representatives from art schools across the globe who fly in from countries such as Hong Kong, Scotland, France and the USA to recruit our students.  Reps and students engage in meaningful conversations that can last an hour, during which the work is critiqued and relationships are formed that assist throughout the application process.  Our students will apply to as many as 20 schools in their pursuit of the best opportunities.   

Portfolio Day at ESA is the culmination of years of focused effort.  PD7 included 110 representatives from 64 post-secondary schools and programs from 3 continents and 5 countries, and resulted in millions of dollars in scholarship offers.  PD8 is even larger.  In 2014 we had 55 participating students, in 2015 we had 71 students involved, in 2016 we had 75 student participants, and this year we have more than 85 students in PD8.  As prices of materials rise and more people flock to the school to exceed their potential, we struggle to meet demand as our budgets do not increase.  In order to make PD8 function we need your help.

We are planning to raise at least $25000 with this campaign.  With that money we will be able to pay for the extraordinary work under way by our grade 12's, and support the much larger group of grade 11 students already planning for PD9, which should see 95 participants with between 25 and 50 works each.  That means we will pay for and exhibit 2500+ pieces in a show that lasts for one day.  Some things are inexpensive to make and others require outside assistance.  At even a low estimate of $50 per work we are running into amounts far surpassing what we seek through this project. 

One reason for making such large and elaborate art works is the direct translation to scholarships and artistic opportunities.  Even with the most significant offers, most of our grade 12 students are unable to afford attending international programs, and so we do everything we can to secure the funding required for their dreams to come true.  In the 7 years of Portfolio Day at ESA we have received approximately twenty five million dollars in total scholarship offers, none of which, unfortunately, is given to the program.

By taking on responsibility for all of these futures we are also helping to shape aspects of our future world.  PD7 reached a level of complexity and scale that exceeded our limits.  With PD8 larger in every way, and PD9 larger again, with an almost doubling of the number of participants in just a few years, we are accepting a responsibility that will require the support of a much larger community - one in which you can play a valuable role.

All of the money raised will go to support our kids in PD8 and PD9.  Your contribution will allow us to re-imagine what is possible by teenagers in high school.  We hope you will attend PD8 when it opens to the public at 7pm on Friday November 3rd, 2017.

You can support us by contributing to this campaign, by spreading the world about our fundraising efforts, and by following us on Instagram at esa_contemporary_art + esa__contemporary_photography + esa_film

Tax Receipts will be issued for all donations over $25

Thank you!!!

Please share this campaign and let as many people as possible know that the future of dozens of creative minds (and the entire world) will be positively and significantly altered by their support

story:
La comunidad educativa Tamujé Iwigara necesita su apoyo. Este hermoso proyecto educativo intercultural. Dona ya y ayúdanos a juntar $3,500 USD para becar a 10 niños rarámuri y mestizos de bajos recursos de la Sierra Tarahumara, para los meses de mayo y junio .

MATÉTERA BA!! (GRACIAS)

Comunidad educativa Tamujé Iwigara (significado: nuestro aliento de vida), es un proyecto intercultural que hemos venido construyendo distintas familias y personas que han colaborado comprometidas con la educación, y con hacer de Tarahumara un lugar de buen vivir. En él, ofrecemos educación de nivel prescolar y primaria a 32 niñ@s de la Sierra.

El sostenimiento económico del proyecto se lleva a cabo mediante la cooperación mensual de los padres de familia, que van desde los $50 pesos hasta los $1,300 pesos (según sus posibilidades), becas de particulares, eventos realizados por los padres de familias y equipo de trabajo, venta de calendarios del proyecto de arte Tamujé, entre otros donativos eventuales. 

El costo mensual real por niño es de $3,000 pesos, pero la situación de las familias, tanto Rarámuri como mestizas, es muy limitada en su mayoría.

Nuestra necesidad más sentida por el momento es conseguir 10 becas mensuales de $3,000 pesos para cada mes.  Esto, para nuestros niños rarámuri y mestizos de bajos recursos.   

Este dinero va destinado a varios rubros; Materiales utilizados día a día para realizar actividades creativas y dinámicas, para una mayor comprensión de los temas. De igual manera también se reparte para gastos fijos mensuales de agua, luz e internet dentro de nuestras instalaciones. También gastos que nos demanda nuestra granjita, donde contamos con animales como conejos, gallinas, borregos y puerquitos. Por último pero igual de importante, se destina para las salidas que organizamos al aire libre, así los niños tienen contacto con la naturaleza que los rodea y aprenden sobre ella.

Los que más estarán agradecidos serán nuestros niñ@s, al saber que más personas se interesan por seguir con la educación que responda al complejo entorno de la Tarahumara. 

Gracias a sus donaciones, seguiremos construyendo procesos de aprendizaje, que no sólo incrementen los conocimientos requeridos, sino que permitan generar un tejido comunitario, social, pacífico y digno, que produzca relaciones armónicas con el territorio y con todos los seres que en él habitan. Así asumiremos la diversidad cultural como un factor excelente de complementariedad y riqueza humana.

Hay muchas formas de ayudar:

Puedes ayudarnos y crear el cambio positivo con sólo difundir nuestra campaña usando las herramientas para compartir de Indiegogo :)


MUCHAS GRACIAS!
