story:
Since 2012,

Scientist of Tomorrow initiative (SOT) a seed that started to bud with a bunch of young students who took the responsibility to improve their community and deeply believe they can actually develop it under the supervision of Dr. Heba Mahmoud.

Whereas we crave to give the upcoming generation a better future and thus strongly believe the way to it needs better mindsets. Hence, SOT aims to raise youth's awareness about the current world challenges while empowering them through providing values, knowledge, and opportunities required to change their mindsets and turn them into critical & analytical thinkers motivated by ambition with the ability to solve such challenges.

Consequently, in order to achieve this ultimate goal, we started providing programs that are based on STEM educational system where we teach them research skills and creative thinking. In addition to providing lectures & trainings in multiple subjects such as Entrepreneurship, Personal branding, and Self-learning.

We are working on 4th, 9th, 16th, and 17th goals of the SDGs.  In this way, we build a future where there are much fewer problems and more opportunities for everyone. A future, with diversity without racism. A future where we see our students the scientists of tomorrow with creative minds building a green future.

Between 2012 and 2018,

We provided a lot of scholarships, internships, and opportunities to SOT's students by organizing Cairo Science and Engineering fair for four consecutive years, training more than 5000 students in the field of scientific research, achieving about 1500 hours and participating in National and International fairs where we won Golden Medals and Special Awards.

On 2018,

Unfortunately, We drew the last smile on the faces of our students.

SOT can't keep providing such opportunity to their students without your help. Support us to create The Scientist of Tomorrow.

Donate now for a better future for our kids.
story_txt:

Scientist of Tomorrow initiative (SOT) a seed that started to bud with a bunch of young students who took the responsibility to improve their community and deeply believe they can actually develop it under the supervision of Dr. Heba Mahmoud.
Whereas we crave to give the upcoming generation a better future and thus strongly believe the way to it needs better mindsets. Hence, SOT aims to raise youth's awareness about the current world challenges while empowering them through providing values, knowledge, and opportunities required to change their mindsets and turn them into critical & analytical thinkers motivated by ambition with the ability to solve such challenges.

story:
Welcome to the WeStryve funding campaign. WeStryve is a tech & developer community focused on learning and career progression. Helping newcomers to tech connect with experienced professionals for mentoring & sharing knowledge.

Anyone who is just starting out in code or even those who are knee-deep in the tech industry know the problem. Resources are disjointed and confusing. Blogs, articles, video tutorials, conferences, lectures, and other resources are scattered here there and everywhere. You also need to think about networking, which can lead to more suggestions, pointers, and tutorials. Exhausting!

We want to be able to facilitate the ease of resource sharing, creating and consuming. Helping people progress their skills and career.

 

WeStryve is supported by a few good people. We’re all on a part-time or volunteer basis and the funding will enable us to provide more support to the community.

We’re looking to raise £10,000 to help do this.

We’ve created some packages for our top supporters. From featuring in an exclusive supporters page to hot swag that will make you feel like you could code anything.

Your support would allow us to progress & grow the community, help more people, and squash some bugs.

Without the support of the community, it would be impossible to grow the platform. Get your face & name on our supporters page: https://westryve.com/sponsors

If you want to support us but financially you can’t (we know times are tough for most of us) you can always be a huge support by sharing our campaign on social media

story:
Short Summary

The Shular Institute is the first of its kind in the post-secondary education field. It is a community-based hospitality institute, developed to redefine the purpose of foodservice and business management through our modern global curriculum and diverse local sustainable culture. Founded by the first African-American Certified Master Chef  in the world, Daryl L. Shular, the Institute will deliver top-tier programming made for “The Modern Entrepreneur Chef and Hospitality Professional."

Our institute's mission is to develop future culinary industry leaders, through the unique integration of entrepreneurship and advanced modern culinary principles of education. Our students will receive the training, skills, and certifications needed to become gainfully employed and eventually leaders in the culinary industry at the fraction of the cost of a four-year college.

Our staff and unique offerings differentiate us from other culinary institutions. Our president, Daryl L. Shular is one of 68 Certified Master Chefs in the world and has earned over 200 awards and accomplishments. Chef Shular is passionate about creating the next leaders in the culinary and hospitality industry. Shular met his business partner and current vice president Sean Rush, a former marketing director with Le Cordon Bleu Colleges, seven years ago. They instantly recognized their shared passion for advancing culinary arts education. Together, they are building a top-tier, student-oriented program that will provide marketable skills to future generations.  

The financial burden of higher learning is daunting and students talented and passionate about culinary studies are often unable to pursue their dreams due to tuition costs.  At the same time, African-American businesses continue to be challenged with securing the critical funds meant to bridge the gap needed to start or scale operations.  Our goal of opening our school in the Fall of 2020 has been postponed until early 2021 as Covid-19 has greatly impacted our timeline. With your help, we can build a sustainable business while eliminating the financial obstacle for our most dedicated and talented future chefs and hospitality professionals.  

 

What We Did and What's Next

The Shular Institute has accomplished thus far:

We have secured a 7,100 square foot restaurant property in Metro Atlanta. We have invested in facility upgrades and stocked the kitchen 80% with stoves, freezers, refrigeration, pots, pans, and small wares. 

We are still in need of funds for the remaining projects and builds needed to be ready to open our doors to the students.  Below are the following ways that we will utilize the funds raised: 

Tuition Reduction Fund: $200,000 

  • (Partial to full scholarships for our culinary students in the first two years)

Equipment for Institute: $50,000

  • Uniforms and Tool Kits
  • 2 Tilt Kettles 
  • Combi-Oven 
  • Industrial Juicer 
  • Cutting Boards 

Growth Fund: $200,000

  • Student-run Food Truck
  • Facility and Technology Upgrades

 

Risks & Challenges

With any business, there is a risk.

Why are we opening an institute during Covid-19 while other businesses are closing? 

Answer:  We have to change the way culinary education is administered and the quality of students in the hospitality industry. So when the next big thing hits the hospitality industry we have skill-based and entrepreneurial-minded professionals in the industry to help it adjust and recover. 

 

Our programs will include:

Workforce Development and Apprenticeship-- Accelerated, character, and skill-based programs that fast track individuals into the culinary industry, some with a minor criminal history. 

Introduction to Culinary Arts Programs-- Classes for individuals who are passionate about learning and pursuing a career in culinary art fields.

Advanced 1 & 2-- Our unique hands-on educational programs for top-tier rising culinarians and those that seek professional development.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to contribute, that does not mean you cannot be a part of our mission. Spread the word about our unique Culinary Institute. Donations of equipment and supplies are always welcome.  Send a positive word of encouragement as we do our part to help the hospitality industry. 

 

FUN FACT: The pleats in a chef’s hat, back in the day, were said to represent the number of ways the chef wearing it could cook an egg — 100 pleats being the ultimate goal and badge of honor, denoting the skill, experience, and rank of the chef.

LET'S HELP OUR STUDENTS GET TO 100 PLEATS!

story:
Concept and history

We thank you for visiting the School of Joy at the Indiegogo page! Please select an advantage of reward to help us to implement the Emotional Intelligence program in English-speaking countries.

At The Enjoyed School, we work to promote a new way of educating children to be prepared for life. For this purpose, it will be essential that we incorporate an Emotional Intelligence education in  all schools and homes. We have already created 560 diversified resources in 14 projection fields, that can be programmed through all educational stages in schools and family environment. The Spanish-speaking countries are already enjoying our program and we believe that now is the time to implement it in the English-speaking countries. To achieve this important goal, we really need your help!

In 1983 Howard Gardner presented,  with his Multiple Intelligences Hypothesis, the possibility of existence of two types of intelligence, intrapersonal and interpersonal, in which emotions acquire significant importance. The concept of Emotional Intelligence was defined for the first time in 1990 by Mayer and Salovey. These authors defined emotional intelligence as "the ability to monitor the feelings and emotions of oneself and others, to discriminate between them and to use this information for the orientation of their own action and thinking." Years later, in 1995, Daniel Goleman published his first book, named "Emotional Intelligence," pointing out the urgent need 
of introducing into the schools, an emotional learning that is basic for everything that the present and future life of children entails. Since then multiple studies have shown that there is a clear relationship between Emotional Intelligence and mental health. It can be proven, then, that greater Emotional Intelligence leads to larger emotional well-being and produces better Mental Health.

We base Education in schools, institutes and universities in promoting the future professional success of children, adolescents and youth. Nevertheless, an investigation carried out in Europe, Asia and United States, with the implication of 121 organizations and the evaluation of millions of workers, offered a result that should make us think: 23% of professional success is due to our intellectual capacities and in 77% to our emotional skills. The research was endorsed by The Consortium for Research on Emotional Intelligence in Organizations, a consortium created by Daniel Goleman.

If we review the UNESCO Report of the International Commission on Education for the 21st Century (Delors, et al. 1996) we can read that the New Education that must face the 21st century should focus around four basic axes, which are defined as The four pillars of education:
1) Learning to know and learning to learn,  to take advantage of the possibilities offered by education throughout life.
2) Learning to do to empower the person to handle diverse situations.


Traditional Education has always prioritized the first two axes and it is time now to expand the focus also to the last two axes, giving them the relevance they deserve, which undoubtedly leads us back to give importance to the emotional intelligence learning. We should take into account that emotions are not only important pillars in the personal and social sphere, as many studies have already shown the influence of emotions in any learning, which also determines their involvement in the first two pillars.
 

With everything previously mentioned and so much more that we could read on this matter, don’t you think that it is really necessary to educate on Emotional Intelligence along all educational stages to facilitate a good development? And then, if emotional intelligence learning is so important in the professional environment, will it not be equally or more important in the personal, family and social life areas?

What we need and what you get

The Enjoyed School aims to raise 20,000 euros to hire people that will be in charge of content translations, building up a new web resource structure and for advertising and marketing. Click on one of the links in our offers and enjoy our resources to program and develop a very original and complete Emotional Intelligence Education for your children and / or students.

The Impact

The aim of The School of Joy is that all English-speaking countries can have access and enjoy a very original and complete range of resources to face an optimal Emotional Intelligence Education for children and teenagers.
Our resources have already been used successfully in all Spanish-speaking countries, both in schools and homes. Our Emotional Intelligence blog far exceeds one and a half million visits and our Facebook page exceeds 33,000 fans.
We have been working for the New Education that the world deserves for years and now we would also like to reach your country. Are you going to give us your support?

Risks and challenges

This is the first Indiegogo campaign of The Enjoyed School and we are excited and confident in achieving our goal. Deliveries are not difficult to meet, since all the resources offered already exist in Spanish and only need translation. All the benefits of the reward will be sent during the months of April and May

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share it with anyone and everyone you know through your social media net and also through the word of mouth, especially with parents and grandparents that have children at the age of 2 to 12. Anyone can help. Send texts and emails to family and friends, share the link of this crowdfund page. Thanks in advance for your support!

 

We also offer resources in Spanish. For more information CLICK HERE

Ofrecemos también los recursos en español. Para más información CLICA AQUÍ

And to enjoy the videos of presentation in Spanish of the projection fields CLICK HERE

Y para disfrutar de los videos de presentación en español de los campos de proyección CLICKA AQUÍ

We also offer The Program in Emotional Education for all the school cycles, for your school. For more information CLICK HERE

story:
imagiCharm is a colorful accessory designed for girls to customize directly from their mobile phones using programming.   

While imagiCharm has been designed for girls between 12 and 16 years, it can be enjoyed by anyone who wants to explore their creativity through programming and join our revolution of girls shaping the future with technology.  

 

Our story has been covered already by amazing people at Samsung Next, DI Digital, Breakit, Red Bull & many more! Even Tim Cook tweeted about us! 

 

PARENTS: Coding as a way to continue creating

Sara is an awesome mom from Stockholm who encouraged her daughter Linn to attend our beginner coding workshop where we tested our imagiCharm prototypes and app curriculum. Now a big fan and reoccurring workshop attendee, Linn is learning how to become a coding pro and loves programming fun projects with her friends. 

 

 

EDUCATORS: Bridging the gap between education and technology

Anurag works with bridging the gap between education and technology at Stockholm International School where he helps to design and facilitate technology initiatives within the curriculums. His students participated in a coding workshop with the imagiLabs team and were able to explore the imagiLabs app and imagiCharm during the prototype phase. Now becoming a reality, imagiCharm is a great product for all students to tangibly see the results of their code and express themselves creatively. 

 

 

 

 

So many colors. imagiCharm has 64 LED lights that can be programmed to light up in any color. It can take on new designs and shapes every day – even multiple times a day.

 

 

So many ways to attach it. The imagiCharm is white to ensure a perfect contrast with any pattern or shape you may program. Its attachment comes in different colors and you can make your own attachments, too.

 

 

So many different ways to wear it. Girls can wear imagiCharm on their backpacks, tote bags, purses or jackets. They can hang it on their keys, wear as a necklace, headband, and even earrings. It's an all-in-one accessory that’s different every day. 

 

 

Even your pet will love it.

 

 

 

imagiCharm uses Bluetooth so you can program it at home or on the go. No cables or previous programming experience are needed. The best part is that you do it all from your phone.

 

 

The imagiLabs app comes with basic tutorials to help you turn individual LED lights on, change their color, and even turn on multiple lights at the same time using loops. It’s a bit like learning how to put Lego blocks together. Once you know how they work, you’re ready to get creative with your own 8x8 grid. 

 

 

Anything is possible. If you can dream it, you can code it – because the opportunities with code are endless. 

Match your imagiCharm with your outfit.

Code an emoji to express how you feel. 

Program an animation.

Or even a game.

 

 

 

Learn: From beginner to advanced lessons, you will learn how to program in Python and receive instant feedback as the imagiCharm lights up with your newly learned code. Gamified and fun, you unlock new levels as you learn smart ways to use programming to create cool and complex designs.

 

 

Create: Use the newly learned concepts to create completely new shapes and patterns. You can create shapes, animations, small games or program notifications - all from the Python coding environment in the imagiLabs app. Once done, you check whether your code is correct and learn to debug just like professional programmers do. Save your creations to come back to them later. Once the Python syntax is mastered, there is no wrong way to use it. The same shape can be programmed in many ways, it’s just a matter of how many programming tricks you want to use!

 

Explore: Meet other girls who share your interest in technology and showcase your creations within our community. You can like, comment, tag, and even try out each other’s code! Community + collaboration = no sticky bug situations. Help each other code more complex creations and brainstorm crazy ideas together. 

 

 

Everything you need to become part of the creative coding revolution!

The imagiCharm comes with: 

  • an attachment
  • a charging cable
  • an instructions card 
  • All in a box full of love from the imagiLabs team. 

The learning content: 

  • Brain teasers, games, and coding challenges.
  • Individualised support from our team and the community if you get stuck.

 

imagiCharm device compatibility

The imagiCharm utilizes the imagiLabs application. The app works on mobile phones and tablets that run on the iOS or Android platform. The application is not compatible with Windows, Chrome or Kindle. 

Specific operating systems and device requirements are as follows:

iOS

  • iOS devices must have OS version 11.0 or higher. In other words, you must have one of the following compatible devices:
  • iPhone 5s+
  • iPad Pro 
  • iPad Air
  • iPad 5th generation+
  • iPad mini 2+

You can find a full list of compatible iPhone and iPad devices here and read more about how to identify your iPhone or iPad model.

Android

Android devices, while having OS 5.0 or higher, must have all of the following hardware in order to use the imagiLabs application: 

  • Bluetooth LE (4.0)
  • Distinct multi-touch touchscreen
  • WiFi capabilities

 

 

 

We adopted a user-centered approach right from the start. imagiCharm started as a participatory design research project at KTH Royal Institute of Technology in Stockholm, Sweden. We wanted to work together with girls to co-create the ultimate gadgets that they would want to use to learn programming.  

 

 

We learned four key things about teenage girls:

  • They love self-expression and customization
  • Tangible experiences are important to them 
  • Community is everything 
  • They prefer phones over computers 

 

 

 

We created prototypes for the imagiCharm and the app and in the process tested them with more than 200 girls. We used the results to further develop and create our final version of the imagiCharm.

 

 

 

If we want to solve this problem then we have to go to its root. There are tools for kids and for adults, but nothing just for teenage girls. Teenage girls want something relevant to their daily lives.

We are here to create that.

Call it the new tamagotchi or Lego of the “Snapchat generation”, the imagiCharm will change how society thinks about girls and women in tech. We are creating more than just an accessory. We are creating a movement of girls who want to shape the future of tech and change the world!

 

 

 

Expressing yourself creatively through code

Previously a primary school teacher, Paul Landers is now Head of Strategic Partnerships for Connect to Learn at Ericsson. Connect to Learn is a public-private partnership with the purpose to increase access to quality education, especially for girls, through life skills programs and the integration of technology tools and digital learning resources in schools. Our collaboration with Ericsson began during our incubation period at Ericsson ONE where we identified the opportunity for us to collaborate through our Creative Coding Module which is set to be offered by Ericsson's Connect to learn program globally in 2020. 

 

 
 

 

Currency, Taxes, and Customs

Conversions to USD shown for pledges, goals, stretch goals are approximate and not final. Please be aware that different conversion rates may apply based on your bank or credit card company.

The rewards will be shipped from Sweden. For the EU and the US, VAT and sales tax are included in the rewards. EU customers will not be charged any import taxes. For all other countries, taxes and duties may apply.

 

 

We could not have done this without the help of many friends and supporters: 

Elsa Landberg, Karin Ruiz, Alma Friberg, Ellie Pei, Emelie Walcott, Gabrielle Lestapier, Marek Bączyński, Morgan Edström, Martin Lundström, Björn Zakrisson, Magnus Schelin, Jonas Hörberg, Dan B., Mario Sanchez, Matilda George, Gemma Vall-llosera, Marwan Ayache, Tom Magnergård, Anjali Virmani Paul, Anurag Choudhary, Paul Landers, Michal Voráč, Silvia Istudor, Madhurya Kumaraswamy, Markus Granström, Giulia Turchetti, Robert Gordon, Russell Cooke, Nikolai Kozak, Neira Causevic, Christina Ntis, Sandor Albrecht, Laurynas Ruzgas, Daniele Vitali, Carmen Beltran, Bruno Marconi and Teodor Hultberg from Shout! Studio, James Pearse, Sara Karlin, Jared Schrieber, Nadja Ekblom and Ingrid Söderberg, Sammy Saldjoghi and Rickard Eklöf, Sofia Johansson, Sara Eriksson, Hedvig Ahlgren + the Sthlm startup & (female) founder community.

 

Partners

 

Our promise

We want to empower girls with the skills they need to create the technology of the future. Female-created tech has powerful potential to create a more inclusive future. There are so many ways to bring technology into the lives of teenage girls and we have many ideas for future products and partnerships, so imagiCharm is the first of many. 

We promise to teach you Python and spark your interest in technology by opening your eyes to all of technology’s opportunities. We promise to inspire you with strong female role models in tech. Finally, we promise you that we will not stop until we create a future coded by all. 

 

Keep following our journey

  • Press kit
  • Join our mailing list on the imagiLabs website 
  • Facebook
  • Twitter
  • Instagram
  • Snapchat

Get in touch with us at sayhi@imagilabs.se!

 

A HUGE THANK YOU FROM ALL OF US! We are so excited for imagiCharm to help girls shape the future with tech!

 

Risks and challenges

There are always risks that could delay the delivery of imagiCharm. However, we will do our absolute best to deliver imagiCharm on schedule and on spec.

We have carefully thought about the potential risks and accounted for them in our timeline, however, unexpected delays might arise. We will prioritise shipping quality product and not rush production and do everything in our power to stay on track.

If any delays or unexpected circumstances incur, you will be the first to know! This project is coming to life thanks to you and we want you to be part of every step of the process. So expect updates from us when things go well and when they do not. Meanwhile, our team will get to work and bring imagiCharm to life!
story_txt:
imagiCharm is a colorful accessory designed for girls to customize directly from their mobile phones using programming.   While imagiCharm has been designed for girls between 12 and 16 years, it can be enjoyed by anyone who wants to explore their creativity through programming and join our revolution of girls shaping the future with technology.   Our story has been covered already by amazing people at Samsung Next, DI Digital, Breakit, Red Bull & many more! Even Tim Cook tweeted about us!  PARENTS: Coding as a way to continue creatingSara is an awesome mom from Stockholm who encouraged her daughter Linn to attend our beginner coding workshop where we tested our imagiCharm prototypes and app curriculum. Now a big fan and reoccurring workshop attendee, Linn is learning how to become a coding pro and loves programming fun projects with her friends.   EDUCATORS: Bridging the gap between education and technologyAnurag works with bridging the gap between education and technology at Stockholm International School where he helps to design and facilitate technology initiatives within the curriculums. His students participated in a coding workshop with the imagiLabs team and were able to explore the imagiLabs app and imagiCharm during the prototype phase. Now becoming a reality, imagiCharm is a great product for all students to tangibly see the results of their code and express themselves creatively.     So many colors. imagiCharm has 64 LED lights that can be programmed to light up in any color. It can take on new designs and shapes every day – even multiple times a day.  So many ways to attach it. The imagiCharm is white to ensure a perfect contrast with any pattern or shape you may program. Its attachment comes in different colors and you can make your own attachments, too.  So many different ways to wear it. Girls can wear imagiCharm on their backpacks, tote bags, purses or jackets. They can hang it on their keys, wear as a necklace, headband, and even earrings. It's an all-in-one accessory that’s different every day.   Even your pet will love it.   imagiCharm uses Bluetooth so you can program it at home or on the go. No cables or previous programming experience are needed. The best part is that you do it all from your phone.  The imagiLabs app comes with basic tutorials to help you turn individual LED lights on, change their color, and even turn on multiple lights at the same time using loops. It’s a bit like learning how to put Lego blocks together. Once you know how they work, you’re ready to get creative with your own 8x8 grid.   Anything is possible. If you can dream it, you can code it – because the opportunities with code are endless. Match your imagiCharm with your outfit.Code an emoji to express how you feel. Program an animation.Or even a game. 
 

 
Learn: From beginner to advanced lessons, you will learn how to program in Python and receive instant feedback as the imagiCharm lights up with your newly learned code. Gamified and fun, you unlock new levels as you learn smart ways to use programming to create cool and complex designs.
 

 
Create: Use the newly learned concepts to create completely new shapes and patterns. You can create shapes, animations, small games or program notifications - all from the Python coding environment in the imagiLabs app. Once done, you check whether your code is correct and learn to debug just like professional programmers do. Save your creations to come back to them later. Once the Python syntax is mastered, there is no wrong way to use it. The same shape can be programmed in many ways, it’s just a matter of how many programming tricks you want to use!

 
Explore: Meet other girls who share your interest in technology and showcase your creations within our community. You can like, comment, tag, and even try out each other’s code! Community + collaboration = no sticky bug situations. Help each other code more complex creations and brainstorm crazy ideas together. 
 
 Everything you need to become part of the creative coding revolution!The imagiCharm comes with: 
an attachment
a charging cable
an instructions card 
All in a box full of love from the imagiLabs team. 
The learning content: 
Brain teasers, games, and coding challenges.
Individualised support from our team and the community if you get stuck.
 imagiCharm device compatibilityThe imagiCharm utilizes the imagiLabs application. The app works on mobile phones and tablets that run on the iOS or Android platform. The application is not compatible with Windows, Chrome or Kindle. Specific operating systems and device requirements are as follows:iOS
iOS devices must have OS version 11.0 or higher. In other words, you must have one of the following compatible devices:
iPhone 5s+
iPad Pro 
iPad Air
iPad 5th generation+
iPad mini 2+
You can find a full list of compatible iPhone and iPad devices here and read more about how to identify your iPhone or iPad model.AndroidAndroid devices, while having OS 5.0 or higher, must have all of the following hardware in order to use the imagiLabs application: 
Bluetooth LE (4.0)
Distinct multi-touch touchscreen
WiFi capabilities
   We adopted a user-centered approach right from the start. imagiCharm started as a participatory design research project at KTH Royal Institute of Technology in Stockholm, Sweden. We wanted to work together with girls to co-create the ultimate gadgets that they would want to use to learn programming.    We learned four key things about teenage girls:
They love self-expression and customization
Tangible experiences are important to them 
Community is everything 
They prefer phones over computers 
   We created prototypes for the imagiCharm and the app and in the process tested them with more than 200 girls. We used the results to further develop and create our final version of the imagiCharm.   If we want to solve this problem then we have to go to its root. There are tools for kids and for adults, but nothing just for teenage girls. Teenage girls want something relevant to their daily lives.We are here to create that.Call it the new tamagotchi or Lego of the “Snapchat generation”, the imagiCharm will change how society thinks about girls and women in tech. We are creating more than just an accessory. We are creating a movement of girls who want to shape the future of tech and change the world!   Expressing yourself creatively through codePreviously a primary school teacher, Paul Landers is now Head of Strategic Partnerships for Connect to Learn at Ericsson. Connect to Learn is a public-private partnership with the purpose to increase access to quality education, especially for girls, through life skills programs and the integration of technology tools and digital learning resources in schools. Our collaboration with Ericsson began during our incubation period at Ericsson ONE where we identified the opportunity for us to collaborate through our Creative Coding Module which is set to be offered by Ericsson's Connect to learn program globally in 2020.     Currency, Taxes, and CustomsConversions to USD shown for pledges, goals, stretch goals are approximate and not final. Please be aware that different conversion rates may apply based on your bank or credit card company.The rewards will be shipped from Sweden. For the EU and the US, VAT and sales tax are included in the rewards. EU customers will not be charged any import taxes. For all other countries, taxes and duties may apply.  We could not have done this without the help of many friends and supporters: Elsa Landberg, Karin Ruiz, Alma Friberg, Ellie Pei, Emelie Walcott, Gabrielle Lestapier, Marek Bączyński, Morgan Edström, Martin Lundström, Björn Zakrisson, Magnus Schelin, Jonas Hörberg, Dan B., Mario Sanchez, Matilda George, Gemma Vall-llosera, Marwan Ayache, Tom Magnergård, Anjali Virmani Paul, Anurag Choudhary, Paul Landers, Michal Voráč, Silvia Istudor, Madhurya Kumaraswamy, Markus Granström, Giulia Turchetti, Robert Gordon, Russell Cooke, Nikolai Kozak, Neira Causevic, Christina Ntis, Sandor Albrecht, Laurynas Ruzgas, Daniele Vitali, Carmen Beltran, Bruno Marconi and Teodor Hultberg from Shout! Studio, James Pearse, Sara Karlin, Jared Schrieber, Nadja Ekblom and Ingrid Söderberg, Sammy Saldjoghi and Rickard Eklöf, Sofia Johansson, Sara Eriksson, Hedvig Ahlgren + the Sthlm startup & (female) founder community. Partners Our promiseWe want to empower girls with the skills they need to create the technology of the future. Female-created tech has powerful potential to create a more inclusive future. There are so many ways to bring technology into the lives of teenage girls and we have many ideas for future products and partnerships, so imagiCharm is the first of many. We promise to teach you Python and spark your interest in technology by opening your eyes to all of technology’s opportunities. We promise to inspire you with strong female role models in tech. Finally, we promise you that we will not stop until we create a future coded by all.  Keep following our journey
Press kit
Join our mailing list on the imagiLabs website 

Facebook
Twitter
Instagram
Snapchat
Get in touch with us at sayhi@imagilabs.se! A HUGE THANK YOU FROM ALL OF US! We are so excited for imagiCharm to help girls shape the future with tech! Risks and challengesThere are always risks that could delay the delivery of imagiCharm. However, we will do our absolute best to deliver imagiCharm on schedule and on spec.We have carefully thought about the potential risks and accounted for them in our timeline, however, unexpected delays might arise. We will prioritise shipping quality product and not rush production and do everything in our power to stay on track.If any delays or unexpected circumstances incur, you will be the first to know! This project is coming to life thanks to you and we want you to be part of every step of the process. So expect updates from us when things go well and when they do not. Meanwhile, our team will get to work and bring imagiCharm to life!

story:
[version française en bas de page]

We believe that every child has the right to a free, high-quality education.

We believe that speaking english will help them achieve what they want to achieve in their life.

We believe that education is necessary for every kid to make positive changes in their lives and to break free from poverty.

This is the school with its two classrooms, at the moment. The goal is to build another building, to have four classrooms in total and hold computer classes.

Background

It is believed that over 20% of the population of Cambodia was killed by the Khmer Rouge during the Pol Pot genocide, between 1975 and 1979. Among those 20% were around 95% of the educated people of the country. This fact is important to understand how difficult it is to build a healthy and positive society on such roots. 

Today the country is slowly rebuilding and it is highly dependent on tourism, especially in the Bakong community, which is roughly 20 kilometers from the temples of Angkor. Tourism currently provides a great number of future employment opportunities. And for a career within the tourism industry, learning to speak English and use a computer is essential.


This is the reason why Poeuy Tiht and his wife, a villager of Bakong who had the chance to learn English as a teenager, decided to start a school in February 2014. The school, a non-profit organization, now provides a secure and happy environment for the children to learn. It offers free education to around two hundred impoverished children and young adults of the village community, many of whom are not able to attend Khmer school otherwise, because their families cannot afford the costs.

This project started around a year ago. Now it is necessary to think long-term. Because the future of this rural school will influence the future of the students.


What is happening ?

Teaching

It can be a challenging job, especially with a constantly changing team. Basically Poeuy, the director and founder of the school, and his wife are running this whole project by themselves, at times supported by volunteers, at times not. And this is a heavy job.This is the reason why he needs the support of volunteers and, even better, of a local teacher who could teach daily at the school and be the link between the volunteers.

It would cost $500 to buy enough teaching supplies and resources for the Khmer and volunteer teachers, and  $1000 to pay a local teacher for at least the first year.


Learning

  • English is essential for these children if they want to have job opportunities in their country today. At the moment there are seven classes during the day : two 2-hours classes in the morning, two 2-hours classes in the afternoon, one 1-hour class in the late afternoon, and two 1-hour evening classes. And even, at times, a French class in the late evening for some of the older children who want to learn French as well.


English learning supplies such as text books, exercise books, story books, pens, pencils, rubbers, paper and games will cost $500.

  • Having a computer course is the next plan for the school, as once these children can speak english AND use a computer, they will have many more opportunities and they will be able to take charge of their own future.

To get started with this class desks, tables, two whiteboards and more importantly, computers are necessary : $6000.


Building

It started to be necessary when classes had to be cancelled because of all the mosquitoes in the class area, especially during the rainy season. So Poeuy, with the help of local workers, started to build two classrooms. The students now have a concrete school, painted green, that consists of two classrooms with electricity, and a roof on them. And it is not over! He is now working on a volunteer house where the international volunteers could live while they teach here. 


When this is finished, the next big project is to build the new classroom to hold the computer course.

To buy the material and pay for local workers to help Poeuy build this classroom : $6200.


Sharing

We hope that our school can bring something to the village children, but also to the community. We would also like to become more active in our community by helping the families who need it. That means :
  • Planting trees for the families to have fruits to eat or sell.
  • Helping to fix the homes of those who need it.
  • Providing a water filter for each family in the village. Because a safe and healthy drinking water supply is necessary for everyone.
  • Buying bicycles for some students to make it easier for them to go to school.
  • Provinding rice drops to support some families, as rice is the main and most common food for every family in Cambodia.

All this we budgeted for $2300.

Who we are

Camille."I'm a former volunteer at the school. I think I never realised the power and impact of education before I entered a classroom in this school. I believe in these children and they made me want to believe in learning, because a lot of them have a pretty precise idea of what they want their life to be. And I truly hope that this school will help them to succeed."
Poeuy Tiht is the director of the school, and he's the one who started it. He had the chance to be able to take a weekend class to be certified as an english teacher in Cambodia. Along with his wife, his three daughters and Saneth, a young girl who lives with them so that she has access to a local khmer school, he lives in Tnol Trong and wants to get involved in his community.

We thank every little contribution that is made to this project, because every step is a step towards a better education for the children in the Bakong community. And if you cannot contribute financially, you are welcome to share our page. The more it's shared, the better chance we'll have to reach our goals!


****************************************************************************

Nous pensons que chaque enfant doit avoir accès à une éducation gratuite, libre, et de qualité.
Nous pensons que la maîtrise de l'anglais aidera les élèves de notre école à accomplir leurs rêves.
Nous pensons qu'une bonne éducation est nécessaire afin que chaque enfant puisse prendre en main son avenir.

Notre idée


De nombreux enfants du village ont perdu un ou plusieurs de leurs
parents. Beaucoup d'entre eux ont perdu leurs pères dans l'armée. Dans les villages, les conditions de vie sont aujourd'hui encore précaires, et nombreuses sont les mères qui ne peuvent pas allaiter leurs nouveaux-nés, et sont
contraintes de les nourrir avec de l'eau de riz.

Le Cambodge aujourd'hui est très dépendant du tourisme, qui donne aux jeunes cambodgiens un grand nombre d'opportunités d'emplois. Pour avoir accès à une carrière dans le tourisme, savoir parler anglais et utiliser un ordinateur est nécessaire. Et si les villes principales sont pourvues d'écoles de qualité, beaucoup d'écoles rurales n'ont pas la chance d'être équipées du matériel nécessaire à un apprentissage complet.

Nous considérons que les enfants issus de zone rurales ne devraient pas être lésés en matière d'éducation, c'est pourquoi nous avons ouvert une école en février 2014 dans une zone rurale, proche de Siem Reap et des temples d'Angkor.  L'école, une
organisation non-gouvernementale, apporte aux enfants un environnement d'étude agréable et sûr. Nous donnons accès à des cours d'anglais gratuits à près de deux cent enfants et jeunes adultes de la communauté, qui souvent ne peuvent pas aller à l'école khmer par manque d'argent.

Ce projet a débuté il y a environ un an et nous nous sommes concentrés jusqu'ici sur les cours au quotidien. Mais notre volonté est désormais d'avoir une vision à long terme et de s'engager pour l'avenir, car du futur de notre école dépend le futur de nos jeunes élèves.

Nos actions


Enseigner


L'enseignement peut-être une activité difficile, d'autant plus dans une équipe aussi changeante. Poeuy, le directeur et créateur du projet, aidé de sa femme, dirige seul l'ONG, épaulé parfois par des volontaires internationaux venus donné des cours d'anglais, parfois complètement seul. Une tâche qui représente une importante charge de travail.

Poeuy fait appel à des volontaires internationaux qui assistent ou organisent les cours d'anglais. Pour une meilleure organisation des cours et un meilleur suivi des élèves, le professeur a besoin de matériel éducatif, de manuels et de méthodes.

Acheter des manuels et du matériel éducatif pour les enseignants : 500 $

Payer un enseignement cambodgien pour assurer un suivant permanent des élèves et faire le lien entre volontaires durant un an : 1000 $

Apprendre


L'anglais est une langue capitale pour ces enfants s'ils veulent s'ouvrir à plus d'opportunités d'emploi dans leur pays. Les élèves, âgés de 4 ans pour les plus jeunes débutants, à 22 ans pour les plus âgés du cours avancé, assistent aux cours gratuitement et quotidiennement s'ils le souhaitent et le peuvent. Leur enthousiasme dans le processus d'apprentissage rend chaque cours interactif et dynamique.

Acheter des cahiers, stylos, crayons, gommes, du papier et du matériel à
destination des enfants : 500 $

Notre prochain projet : apprendre à tous les enfants l'utilisation basique et professionnel d'un ordinateur. Traitement de texte, création d'une boîte mail, envoi de courriels, utilisation simple d'excel, recherche google, etc. Toutes ces activités qui nous sont devenues évidentes mais qui sont étrangères à la plupart des jeunes de cette école. Ces cours sont un passage obligé pour eux : ils n'ont pas d'autre moyen d'avoir accès à un ordinateur.

Pour commencer ce cours, acheter des tables, des chaises, des tableaux
weleda, et surtout des ordinateurs : 6000 $

Construire


Commencer la construction de salles de classe "en dur" est devenu nécessaire quand les moustiques empêchaient les cours du soir d'avoir lieu. Poeuy, accompagné de travailleurs locaux, a donc construit deux salles de classe qui
servent désormais pour les cours d'anglais. Une maison permettant d'accueillir les volontaires est également en cours de construction. La prochaine étape, c'est la construction de deux nouvelles salles de classe pour accueillir les cours d'informatique.

Acheter le matériel, payer les artisans locaux, pour bâtir les nouvelles
salles de classe : 6200 $

Partager


Nous souhaitons que notre école sache s'intégrer dans son environnement rural et dans la communauté dont nous faisons partie, en participant à son développement et en aidant les familles qui en ont besoin. C'est pourquoi nous souhaitons mettre en place des actions soutenant la communauté.

  • Planter des arbres fruitiers qui seront une source de nourriture ou de revenus pour les familles les plus dépendantes.
  • Réparer les maisons endommagées.
  • Distribuer des filtres dans les foyers pour purifier l'eau afin de la rendre potable.
  • Acheter des vélos pour les familles n'en disposant pas afin de permettre
    aux enfants d'aller à l'école librement.
  • Fournir des semences de riz aux familles les plus démunies, le riz étant
    la nourriture de base la plus commune au Cambodge.

Tous ces projets d'intégration nous coûteront autour de 2300 $.


Notre motivation

Camille "J'ai été volontaire à l'école. C'est dans cette école, la première fois,que j'ai vraiment compris l'importance de l'éducation. Je crois en cette école, je crois en ces enfants parce que Poeuy croit en eux et qu'eux font preuve d'un enthousiasme qui ne peut que leur permettre de réussir. A mon retour en France, j'ai voulu contribué au travail de Poeuy en lui envoyant  un colis de fournitures scolaires. Et puis j'ai pris conscience qu'il savait mieux que moi de quelles fournitures il avait besoin. Que ce qu'il lui fallait à présent, c'était avoir toutes les cartes en main pour organiser le futur de son école au mieux. Je lui ai proposé d'organiser ce projet de financement pour qu'il puisse prendre en main, seul ou avec ses élèves, le futur de son école."

Poeuy est le directeur et le créateur de l'école. Il vit à Tnol Trong avec sa femme, ses trois filles et Saneth, une fillette de 12 ans qui vit avec eux afin d'avoir un accès plus facile à l'école locale khmer. Il a eu la chance de pouvoir assister à un cours à Siem Reap, les weekends, ce qui fait de lui  un professeur d'anglais aujourd'hui certifié.

The more it's shared, the better chance we'll have to reach our goals!****************************************************************************Nous pensons que chaque enfant doit avoir accès à une éducation gratuite, libre, et de qualité.Nous pensons que la maîtrise de l'anglais aidera les élèves de notre école à accomplir leurs rêves.Nous pensons qu'une bonne éducation est nécessaire afin que chaque enfant puisse prendre en main son avenir. Notre idée De nombreux enfants du village ont perdu un ou plusieurs de leurs parents. Beaucoup d'entre eux ont perdu leurs pères dans l'armée. Dans les villages, les conditions de vie sont aujourd'hui encore précaires, et nombreuses sont les mères qui ne peuvent pas allaiter leurs nouveaux-nés, et sont contraintes de les nourrir avec de l'eau de riz. Le Cambodge aujourd'hui est très dépendant du tourisme, qui donne aux jeunes cambodgiens un grand nombre d'opportunités d'emplois. Pour avoir accès à une carrière dans le tourisme, savoir parler anglais et utiliser un ordinateur est nécessaire. Et si les villes principales sont pourvues d'écoles de qualité, beaucoup d'écoles rurales n'ont pas la chance d'être équipées du matériel nécessaire à un apprentissage complet.  Nous considérons que les enfants issus de zone rurales ne devraient pas être lésés en matière d'éducation, c'est pourquoi nous avons ouvert une école en février 2014 dans une zone rurale, proche de Siem Reap et des temples d'Angkor.  L'école, une organisation non-gouvernementale, apporte aux enfants un environnement d'étude agréable et sûr. Nous donnons accès à des cours d'anglais gratuits à près de deux cent enfants et jeunes adultes de la communauté, qui souvent ne peuvent pas aller à l'école khmer par manque d'argent. Ce projet a débuté il y a environ un an et nous nous sommes concentrés jusqu'ici sur les cours au quotidien. Mais notre volonté est désormais d'avoir une vision à long terme et de s'engager pour l'avenir, car du futur de notre école dépend le futur de nos jeunes élèves. Nos actions Enseigner L'enseignement peut-être une activité difficile, d'autant plus dans une équipe aussi changeante. Poeuy, le directeur et créateur du projet, aidé de sa femme, dirige seul l'ONG, épaulé parfois par des volontaires internationaux venus donné des cours d'anglais, parfois complètement seul. Une tâche qui représente une importante charge de travail. Poeuy fait appel à des volontaires internationaux qui assistent ou organisent les cours d'anglais. Pour une meilleure organisation des cours et un meilleur suivi des élèves, le professeur a besoin de matériel éducatif, de manuels et de méthodes. Acheter des manuels et du matériel éducatif pour les enseignants : 500 $Payer un enseignement cambodgien pour assurer un suivant permanent des élèves et faire le lien entre volontaires durant un an : 1000 $ Apprendre L'anglais est une langue capitale pour ces enfants s'ils veulent s'ouvrir à plus d'opportunités d'emploi dans leur pays. Les élèves, âgés de 4 ans pour les plus jeunes débutants, à 22 ans pour les plus âgés du cours avancé, assistent aux cours gratuitement et quotidiennement s'ils le souhaitent et le peuvent. Leur enthousiasme dans le processus d'apprentissage rend chaque cours interactif et dynamique. Acheter des cahiers, stylos, crayons, gommes, du papier et du matériel à destination des enfants : 500 $ Notre prochain projet : apprendre à tous les enfants l'utilisation basique et professionnel d'un ordinateur. Traitement de texte, création d'une boîte mail, envoi de courriels, utilisation simple d'excel, recherche google, etc. Toutes ces activités qui nous sont devenues évidentes mais qui sont étrangères à la plupart des jeunes de cette école. Ces cours sont un passage obligé pour eux : ils n'ont pas d'autre moyen d'avoir accès à un ordinateur.  Pour commencer ce cours, acheter des tables, des chaises, des tableaux weleda, et surtout des ordinateurs : 6000 $ Construire Commencer la construction de salles de classe "en dur" est devenu nécessaire quand les moustiques empêchaient les cours du soir d'avoir lieu. Poeuy, accompagné de travailleurs locaux, a donc construit deux salles de classe qui servent désormais pour les cours d'anglais. Une maison permettant d'accueillir les volontaires est également en cours de construction. La prochaine étape, c'est la construction de deux nouvelles salles de classe pour accueillir les cours d'informatique. Acheter le matériel, payer les artisans locaux, pour bâtir les nouvelles salles de classe : 6200 $ Partager Nous souhaitons que notre école sache s'intégrer dans son environnement rural et dans la communauté dont nous faisons partie, en participant à son développement et en aidant les familles qui en ont besoin. C'est pourquoi nous souhaitons mettre en place des actions soutenant la communauté.
Planter des arbres fruitiers qui seront une source de nourriture ou de revenus pour les familles les plus dépendantes.

Réparer les maisons endommagées.

Distribuer des filtres dans les foyers pour purifier l'eau afin de la rendre potable.

Acheter des vélos pour les familles n'en disposant pas afin de permettre aux enfants d'aller à l'école librement.

Fournir des semences de riz aux familles les plus démunies, le riz étant la nourriture de base la plus commune au Cambodge.

Tous ces projets d'intégration nous coûteront autour de 2300 $.Notre motivation 
Camille "J'ai été volontaire à l'école. C'est dans cette école, la première fois,que j'ai vraiment
 compris l'importance de l'éducation. Je crois en cette école, je crois 
en ces enfants parce que Poeuy croit en eux et qu'eux font preuve d'un 
enthousiasme qui ne peut que leur permettre de réussir. A mon retour en France, j'ai voulu contribué au travail de Poeuy en lui envoyant  un colis de fournitures scolaires. Et puis j'ai pris conscience qu'il savait mieux que moi de quelles fournitures il avait besoin. Que ce qu'il lui fallait à présent, c'était avoir toutes les cartes en main pour organiser le futur de son école au mieux. Je lui ai proposé 
d'organiser ce projet de financement pour qu'il puisse prendre en main, seul ou avec ses élèves, le futur de son école."
Poeuy est le directeur et le créateur de l'école. Il vit à Tnol Trong avec sa femme, ses trois filles et Saneth, une fillette de 12 ans qui vit avec eux afin d'avoir un accès plus facile à l'école locale khmer. Il a eu la chance de pouvoir assister à un cours à Siem Reap, les weekends, ce qui fait de lui  un professeur d'anglais aujourd'hui certifié.

story:
Hi !
My name is Grimm, I'm 24 years old  and I study Permaculture.
Since last summer I have a Van, which I named Lucy July August.
I am currently repairing this vehicle so I can rebuild this van into a Tiny Low Impact Permaculture Van.
Basically: a home on wheels that provides for most of my needs and offers a nomadic independent lifestyle with a low environmental impact through intelligent design of individual systems and the vehicle/home as a whole. 
This vehicle will be my home for the next years and I will visit and volunteer at eco-communities and permaculture projects all over Europe. The goal of this journey is to learn about permaculture and share this knowledge with the community by an online free database with information about permaculture designs, elements, systems and everything else I encounter on the road. 
All this information will be shared for free on the web so this knowledge can be used by others for their projects and the permaculture Van can return energy to the whole community ! 

I am also a photographer, and I can only dream about the amazing photographs I will be able to take on this adventure. 
I will be sharing tons of  videos and photos from my  digital camera and from my Wooden Camera Box (checkitout!) . 

If you would like to find out more about the van, have a look on it's own blog www.lucyjulyaugust.com or hear the latest news on the permaculture van's Facebook page !

Find photo's of the Van , the perks and myself at the end of this page =)

***----------------------------------10cm X 10cm = 10€ !----------------------------------***


SPECIAL GIFT ! You can own 10cm x 10cm of the Van's outside wall ! 

It can be a logo or a URL, a stencil of your mum, a loveletter, anything goes !
I can paint,spray or write on it, or we can put a sticker, or do something completely different . 

If you are around,come and make it yourself ! I'll organise multiple events in Belgium or we can meet up! Ff you live too far I'll mail you a superawesome thank you card with a photo of your contribution :-)  

The van is divided in squares of 10cm x 10cm each with a own number.
All numbers are in the magic hat, so a random location is picked.
You can also get multiple adjacent squares and occupy a bigger surface of the Van for extra visibility ! 

All squares stay for AT LEAST 2 YEARS and will be seen by thousands of people everywhere in Europe =) 

To get your own piece of Van wall , choose the 10cm x 10cm perk on the right of this text. 
IF YOU DON'T HAVE PAYPAL OR A CREDITCARD 
it is possible to send me a donation on my Belgian bank account OR donate to me in person if you see me ! 
I will then contribute your donation to this account using my own creditcard but with your name and email address (this is how Indiegogo suggests to solve this issue). 
Please don't forget to write in the bank transfer :
-'Indiegogo' 
- Your name and email adress 
- Which perk you would like to receive and your shipping adres .

Bank transfer donations details : 
Grimm Van Gestel - Antwerp - Belgium 
Iban :  BE42 0013 8848 2854
Bic :  GEBABEBB


***--------------------------THE--STORY--IN--LONG-------------------------------------***

The van is a permaculture project. 

How can you redesign a vehicle to provide a home that supplies you with most of your daily needs, able to stay off-grid for periods of time, search interaction and balance with all 5 elements (water-earth-energy-air-community) AND do this all as environmentally friendly as possible while being as independent as possible from big corporations ? 
That's where permaculture comes in. In permaculture design, we create smart energy efficient systems where elements interact in a mutually beneficial way to produce a greater whole.
Practically it means observing, designing and building systems to provide with my basic everyday needs at a low environmental impact.

It has to be said, the van is a 3 liter diesel engine that requires fuel to drive and thus it also pollutes the environment. As the goal of living in the Van is to become more self aware and sufficient, I aim to compensate for this pollution with a reduction in personal ecological impact. I am also investigating how to reduce the exhaust pollution by the usage of filters, and I will adapt the vehicle so it is possible to run on biodiesel made from waste cooking oil (more on this in a later post !) 

- The van will be my only home full-time for the next years. 
I will have the comforts of a traditional home, but everything is just tinier and I will have to use my resources such as power or water wisely. Living with limited resources and space will force me to re-think my choices and habits, and adapt where necessary. 

- The van is a transport vehicle.
For the next years I will be visiting permaculture projects and communities all around Europe, to learn about them and their projects. 
By volunteering at various communities, I hope to learn tremendous amounts and become a better permaculture designer ! 
I will keep an active blog and 'database' of permaculture projects, designs and systems for everyone to access freely. This way we could learn from each other experiences,  and extend the communal knowledge.

- The van is BIG.
Lucy July, the Van, is a Mercedes-Benz 409D born in 1985 a good 6m long, 3m high 2,3m wide and 3ton heavy. She's been converted to a mobilhome camper for 5 people, fitted with everything you need including a small bathroom ! 
August is the engine, a famous OM617 motor. 
These cars are known for driving over 1 million km's and they are perfect for driving on biodiesel from recycled oil ! 

- The van is a personal lifestyle experiment.
I will monitor closely how much resources I consume, how much garbage I produce, even how much poop I make ! 
By reducing my needs, my consumption and my garbage, I will see how such a nomadic lifestyle can influence my ecological footprint, compared to my previous urban lifestyle. 
Reduce - Reuse - Recycle !

- The van prefers home made biodiesel above fossil fuels. 
One of the main points of the conversion, is to seek independence of big oil companies. I will source used cooking oil (a waste product), filter it and convert it into biodiesel for driving the Van as much as I can.
Driving on biodiesel produces less greenhouse gasses, and I'm using a local resource that would otherwise become waste.
Making my own fuel forces me also to engage with the local community.
One other aspect of this goal is the law. It is often illegal to drive on fuels that aren't regulated and especially taxed. It is possible in some countries and on private terrain. Recycling waste oil to a resource should be encouraged in my opinion. 
Realistically, I don't think I can find enough oil while travelling to drive ONLY on home made biodiesel, but I sure will try ! 

- The van serves the community.
Not only will the community benefit through the information shared online, the van will also be used for teaching introductions to permaculture in all kind of places I go. It can be a mobile outdoor classroom ! 
Ofcourse I will be giving a lot of rides and sleep-over places (always pick up hitchhikers!) , and I want to form a driving seedbank to exchange plant and vegetable seeds, acting as a steel pollinator between communities.

- The van is technical experiment. 
I will test all my technical skills repairing and converting this Van, a lot of the systems will be experimental and DIY ! Self made water boilers, solar panels, washing machines, everything needed will pass the stage and all this info will be available on the blog. This way you can even build your own permaculture van! 

- The van doesn't like big company's that suck your soul. 
This will be a hard but necessary part of the transition. I want to consume less ! 
That means : finding other ways to get food, for example bartering, volunteering, dumpsterdiving and so on. Recovered clothes and other recycled goods will be the first choice, and if money is involved , it will be used locally to people who can use it instead of shareholders and off-shore tax paradises. 

- The van needs you ! 
Lucy July August sure is one hell of a ride if it all works out, and that's where I really need your help ! 

All my savings went to the purchasing and repairing of the Van to get it back on the road. 
I have been estimating how much budget I still need in order to get the last repairs done, purchase the materials necessary for the various systems to make this home a low impact permaculture van and the Indiegogo perks and fee's,  
The total estimated amount of funding I need is 4000€.  
This amount will go to the replacing of the molded walls, the building of an electrical system , the compost toilet , the heat exchanger from engine, a water filtering system, DIY solar panels and so on. 

This sounds like a big amount, but consider that I will be making almost everything myself, I will use recycled or 2th hands goods where ever possible , and it's actually peanuts compared to building a house !
 If I would not obtain the 4000€ needed, the Permaculture Van project will still go on with the funds acquired, but everything will take a little more time as I will have to work and save longer.
In the unlikely case that more as the estimated 4000€ is collected, the surplus will be saved as an emergency car breakdown fund and it will help to pay a mentor on my way to my permaculture diploma ! 

Currently I aim to have everything ready and start travelling by November 2015 and be at least 2 years on the road, and if the feeling is good , even longer ! 

What do you get back ? 

In exchange for your support as a community, I will give back tons of information about permaculture , it's systems and living in a camper.  
I'll be able to tell and teach others about permaculture as a way to live, I will be helping communities and their projects and assist in their permaculture design. 
All systems in these communities, such as greywater treatment or composting systems will be investigated, documented and shared for others to learn ! 
In the long term, it is the aim to develop a sort of database with info about all different permaculture systems and solutions, while providing travelers and wwoofers some more information about a community :) 
Everything will be freely available via the web , and one day, I hope to publish a book of these experiences.  

Also have a look at my unique perks, found here on the right side ! 
As an artist and crafter , I will provide you contributors with nice and one of a kind gifts. I will update more about the different perks (with photos) in the near future , contact me if anything is unclear ! 


How to help ?

You could help in many way's !
If you can, please consider a donation for this campaign and feel free to choose one of the perks on the right side, I hope you like them ! 
Sharing this campaign with friends and family via social media is always fantastic ! 

All help is deeply appreciated ! 

Bless <3 

 

Lucy July August !

You can own and customize a part of his beauty on wheels ! 

Me and my Afghan Box Camera. 

Lasercut Jewerly box , available as perk ! 

A lasercut mandala from my own design ! 

Vinyl mandala stickers available as perk ! 

CONTACT ME AT : GRIMM.VG(at)GMAIL.COM

story:
Our mission: to build a movement to promote personal, community, and environmental health (a.k.a. “3-Dimensional Health”)

Who we are: a nimble, creative, and collaborative organization that empowers audience members to experiment and create

What we provide:

  • Entertaining presentations with information tailored to specific audiences
  • Online resources to support personal health experiments and service learning projects
  • Music and t-shirts promoting behaviors like eating well and being physically active

Initial target audience: adolescents in the Casco Bay area and resource-limited parts of Maine

Key things we promote:

  • Understanding how personal, community, and environmental health interrelate
  • Fueling well with vegetables; some protein at each meal; fat from nuts, seeds, and unrefined oils; moderate carbohydrates (minimal sugars and refined carbs); and lots of filtered tap water
  • Regularly engaging in fun and varied physical activities
  • Conducting useful personal health experiments
  • Creating service learning projects or joining ongoing efforts to build community or environmental health

About Tyson Weems (CEO, founder, presenter, graphic and web designer, music writer/producer)

I’ve long sought a way to use my passions for positive effect. The concept for this project arose in 2003 and was the reason I got a masters degree in Health and Human Development at Montana State. It was also why I moved back to Maine, where I could use social and professional networks to strengthen it. I’ve spent much of the last 12 years developing skills and materials to maximize its impact. Acquiring sufficient funding is now a top priority so that it can deliver in a big way.

Health-related Background

  • Coach: CrossFit, baseball, basketball, X-C skiing, whitewater rafting (guide)
  • Registered dietitian
  • Competitive athlete: CrossFit, high school and college basketball, X-C skiing, high school and Legion baseball
  • Recreational athlete: snowboarding, tennis, whitewater riverboarding, and beach volleyball

Educational Background: 

  • University of Northern Colorado Distance Dietetics Internship Program 2008 
  • Montana State University (MS in health and human development) 2007 
  • Bowdoin College (BA in sociology and environmental studies) 2000
  • Phillips Exeter Academy 1995 
  • Brunswick High School 1994

Current Home: Portland, Maine

The campaign goal: raise $10K (of $50K this year) in order to do 4 things by next winter:

  • Complete an album of songs promoting healthy behaviors (see the video for two example clips)
  • Purchase equipment to give presentations to large audiences (e.g., speakers, microphones, a projector, and a big screen)
  • Create curriculum materials to use with presentations that can integrate with existing health ed programs
  • Make 30 presentations in New England for groups with limited resources, including schools, camps, or after school programs (including gas and insurance)

Update: we just secured a challenge grant to match donations made in February and March! This doubles the impact of your donation!

Raising the funds to meet these objectives will have immediate impacts on Maine communities and set the stage for much more. Kids will better understand that daily choices impact how they feel and have consequences for others and the natural world as well. Many will act to make their impacts more positive through personal health experiments and projects. A quick way for them to start: providing us with feedback about how effectively we share ideas (a part of every presentation).

Expanding operations and reaching larger audiences means more kids and others recognizing how crucial it is that we take care of ourselves and what sustains us. We’ll continually hone our message and materials and ideally add a service learning project coordinator in the near future. That will allow for supporting many more in taking responsibility for personal, community, and environmental health. We’re serious about the whole movement thing.

Should we come up short in this drive, we'll scale back the number of presentations given to schools without outside speaker budgets this year and focus on alternative fundraising (e.g., through grants and corporate sponsorships).

Starting and operating a successful non-profit is no small feat. Luckily I have a supportive family, professional network, and talented advisory team. Plus we’re starting in Maine, where teachers and others with whom I’ve spoken are generally psyched about this project happening. This project is the culmination of much of what I've done academically, musically, and athletically in my life. After 11 years of specific preparation and development (and some related project work), it's GO TIME.

For more video clips and pictures: see the Gallery (menu button at the top of this page)

If you’re not in a position to contribute $, other ways to support us include:

  • Telling others about this fundraiser, such as by using the Indiegogo share tools (or sharing the link to this page  http://igg.me/p/rise-of-the-3d-health-alliance/x/8643152)
  • Liking us on Facebook (http://www.facebook.com/3dhealthalliance)
  • Letting us know about other organizations with which we might collaborate
  • Taking action to promote 3-D Health in your life (see our resources page for ideas: http://3dhealthalliance.org/resources/)

a movement to promote personal, community, and environmental health (a.k.a.
“3-Dimensional Health”)
Who we are: a nimble, creative, and collaborative organization that empowers audience members to experiment and create
What we provide:


Entertaining presentations with information tailored to specific
audiences


Online resources to support personal health experiments and service learning projects


Music and t-shirts promoting behaviors like eating well and
being physically active

Initial target audience: adolescents in the Casco Bay area
and resource-limited parts of Maine
Key things we promote: 


Understanding how personal, community, and environmental
health interrelate


Fueling well with vegetables; some protein at each meal; fat
from nuts, seeds, and unrefined oils; moderate carbohydrates (minimal sugars
and refined carbs); and lots of filtered tap water


Regularly engaging in fun and varied physical activities


Conducting useful personal health experiments

Creating service learning projects or joining ongoing efforts to
build community or environmental health

story:
Sind Sie es satt, Single zu sein?

Sehnen Sie sich nach der wahren Liebe?

Lernen Sie, wie Sie die wahre Liebe finden können! Ich bin Dolores Dimic  (*1968), Autorin von “Wie verliebt man sich richtig”. In meinem Buch, in Seminaren, Videokursen und Coachingsprogrammen führe ich Sie Schritt für Schritt zum richtigen Partner. Selbst habe ich auch einige Frösche geküsst, bis ich 2008 den Jackpot meiner Lebenslotterie gefunden habe. Wir leben glücklich auf einer kleinen Insel in den Niederlanden.

 

Als ich es satt war, mich immer wieder in den falschen Mann zu verlieben, habe ich eine Methode entwickelt, mit der ich meinen Lebenspartner gefunden habe. Diese Methode beschreibe ich in meinem Buch „Wie verliebt man sich richtig“.

 

 

Die Methode führt Sie Schritt für Schritt zum richtigen Partner. Sie funktioniert – nicht nur bei mir, sondern bei ehemaligen Singles in der ganzen Welt (vielen Dank an "meine" glücklichen Pärchen, deren Bilder ich im Video benutzen durfte!).

 

Wie funktioniert es?

Wir Menschen planen unsere berufliche Laufbahn, unseren Urlaub, einen Wohnungskauf. Aber bei der Partnersuche gehen viele planlos vor. Ich habe mich immer wieder in Männer verliebt, die auf den ersten Blick zu mir passten – und mir oft das Herz brechen lassen. Meine Methode hat mich und Singles in der ganzen Welt Schritt für Schritt zum richtigen Partner geführt. Bei mir dauerte es 6 Wochen, bis ich ihn gefunden hatte. Leser(Innen) meines Buches und Singles aus Seminaren haben ihren Partner innerhalb von 24 Stunden (!) bis 6 Monaten gefunden .
 

Was gibt es für Sie?

Buch „Wie verliebt man sich richtig”

Das Buch "Wie verliebt man sich richtig" beschreibt die Methode, die Sie Schritt für Schritt zum richtigen Partner führt.

12x19 cm groß, ca. 120 Seiten, Hardcover.

Videokurs "Die wahre Liebe finden"

12 Videolektionen mit wertvollen Tipps und praktischen Übungen, die Sie Schritt für Schritt zum richtigen Partner führen. Jede Woche erhalten Sie ein neues Video mit neuen Anregungen und Hilfestellungen.

Intensivseminar "Die wahre Liebe finden"

Das Seminar beantwortet Fragen wie "Warum greife ich immer wieder daneben?", "Bin ich zu anspruchsvoll?" und "Kann ich in meinem Alter überhaupt noch die wahre Liebe finden? Wenn ja, wo??" Intensives Training, praktische Übungen, Zeit für persönliche Gespräche, Strandspaziergang.

max. 7 Teilnehmer

vom 20.-22. März 2015 oder vom 24.-26. April 2015

inkl. 2 Übernachtungen (DZ) mit Frühstück

1 x Mittagessen

Tee & Kaffee während des Seminars

auf Texel / Niederlande

Persönliches Coachingprogramm

Sie werden von mir persönlich begleitet, bis Sie die wahre Liebe gefunden haben. Sie lernen Schritt für Schritt meine Methode, die Sie zum richtigen Partner führt. Ich spreche persönlich mit Ihnen, vor Ort, auf Skype oder telefonisch. Sie bekommen persönliches Feedback, Coaching und Antwort auf alle Fragen, die Sie zur Partnersuche haben. In Notfällen können Sie mich täglich telefonisch erreichen. Ich bleibe an Ihrer Seite, bis Sie die wahre Liebe gefunden haben – und freue mich auf die Einladung zu Ihrer Hochzeit!

 

 

Mein Projekt Wahre Liebe

Wenn Sie mich unterstützen, helfen Sie mir nicht nur, mein Buch in Deutschland herauszugeben, sondern Sie retten im wahrsten Sinne des Wortes Leben: Menschen in einer glücklichen Beziehung leben länger als Singles. Für jeden Single, der den richtigen Partner gefunden hat, gibt es zwei Singles weniger auf dem Markt. Ich möchte aus den 16 Millionen Singles in Deutschland 8 Millionen glückliche Pärchen machen - und ich möchte, dass Sie zuerst Ihren Liebespartner finden!

Mein Buch habe ich bereits geschrieben. Ich habe ein Cover entwerfen lassen und einen Drucker gefunden. Jetzt benötige ich € 4.800,00 für den Druck von 400 Büchern. Mit Ihrem Beitrag kann ich die ersten 400 Bücher von „Wie verliebt man sich richtig“ drucken lassen und Ihnen ein handsigniertes Exemplar schicken.

Mein Buch beschreibt die komplette Methode, die Sie Schritt für Schritt zum richtigen Partner führt und kostet soviel wie 3 Latte Macchiato. Die wahre Liebe ist doch unbezahlbar…?

 

Zum Schluss

Wenn Sie bereit sind, die wahre Liebe zu finden, bestellen Sie mein Buch, buchen Sie meinen Videokurs oder sichern Sie sich Ihren Platz im Intensivseminar „Die wahre Liebe finden“. Ich freue mich darauf, Sie persönlich kennenzulernen! Auch wenn Sie mein Buch nicht kaufen möchten, können Sie mir helfen: Bitte teilen Sie diese Seite auf Facebook, auf Google+ und auf Twitter und gönnen Sie einem guten Freund die wahre Liebe. Ich danke Ihnen sehr!
 

Das sagen Leser und Seminarteilnehmer über mich

 

„Dolores, ich habe zum ersten Mal wieder die Hoffnung, dass es klappen kann!“

„Danke, dass du dieses Buch geschrieben hast!“

„Ich wünschte, ich hätte das alles schon vor Jahren gewusst.“

„Deine Methode hat meinen Seelenverwandten in mein Leben gebracht.“

„Ich bin nun seeeehr glücklich mit ihm zusammen. Vielen Dank, liebe Dolores!“

„Mein Partner ist liebevoll, freundlich und großzügig. Er hat alles, was ich mir gewünscht habe, und noch vieles mehr!“

„Dein Buch kam genau im richtigen Moment.“

„Dolores, du bist mein Liebesengel! Ich habe ihn 4 Monate später gefunden!“

 

Auf die wahre Liebe! Herzlichst Ihre

 

Dolores Dimic

story:
Short Summary

In 1992, Alfred Ring fled his village in Sudan to avoid being killed by the terrorist's army.  He joined other young men from his tribe, and together, they walked to Ethiopia and then to Kenya before the "Lost Boys of Sudan" could find safety at a refuge camp.  He later married Adhol and had three children.   But in 2004, he was given the opportunity to live in the United States so as to better his life, and ultimately the life of his family.  In 2010, he became a citizen of the United States. His wife joined him to live in Overland Park in 2013.  Alfred is currently working at Shawnee Mission Medical Center while taking classes at Johnson County Community College while Adhol works 30 hours a week as well.  They have been working tirelessly to bring their 3 children home from Nairobi, Kenya to live in Overland Park with them.  The 3 children are a boy, Awak - age 13, and twin girls, Achan and Abuck - age 11.  The passports for the 3 children have finally been approved.  

This campaign is to help pay the cost of the airline tickets, the remaining immigration legal fees, and some basic living essentials for each child when they arrive. 

What We Need & What You Get

The $12,100 will specifically pay for:

  • $7,500 towards airline tickets
  • $1,600 towards remaining immigration legal fees
  • $1,000 per child for a mattress, clothes, and school supplies

The Impact

You can only imagine the heartache and pain that each family member has experienced by being apart for all these years.  With our help, the Ring family can finally be reunited for good!
