story:
To BE EDITED!!!!

Build a new school in Gaunshahar, Lamjung, Nepal 2015!
Namaste!
Help me build a new school in Gaunshahar, Lamjung, Nepal for children 3-13 years old. Help me create a valuable foundation for the next generation of world educators and leaders!
Hi,
my name is Marcia Voss and this is my campaign. I am a 24-year-old music student in Germany. I’m a proud dog owner of a 4year old Mexican street mud. Under my passions for life are hobbies such as traveling, languages, music, arts, dance, animals, nature and Bikrahm yoga.
I have never ever asked strangers for donations nor made an online campaign before, but now I found a strong enough reason for me to ask the world to contribute to my cause.
Recently, I've been browsing the Internet for volunteer opportunities abroad and tumbled across a very touching post. In that post a man called Shamser Thapa and his family are doing their best for their poor village in Gaunshahar, Lamjung, Nepal. Gaunshahar is the original abode of the royal family of Nepal, which later relocated to Kathmandu. The small palace and courtyard still host’s traditional festivals that attract hundreds, sometimes thousands of people from all around at many intervals during the calendar year.
Gaunshahar's population is 1000 and is located in the Lamjung district with a population of 6,611 (stats as of 2011), the village has 1 communal place and only 1 communal school. At this moment there are 75 students, aged 3-13, with class sizes no bigger than 12.  In the district of Lamjung the villages have many low-income families, who are struggling in receiving basic education. Most families’ children have basically no chance of education. Shamser and his family, with help from volunteers around the world, such as me, are planning to build a second school so more families have the chance in sending their children to school.
About Heaven Hill Academy
 
Shamser Thapa is a local teacher and principal who is passionate about improving his community. Not satisfied with the education system, his vision is to build a new free independent school in the heart of Gaunshahar. A school, which will not discriminate between family income and social class status but will take the poorest of the village children alleviating the financial burden on their families and providing them with quality education they could not otherwise afford.
The Plan
To fund and build a physical school for approximately 40 students from the age of 4 to 8 in the heart of Gaunshahar.
The challenges, which lay ahead of us, are:
•   Find suitable land in the village
•   Source funding to buy the land at an estimated cost of US$ 8,500
•   Secure funding to build the buildings an at estimated cost of US$ 12,600
•   Gain approval from the education board
•   Design the layout of the school
•   Have a steady flow of volunteers to assist with the build and reduce costs
•   Fit out of the school
•   Design the school emblem and create the logo to match our principles
•   Secure funding for the day to day running of the school - estimated at US$ 600 per month
•   Employee and train 4 teachers
•   Identify worthy students and enroll them
•   Opening day
Progress up to Date!

22 September 2014 - We’ve found suitable land in the heart of Gaunshahar. The farmer, who currently grows crop on the land, is willing to sell so we’re beginning negotiations.
 
 
30 September 2014 - A generous donation has been received from a previous volunteer. This has allowed us to purchase the land. Once the millet has been harvested, we can start the build!
14 October 2014 - We’ve been granted permission from the local authority in Besishahar to open a school for nursery, lower kindergarten and upper kindergarten classes.
 21 October 2014 - With the help of a volunteer and after weeks of drawings and revisions, we’ve come up with a design for the school which we believe optimises the space we have available.
 
26 October 2014 - A further large donation has been received which has allowed us to purchase a water tank for the school, pay for the electricity wiring as well as start breaking the stones.
27 October 2014 - We’ve now started breaking the stones. A family in the village who has land near the school’s location has given permission to use their stone. We’ve employed 2 men local to the village to begin breaking the stone at the quarry. Volunteers have cut in a path into the side of the mountain for access and they’ve started carry the stones from the quarry to the site.
 
7 November 2014 - With the help of the volunteers, we’ve created both a logo and school motto. After brainstorming ideas, we believe ‘Pride in our past, skills for the future’ emphasises our aim for the school; to preserve the traditions of the community and provide future generations with the skills and knowledge to achieve. With the pipal tree being an important focal point in this rural community, it’s also our main focal point with the roots representing the past and the leaves the future.








About Shamser Thapa
 
Shamser Thapa is a teacher and principle of a school in the small picturesque village of Gaunshahar, Nepal. The village being the original abode of the Nepali Royal family before they were relocated to Kathmandu.
Shamser was brought up in Gaunshahar, the son of a farming family. Schooled in the local public school, their mornings and evenings were spent assisting the family with chores around the farm, leaving little time for studying. Not much has changed in Gaunsahar in 30 years.
Having graduated from the local high school, Shamser sought higher education but with his father lacking the funds to invest in his son’s education he moved to Kathmandu and took a job in a hotel in Nagarkot as a kitchen porter to enable him to pay for his university degree. Impressing the owner with his English, he was promoted to waiter before finally moving to concierge. Working full time at the hotel proved difficult to fit in the time for study, but with his determination, he managed to secure a degree in English Literature and Population after 3 years.
Graduating Tribhuban University, Shamser continued to save until a time when he was able to move to the West in search of employment opportunities, not unlike the vast majority of men in rural communities in Nepal who struggle to find work. Spending a year and a half in Antwerp working and saving, he realised, in comparison to the West, he missed the close knit community of his hometown; the perfect environment to bring up his family and the perfect place where he could make a difference to the future of the community; something he wasn't afforded in Antwerp.
With ideas for social improvement circling around Shamser’s head, he moved back home. He took a job teaching in a local school in Gaunshahar and was soon made principle. Not resting on his laurels and with the poverty of the village in the forefront of his mind, Shamser continued with small projects borne from the heart.
 
This story, as well as all the images on Shamser's websites at  www.heavenhillhomestay.com & www.heavenhillacademynepal.org, touched me deeply. Since I had read the story, I cannot stop thinking about the children and their beautiful villages in the mountains of Nepal. With in the years to come I sincerely wish to travel to Gaunshahr to meet Shamser Tapa, his family and the wonderful children we all have helped establish a foundation for their future! Nepal has been one of my longest dreams, for over 7 years now. Every now and again I envision my stay with them already.
In my opinion, education is of high importance and necessity globally. The lack of education around the world is scary. We know that the United States as well as Europe have enough educational problems but for countries to not have even a choice of getting educated is outrageous, in my mind. I am asking you to help me raise funds so we can send Gaunshahar's and the surrounding village children to get a basic education near their home.
When we archive the goal of $10.000 US Dollars/9390.99 Euros, you have helped build a second school by supplying the funds for all materials needed for building the school, as well as giving the children enough props to start learning such as:
•   Pencils, rubbers/erasers, markers, crayons, colour pencils, sharpeners, and etc.
•   Exercise books, drawing paper, A4-sized printer paper
•   First aid materials (plasters, scissors, wound disinfection)
•   English children's books  
•   Children's clothes
•   Educational board games and toys
•   Radio/CD player
•   Old laptops
•   Light bulbs and lamp covers  
•   Cups, mugs, plates or bowls
•   Toys
•   Cash!
Please be aware of size and weight because all items will be hiked up the mountains. The smaller and lighter the better! :)
How you helped build the new school?
Your donations here → Donation Button! (integrate button)
With your efforts, we also accept any and all materialistic donations sent to the address below. Read further to see a full list of items require for the school or see above mentioned item list in short.
You can personality ship items to:
Heaven Hill Academy   
Gaunshahar-1 Lamjung   
Zone-Gandaki   
Nepal   
Or directly address to Shamser Thapa.

Sending school supplies
We realize many people prefer to send school materials by airmail/courier than donating money. Whilst any donations of supplies are greatly received, it’s unfortunate that in Nepal the customs charges to have parcels greater than 2kg released from the depot in Kathmandu are extremely high, meaning we have to channel much needed money into releasing them. Should you wish to send supplies directly, please get in touch and we may be able to put you in contact with someone from your country who is coming to volunteer and could bring any items. Alternatively, if there are specific items you wish to donate, we can source them here in Nepal and purchase using your kind donation.   
NOTE: When you ship items, make sure you keep a detailed list of items sent in case of damage, loss or theft. Get a durable/heavy duty box and make sure you receive your tracking number. Make sure items in the box are shielded well, cover them with newspaper, Styrofoam or any other gap filling material for safer arrival of package. Best to get package coverage/insurance.
Donations are the best way to help! I will deal with the shipping costs and pack as many suite cases as the airline allows me.

Make a donation
One of the most important parts of our vision for Heaven Hill Academy is the ability to offer quality education free of charge to those children who would not otherwise have access to it. We will be dependent on donations to fund the build, chattels, teaching resources and ongoing running costs (teaching materials, wages, electricity, etc.) initially for the school. Although there are plans to develop an income stream to fund the school on going, this will not be realized until the end of 2015. 100% of all donations received will go directly into providing a child’s free education with nothing taken for any admin costs. We understand the need for transparency when donating to charitable causes, therefore should you wish to donate to the project, we urge you to get in touch and we’ll tell you how your generous donation, however big or small, will be spent.
http://www.heavenhillacademynepal.org

 
Make your cause 2016 the children of Gaunshahar!!!!
Save the children and an amazing culture, hit in April 2015 by one of the largest earthquakes in history of the world with a magnitude of 7.8!!!
Leaving Nepal devastated and in need of our support to rebuild!

Dear Contributors,
This campaign I started begin of 2015 and will continuously run till the goal has been reached. All your generous contributions made here through my website will cumulate in a PayPal account especially created solely for this campaign. Only I have access to the funds. See top for fund count. Once the goal is reached, I will send the money directly to Shamasar Tapa’s account in Nepal via direct deposit/PayPal transfer.
It is very important to me to make the biggest impact possible with the funds collected. The excitement for me lies in establishing a partnership with the Heaven Hill Community for future educational travels, volunteer opportunities, international friendships and relations to better the world where we can.
As some of you know, I've lived already in 6 countries (Germany, Australia, Mexico, States and France) and visited 15 countries. Throughout my travels I have seen and heard a lot. Mexico was my first real encounter with poverty and strong social conflict. Seeing people squished in the tiniest places just to have a roof over their head, seeing stray and diseased animals on a daily roaming the streets, empty buildings of unfinished projects, and the hustle to have a meal per day on the table for each member in the family and than consider it normal. Seeing the different social behaviours when strangers/tourists enter the country unaware of the cultural differences is very provocative, in mind.
Tourism has become a trend and I am not for the trend of travel. If everyone traveling would share their money accurately, consider how you can positively take your vacations while helping the natives and volunteer some hours in building relationships, institutions (such as schools etc.) or other useful deeds needed at the place of your visit, we all would profit from a higher standard of living and friendships globally.
One of my dreams is to make the differences between human cultures and societies just a tiny bit smaller by actively participating and learning different cultures, languages, mindsets and behaviours. I believe if we all work together, with each other, everyone involved will benefit from a life long very valuable journey of progression.
This campaign is the start of my efforts to fund raise and help on a global scale. Writing you this made me realize I want to do this for more people. There are so many causes I feel very passionate about and it would be amazing for me to get your continuous support on the goals we all share.
In the past I have helped a few friends in Australia fund raise to save the Kimberly Mountains among other cause driven events. One thing I do daily is sign petitions and make pledges for a better future through websites such as causes.com, greenpeace, sierra, world wildlife fund, compact.de and many more. I've never done any fundraising or campaigning online in this manner before and hope I am doing well with it, which will show through your support.
My research on volunteer opportunities is and was extensive. There are so many ways to volunteer and help globally. One can go through an organization that will place you to work or find private volunteer projects. Heaven Hill Homestay is a private volunteer opportunity that I chose, to be able to have a more intimate experience with the natives of Nepal.
With this information and campaign my hope remains that it touches you on a humane and heartfelt level to donate the highest amount you can.  The more collective spirit, the quicker help can reach the village children of Gaunshahar, Nepal.

I sincerely thank you in advance for reading, sharing and donating to this cause!


 
Risks & Challenges
The challenges I am facing with this campaign are:
1.   The amount I want to raise, will take time, effort and collective spirit! Your help!
2.   I will solely do the updating of this campaign on my website and the facebook page at: https://www.facebook.com/nepalbuildaschool/
3.   This campaign will run till the goal is reached!
4.   Donations from other countries other than within the EU are subject to currency exchange rates and fees.
5.   Through out time I will organize fundraisers as much as it is possible for me to push the campaign goal.
6.   Travel to Nepal is only possible after my BA (in 3-4years from now).
7.   I will gradually use multiple platforms to accept donations throughout the process.
See below for ways to follow this project and me.

All updates and information on the upcoming events for this campaign will be posted on:
 Facebook:
https://www.facebook.com/nepalbuildaschool
My website:
www.mokkaspectrum.com/my-campaign
www.mokkaspectrum.com/news/















Other Ways You Can Help!!!

Spread the word about this campaign-- MAKE SOME NOISE!!!
Share with your friends and family--MAKE SOME NOISE!!!
Share it all over your social media--GET THE WORD OUT!!!
Volunteer--BE THE CHANGE!!!










Volunteer at:
 
Heaven Hill Homestay
 
by Shamser Thapa
Hello, my name is Shamser. I am the principal of an academy of learning in Lamjung, Nepal. My family has a homestay located in a beautiful part of North-Western Nepal on the top of a hill with stunning views of Annapurna, Fishtail, Manaslu, Peak 29 and Lamjung. My village is called Gaunshahar and is the original abode of the royal family of Nepal, which later relocated to Kathmandu. The small palace and courtyard still hosts traditional festivals that attract hundreds, sometimes thousands of people from all around at many intervals during the calendar year.
Besisahar is a small town in the valley below and is the starting point of the famous Annapurna Circuit trek. Know that you can also get your trekking permits from Besisahar. We have both accommodation in our homestay as well as a newly built traditional Nepali eco roundhouse made from stone and a straw roof. Both accommodations have western style bathrooms; hot shower available, Internet and plenty of blankets. Our food is sourced from almost entirely local ingredients. We can accommodate vegetarian diets as well. We can also teach volunteers to cook Nepali food, such as chapati for breakfast and Dal Baht as a main course.
We welcome all new volunteers with Tikka and Garlands. Whilst staying with my family, we welcome any help you can give. As the principal of the local school I welcome volunteers that help the children in any way they can, especially with handwriting practice, learning English or even just playing with them or teaching them games.
Don't worry if you have no special skills. I will give assistance with any work that needs doing. This might be painting, building work, cooking or whatever you can offer. A few volunteers started their own novel projects, which were most welcome. Volunteers helped build a clay cob oven, a chimney and ideas of our vegetable garden. You are welcome to use our outside clay oven to bake or cook (we can make pizza). You can buy some ingredients in Besisahar. One volunteer set up a very small library (children's book donations are welcome). Other volunteers helped build the house we live in, and our beautiful garden. Two recent volunteers taught some nursery rhymes and games to our school children during assembly. If you know anything about permaculture, we'd love to learn so we can grow more of our own food. We've collected laptops from volunteers, which have enabled us to run computer classes for free with the children from the village.
We ask volunteers to pay only a total of 5 USD a day to stay here. This cost includes two meals, tea and coffee, free wifi and cold shower. We have a local shop if you want to buy snacks, drinks and other items. We ask volunteers to give four hours help a day in any way you can. The rest of the day is yours!

------ General Volunteer Schedule ------
First day: Settling in and introduction for volunteers to my family and current projects. (Volunteering activities during the day, depending on the nature of the activity)
Friday: Campfire (weather permitting in the winter) in the evening with the volunteers
Saturday (rest day): Nepali class / 4 to 5 hours trek to the forth, ruined Royal Palace and jungle and village visits etc. / free time

For bookings and volunteering contact Shamser Thapa at booking@heavenhillhomestay.com
More info at
 www.heavenhillhomestay.com
Or visit
http://www.workaway.info/169379873767-en.html
For more details on the volunteer opportunity!

Namaste!
story_txt: To BE EDITED!!!!Build a new school in Gaunshahar, Lamjung, Nepal 2015!Namaste!Help me build a new school in Gaunshahar, Lamjung, Nepal for children 3-13 years old. Help me create a valuable foundation for the next generation of world educators and leaders! Hi,my name is Marcia Voss and this is my campaign. I am a 24-year-old music student in Germany. I’m a proud dog owner of a 4year old Mexican street mud. Under my passions for life are hobbies such as traveling, languages, music, arts, dance, animals, nature and Bikrahm yoga.I have never ever asked strangers for donations nor made an online campaign before, but now I found a strong enough reason for me to ask the world to contribute to my cause. Recently, I've been browsing the Internet for volunteer opportunities abroad and tumbled across a very touching post. In that post a man called Shamser Thapa and his family are doing their best for their poor village in Gaunshahar, Lamjung, Nepal. Gaunshahar is the original abode of the royal family of Nepal, which later relocated to Kathmandu. The small palace and courtyard still host’s traditional festivals that attract hundreds, sometimes thousands of people from all around at many intervals during the calendar year. Gaunshahar's population is 1000 and is located in the Lamjung district with a population of 6,611 (stats as of 2011), the village has 1 communal place and only 1 communal school. At this moment there are 75 students, aged 3-13, with class sizes no bigger than 12.  In the district of Lamjung the villages have many low-income families, who are struggling in receiving basic education. Most families’ children have basically no chance of education. Shamser and his family, with help from volunteers around the world, such as me, are planning to build a second school so more families have the chance in sending their children to school. About Heaven Hill Academy Shamser Thapa is a local teacher and principal who is passionate about improving his community. Not satisfied with the education system, his vision is to build a new free independent school in the heart of Gaunshahar. A school, which will not discriminate between family income and social class status but will take the poorest of the village children alleviating the financial burden on their families and providing them with quality education they could not otherwise afford. The Plan To fund and build a physical school for approximately 40 students from the age of 4 to 8 in the heart of Gaunshahar. The challenges, which lay ahead of us, are:•   Find suitable land in the village•   Source funding to buy the land at an estimated cost of US$ 8,500•   Secure funding to build the buildings an at estimated cost of US$ 12,600 •   Gain approval from the education board•   Design the layout of the school•   Have a steady flow of volunteers to assist with the build and reduce costs•   Fit out of the school •   Design the school emblem and create the logo to match our principles•   Secure funding for the day to day running of the school - estimated at US$ 600 per month•   Employee and train 4 teachers •   Identify worthy students and enroll them•   Opening day Progress up to Date!22 September 2014 - We’ve found suitable land in the heart of Gaunshahar. The farmer, who currently grows crop on the land, is willing to sell so we’re beginning negotiations.  30 September 2014 - A generous donation has been received from a previous volunteer. This has allowed us to purchase the land. This campaign is the start of my efforts to fund raise and help on a global scale. Writing you this made me realize I want to do this for more people. There are so many causes I feel very passionate about and it would be amazing for me to get your continuous support on the goals we all share.In the past I have helped a few friends in Australia fund raise to save the Kimberly Mountains among other cause driven events. One thing I do daily is sign petitions and make pledges for a better future through websites such as causes.com, greenpeace, sierra, world wildlife fund, compact.de and many more. I've never done any fundraising or campaigning online in this manner before and hope I am doing well with it, which will show through your support.My research on volunteer opportunities is and was extensive. There are so many ways to volunteer and help globally. One can go through an organization that will place you to work or find private volunteer projects. Heaven Hill Homestay is a private volunteer opportunity that I chose, to be able to have a more intimate experience with the natives of Nepal. With this information and campaign my hope remains that it touches you on a humane and heartfelt level to donate the highest amount you can.  The more collective spirit, the quicker help can reach the village children of Gaunshahar, Nepal.I sincerely thank you in advance for reading, sharing and donating to this cause!  Risks & Challenges The challenges I am facing with this campaign are:1.   The amount I want to raise, will take time, effort and collective spirit! Your help!2.   I will solely do the updating of this campaign on my website and the facebook page at: https://www.facebook.com/nepalbuildaschool/3.   This campaign will run till the goal is reached!4.   Donations from other countries other than within the EU are subject to currency exchange rates and fees.5.   Through out time I will organize fundraisers as much as it is possible for me to push the campaign goal.6.   Travel to Nepal is only possible after my BA (in 3-4years from now).7.   I will gradually use multiple platforms to accept donations throughout the process. See below for ways to follow this project and me. All updates and information on the upcoming events for this campaign will be posted on: Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/nepalbuildaschoolMy website:www.mokkaspectrum.com/my-campaignwww.mokkaspectrum.com/news/Other Ways You Can Help!!! Donate--BECOME A SPONSOR FOR A GOOD CAUSE!!!Spread the word about this campaign-- MAKE SOME NOISE!!!Share with your friends and family--MAKE SOME NOISE!!!Share it all over your social media--GET THE WORD OUT!!!Volunteer--BE THE CHANGE!!!Volunteer at: Heaven Hill Homestay by Shamser ThapaHello, my name is Shamser. I am the principal of an academy of learning in Lamjung, Nepal. My family has a homestay located in a beautiful part of North-Western Nepal on the top of a hill with stunning views of Annapurna, Fishtail, Manaslu, Peak 29 and Lamjung. My village is called Gaunshahar and is the original abode of the royal family of Nepal, which later relocated to Kathmandu. The small palace and courtyard still hosts traditional festivals that attract hundreds, sometimes thousands of people from all around at many intervals during the calendar year.Besisahar is a small town in the valley below and is the starting point of the famous Annapurna Circuit trek. Know that you can also get your trekking permits from Besisahar. We have both accommodation in our homestay as well as a newly built traditional Nepali eco roundhouse made from stone and a straw roof. Both accommodations have western style bathrooms; hot shower available, Internet and plenty of blankets. Our food is sourced from almost entirely local ingredients. We can accommodate vegetarian diets as well. We can also teach volunteers to cook Nepali food, such as chapati for breakfast and Dal Baht as a main course.We welcome all new volunteers with Tikka and Garlands. Whilst staying with my family, we welcome any help you can give. As the principal of the local school I welcome volunteers that help the children in any way they can, especially with handwriting practice, learning English or even just playing with them or teaching them games. Don't worry if you have no special skills. I will give assistance with any work that needs doing. This might be painting, building work, cooking or whatever you can offer. A few volunteers started their own novel projects, which were most welcome. Volunteers helped build a clay cob oven, a chimney and ideas of our vegetable garden. You are welcome to use our outside clay oven to bake or cook (we can make pizza). You can buy some ingredients in Besisahar. One volunteer set up a very small library (children's book donations are welcome). Other volunteers helped build the house we live in, and our beautiful garden. Two recent volunteers taught some nursery rhymes and games to our school children during assembly. If you know anything about permaculture, we'd love to learn so we can grow more of our own food. We've collected laptops from volunteers, which have enabled us to run computer classes for free with the children from the village.We ask volunteers to pay only a total of 5 USD a day to stay here. This cost includes two meals, tea and coffee, free wifi and cold shower. We have a local shop if you want to buy snacks, drinks and other items. We ask volunteers to give four hours help a day in any way you can. The rest of the day is yours!------ General Volunteer Schedule ------ First day: Settling in and introduction for volunteers to my family and current projects. (Volunteering activities during the day, depending on the nature of the activity) Friday: Campfire (weather permitting in the winter) in the evening with the volunteers Saturday (rest day): Nepali class / 4 to 5 hours trek to the forth, ruined Royal Palace and jungle and village visits etc. / free timeFor bookings and volunteering contact Shamser Thapa at booking@heavenhillhomestay.comMore info at www.heavenhillhomestay.com Or visithttp://www.workaway.info/169379873767-en.htmlFor more details on the volunteer opportunity!GPS N28 12.698 E84 21.908 To follow the story, like my Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/nepalbuildaschoolTo follow me on social media enter Mokka Spectrum in your search! Twitter, Instagram, Facebook, SoundcloudThank you for your continued support!!!Namaste!

story:
Life as an asylum seeker in Bulgaria's capital Sofia can be isolated and boring. Significant administrative hurdles prevent most asylum seeker children from enrolling in school, and the refugee camps are in quiet parts of town, with no activities provided by the state.

That’s where The Refugee Project steps in.

For more than four years, we have worked with hundreds of children and adults living in the refugee centres in Sofia, Bulgaria. We organize Bulgarian, English and computer lessons, sports and games, music, cookery and art activities, parties and excursions. 

What's the point?

Every child deserves a childhood. 

The activities we provide for children (and adults) not only help them to integrate into a new country; they also provide a chance to be creative, to try new activities, to make friends, and to take a break from a difficult period in their lives.

What We Need

We aim to raise $5000 to cover the costs of materials for our classes, activities, events and excursions for the children in the 3 refugee centres in Sofia in 2015. Every cent of the donations will go directly towards these activities, because the project is run by more than 60 volunteers, none of whom are paid.

Every dollar makes a difference…

  • 5 dollars provide pencils for 10 children
  • 50 dollars are enough for a whole week of activities in one refugee center
  • 100 dollars will cover the costs of an excursion to a Sofia tourist site for 20 children.

…but money is not everything!

You can also support us by:

  • Sharing our campaign with friends using the Indiegogo share tools
  • Liking our Facebook page: Refugee Project
  • Run in our fun run on the 1st of March! You can get your tickets here

story:
What we do...

 

The picture above was our first garden. It helped multiple families grow a little extra food last year. It helped the hosts by turning an unused space in to a beautiful variety of people and plants, and at times a hustle bustle of pests lol (we don't allow pesticide use in our gardens). The most important thing I feel we grew last season was hope. The hope of a food secure city and a community oriented mentality.

The Backyard Sharing Program has a very simple structure.

 We find host yards and turn them in to gardens. We then pair gardeners, with hosts and once they come to an agreement the fun begins! We helped over 20 people with our first garden and did so with next to no money. But now we want to help a lot more people!

What We Need

We need all the things that come with gardening. We need good clean healthy soil/manure for amending the beds. We need good seed. We need watering cans and hand tools, rain barrels and composters. We had to rent a rototiller and I feel we are still at a stage where renting is the best way for us :). We are putting in a few planters as part of our Food Is Free side project. We have the ok for two locations to do so!

We need your help to keep helping people!

The Impact

We want to show people that it is easy to grow food!

We want to make it so easy and accessible that the families and kids involved,fall in love with every aspect of gardening! even pulling the weeds! well maybe not pulling the weeds...

The way we like to do this is.

Free workshops!

As I had said before we helped over 20 people last year. I reached out to alot of Transition Guelph members and had them share their time and knowledge . We hosted canning workshops and companion gardening workshops along with a few more. This year I have asked another volunteer to help me coordinate(Tiffany Baldwin) in hopes of helping that many more people and being able to host alot more workshops!

This is also where the need of funding comes in. We not only want to teach the skills (canning,composting,seed saving,pressure canning, tree grafting and so much more!) but hope to plant some communal fruit bearing tree and shrubs, along with sending home preserves and possibly a few supplies to help participants practice at home.

Where we hope to be the most impactful is in educating our gardeners to extend the fruits of their labours. By teaching these skills and overall helping them grow a passion for gardening, we hope to build food security amongst the families that need it most.

We need your help though!


Risks & Challenges

 Unlike a normal community based gardening project we have very little risk. Most of our gardens are in backyards and because they are in yards they offer great security from theft and vandalism.

Our biggest challenges are pushing forward and finding new yards and gardeners.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Other ways you can help....Come out and volunteer!

We are always in need of extra hands for digging or people with green thumbs to help teach and care for gardens with our new gardeners!


You can contact us at backyardsharingprogram@transitionguelph.org


Thank you for your support!

story:
My name is Sejah Coombs, and I created Girls of Virtue to serve the most pressing needs of our young girls by combating several of the numerous difficulties they face. Our objective is to address and eradicate the issue of decreasing self-esteem and create positive social change that enables our society to function more efficiently, in turn, making our world a better place.

At Girls of Virtue, we promote positive mental health to help our girls establish the course of their lives, as a positive self-image contributes to current development and future experiences. Our objective is to assist adolescent girls in recognizing and understanding their value by building their self-esteem. By becoming conscious of their value, they will set admirable standards for themselves and their choice of clothing will be respectable. We provide an innovative and interactive workshop that offers practical skills they can immediately begin to apply to their lives, impacting clothing awareness and selection. Our initiative aims to realize a variety of specific long-term benefits including a positive attitude, a sense of optimism, reduced anxiety and positive decision making which are extremely beneficial; helping them excel in the classroom, in personal relationships and as they mature into adults, preparing them for happy and successful lives.

I desire for our young girls to believe in themselves and am dedicated in assisting them, as I know that self-esteem and confidence needs to be encouraged and even taught. Through our workshop, we educate young girls on how to use fashion as a means of self-expression by offering realistic and manageable steps that will help give them confidence. When our girls feel good about themselves, they treat others well, act appropriately in a variety of situations, and have a sense of accomplishment that they will carry with them throughout their lives. We provide an inclusive learning environment where they feel safe and valued, and work together to learn important life skills in order to be their best and make a positive contribution to their community.

​By helping to support us, you can expect to see a number of changes within our girls and our communities, including:

  • Improved behavioral choices
  • Decrease in bullying
  • Increase among academic success
We have an opportunity to influence the patterns of self-esteem that are currently developing, before they become permanently established by adulthood. 
We are optimistic that you will stand with us, as your support in our initiative helps to improve our city by strengthening the individuals within our communities. I invite you to visit www.girlsofvirtue.ca for more information

I understand that there are individuals who want to help, but are unable to contribute monetarily. If this is you, you can support us by sharing our mission with others in order to get our initiative out into our communities

    I thank you for taking the time from your busy day to read this.

    Sincerely,
    Sejah Coombs

    "People who work together will win, whether it be against complex football defenses, or the problems of modern society." Vince Lombardi

story:
Sumatra Environmental Education Concern is getting serious about environmental education in Indonesia.

  • I'm Andy Short, founder of Sumatra Environmental Education Concern (SEEC). I have been teaching English and Environmental Management, among other subjects, in Indonesia, for more than 12 years. Indonesia is going through a phase of development which is putting massive strain on its natural environment and resources and continued uncontrolled progress will lead to negative consequences for the marine and forest ecosystems, and the amazing, unique species which live there, such as Sumatran Tigers, Orangutans, Gibbons, Elephants, Rhinos, Monkeys, Hornbills, Pangolins, Fruit Bats, Slow Loris, and many, many more.  The consequences of disturbing ecosystem services will negatively impact humans, too.
  • Young people from normal schools in Indonesia rarely get any chance to see nature and learn about their environment in the field. They are also the majority. We believe the ability to get out and engage with nature and conservation should NOT just be the right of children from wealthy schools, but all children.
  • After many years of experience and contacts within the Department of Education, and with the hardest-working and most valuable conservation organisations in the country, we have the ability to connect with schools and hundreds of thousands of children in Sumatra and beyond, and an opportunity to encourage them to love and protect their environment.

What we need and what you get

  • To legally register as an organisation in Indonesia SEEC will require around $7,500 (£5,700) or 100 million Indonesian Rupiah as funds. This will enable us to be officially registered as a 'yayasan' in Indonesia. Additional funds raised will be used for operational expenses, for rental of a temporary base / office space for SEEC, and to prepare our first proper season of fieldtrips and classes.

The Impact

Indonesian children have the potential to protect and ensure the survival of hundreds of unique species and the stunning and vital forest home they still live in. All that is required is education, some understanding, and some care, in order to save species and their forest ecosystems, which are vital to supporting life, including human life.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you would like to help in any other way please contact us directly.

We will be looking for permanent and temporary volunteers and will always be ready to listen to suggestions and ideas of people who care.

story:
It starts in Brighton

It grows everywhere.

It ends never

Intelligently self-organizing communities begin here & now, with you.


Anything you want to say/ask us?

Comment here via our page, to suggest/ask anything at all about this project.
More questions about ChangeTheFuture & the bus

Go here to join our next strategy meeting (16 feb 15, 8:30pm, in person in Brighton + on line via Google Hangouts) Agenda & Minutes here.

----------------

ChangeTheFuture is an open, democratic collective of volunteers,
creating new spaces in our communities (starting in Brighton) which bring together decision makers with those affected by decisions - the people.

Here, we all have a voice, shaping our communities more intimately together.

We're creating on-line and offline spaces for us to have a more fun & effective, more intimate democracy in which we better harness the collective intelligence of all of us; rather than us all simply being passengers in a city or community which has little or no options for influencing change or bringing our own ideas to the table:


The bus this campaign is funding:

The bus serves 3 purposes

  1. This multi-function, free to use central Brighton community space - booked via a simple process of direct democracy

  2. All around the outside walls of the bus - A 60ft long, permanent, mobile installation of the Wall Of Ideas - The new way for people in Brighton to influence decision making in their city & bring their own ideas to the table.
    Now we can take this to people, rather than expecting them to know about & come to us.

    We will run the Wall Of Ideas all over Brighton, gathering the ideas, dreams, needs, and voices of the potentially digitally excluded, isolated locals, and give them a new way to be heard in the issues they know about and care about most.

    The bus will be the 4th erection of the Wall Of Ideas. The difference is that

    • This time it's going up permanently

    • Now the leader of the council + our local MP Caroline Lucas are eager to support.

    Read about what's already happened with the wall:
    The Wall Of Ideas - What is it?
  3. Upstairs, an office space for ChangeTheFuture to develop its work (join in?)

    This project is a tall order for our 20+ committed volunteers.
    We've had 2 previous offices for free which were incredibly empowering while we had them - allowing us to come together to focus on the project, immersing ourselves in it, storing our big whiteboards covered in web platform blue-prints and project strategy, a space we can hold meetings and organise small workshops or just escape distraction and dive deeper into ChangeTheFuture in our precious free time.
    By having an office we own, rather than paying expensive rent to hire one, we no longer have to monetise this project - we won't be forced to sell a commercial product or service, but rather can focus directly on serving our community and grow this project and its work beyond Brighton.

    We are exploring creative ways to pay volunteers without selling out and compromising on the very strong values of the project - this project is not for sale or equity-share. It will always belong entirely to the community, and be operated by that community.

Read more about the details of the vision for this bus here.

As always, this project is as much yours as ours - everyone is invited to join ChangeTheFuture (free!) to shape & drive forward this incredible project with us, democratically!
www.ChangeTheFuture.co.uk


The bus will also have a pimped-out multi-function room downstairs.





Submit your proposal for what to do in this free to use space. The most popular proposal will win - the first booking is for 15 may 2015 and we'll let you know 14 days in advance if your proposal is the most popular:
https://www.facebook.com/groups/wheelsofchange

The whole bottom deck (approx 8 metres x 3 meters) will be fully powered with sound system, projector, flexible seating & lighting and be perfect all kinds of community projects and activities that benefit local people.

Being totally free of charge to the local community, this is a very rare opportunity in central Brighton, allowing any artist of non-profit to use this space, so long as it's the most popular proposal (we invite bids for the space from everyone in the city and the most popular idea wins; we give you 2 weeks notice to prepare.)

What would you do with this space?

A film evening with Q&A?

Drive a bunch of young people having a hard time in school out to an outdoor education activity in a beautiful place?

Perhaps you'd like to help us look after/manage the space? or make it beautiful?

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

IF WE ARE UNDER FUNDED

We will contact you and offer a full return of your money.
If you're happy with us keeping it, we'll let you know how we intend to spend it + offer you alternative rewards if you chose something bus-related we're unable to deliver.


IF WE ARE OVER FUNDED

£1 - £10,000 over funded; we'll get a shinier bus in better condition and do it up really beautifully!
Get involved in designing it or renovating it if you like!

£10,000+ = Goes 50/50 into the following 2 money pots:

a) General ChangeTheFuture budget (to be spent via our standard direct democracy; anyone who fancies joining ChangeTheFuture can of course create proposals on how to spend it + vote).

b) Help volunteers to remain financially solvent while volunteering time on ChangeTheFuture by helping them to cover living costs through small grants (based on the amount of work they've done; agreed in advance).

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

If you share this, chances are good that one of your friends will share it again - let's get this idea out there and help communities to self-organize better - a solution for the community, owned and operated by the community.

Would you like to join one of our weekly events?
• Mondays 8pm: Strategy meetings (on and offline)
• Wednesdays 8pm: Social get together (informal chinwag; offline only: Brighton)
• Thursdays 8pm: Working group (get stuff done together: Brighton + online)

Thank you so much for your support.

Please fire away any ideas or questions below; we'll be here to respond!


www.ChangeTheFuture.co.uk

The bus serves 3 purposes


This multi-function, free to use central Brighton community space - booked via a simple process of direct democracy

All around the outside walls of the bus - A 60ft long, permanent, mobile installation of the Wall Of Ideas - The new way for people in Brighton to influence decision making in their city & bring their own ideas to the table.Now we can take this to people, rather than expecting them to know about & come to us.We will run the Wall Of Ideas all over Brighton, gathering the ideas, dreams, needs, and voices of the potentially digitally excluded, isolated locals, and give them a new way to be heard in the issues they know about and care about most.The bus will be the 4th erection of the Wall Of Ideas. The difference is that
• This time it's going up permanently
• Now the leader of the council + our local MP Caroline Lucas are eager to support.



Read about what's already happened with the wall:The Wall Of Ideas - What is it?


Upstairs, an office space for ChangeTheFuture to develop its work (join in?)This project is a tall order for our 20+ committed volunteers.We've had 2 previous offices for free which were incredibly empowering while we had them - allowing us to come together to focus on the project, immersing ourselves in it, storing our big whiteboards covered in web platform blue-prints and project strategy, a space we can hold meetings and organise small workshops or just escape distraction and dive deeper into ChangeTheFuture in our precious free time.By having an office we own, rather than paying expensive rent to hire one, we no longer have to monetise this project - we won't be forced to sell a commercial product or service, but rather can focus directly on serving our community and grow this project and its work beyond Brighton.We are exploring creative ways to pay volunteers without selling out and compromising on the very strong values of the project - this project is not for sale or equity-share. It will always belong entirely to the community, and be operated by that community.

Read more about the details of the vision for this bus here.



As always, this project is as much yours as ours - everyone is invited to join ChangeTheFuture (free!) to shape & drive forward this incredible project with us, democratically!www.ChangeTheFuture.co.uk
The bus will also have a pimped-out multi-function room downstairs.




Submit your proposal for what to do in this free to use space. The most popular proposal will win - the first booking is for 15 may 2015 and we'll let you know 14 days in advance if your proposal is the most popular:https://www.facebook.com/groups/wheelsofchange
The whole bottom deck (approx 8 metres x 3 meters) will be fully powered with sound system, projector, flexible seating & lighting and be perfect all kinds of community projects and activities that benefit local people.
Being totally free of charge to the local community, this is a very rare opportunity in central Brighton, allowing any artist of non-profit to use this space, so long as it's the most popular proposal (we invite bids for the space from everyone in the city and the most popular idea wins; we give you 2 weeks notice to prepare.)
What would you do with this space?
A film evening with Q&A?
Drive a bunch of young people having a hard time in school out to an outdoor education activity in a beautiful place?
Perhaps you'd like to help us look after/manage the space? or make it beautiful?
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
IF WE ARE UNDER FUNDED
We will contact you and offer a full return of your money.If you're happy with us keeping it, we'll let you know how we intend to spend it + offer you alternative rewards if you chose something bus-related we're unable to deliver.

IF WE ARE OVER FUNDED

£1 - £10,000 over funded; we'll get a shinier bus in better condition and do it up really beautifully!Get involved in designing it or renovating it if you like!
£10,000+ = Goes 50/50 into the following 2 money pots:
a) General ChangeTheFuture budget (to be spent via our standard direct democracy; anyone who fancies joining ChangeTheFuture can of course create proposals on how to spend it + vote).
b) Help volunteers to remain financially solvent while volunteering time on ChangeTheFuture by helping them to cover living costs through small grants (based on the amount of work they've done; agreed in advance).
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
If you share this, chances are good that one of your friends will share it again - let's get this idea out there and help communities to self-organize better - a solution for the community, owned and operated by the community.
Would you like to join one of our weekly events?• Mondays 8pm: Strategy meetings (on and offline)• Wednesdays 8pm: Social get together (informal chinwag; offline only: Brighton)• Thursdays 8pm: Working group (get stuff done together: Brighton + online)
Thank you so much for your support.
Please fire away any ideas or questions below; we'll be here to respond!


www.ChangeTheFuture.co.uk

story:
The Identity Quest is the first ever game simulation of a complete linguistic environment. You play the game, and on the way, acquire the language spoken in it.

The Identity Quest is the first ever game simulation of a complete linguistic environment. You play the game, and on the way, acquire the language spoken in it.

Never before has a language learning been easier or more enjoyable. The Identity Quest gives you the complete knowledge of a language you’ve chosen to play. You won’t need anything else playing it. No more study groups or courses. No more embarrassment or frustration when talking with foreigners because you can’t convey simple messages as natural and easy as in your native language.

All psychological barriers are gone with the advent of the game. Natural acquisition meets the best of organized learning, thus providing you with the easiest way to know a language. You can make your dream a reality and acquire one, two, three, or maybe five languages.

Originally planned as a 3d real world simulation, The Identity Quest was further rewritten into a point-and-click casual game with static 2d or 3d scenes, dialog choices, animated facial expressions, animated mini-games, and cut-scenes to minimize the development cost.

You may ask why we think our Project is any different from other mobile apps and language games so abundant in the booming market these days. Indeed, there are various online games, which are also free. So yes, why The Identity Quest? 

The main distinction between ANY existent linguistic game and The Identity Quest is the latter’s holistic approach.

If you run a search for language games, you will find infinite web resources, displaying games in categories. You will see games that present vocabulary topics, grammar issues, phonics, word-building nuances, etc. Tons of valuable materials, but emphasizing only ONE point of study. 

For example, if you choose Animals, you will get drills only on these creatures, wild or domestic, not connected to anything else. Studying like this doesn’t immediately incorporate the new elements into your overall system of knowledge, since there are no links to anything learned before. Consequently, it takes time for your memory to extract the necessary name when you need it in a free conversation.

This is what we avoid in The Identity Quest. You won’t have tasks or challenges just for the sake of the material presented in them. Everything has its meaning and connection with something bigger and deeper. 

This integrity becomes possible thanks to initial submission of the material you need to acquire to the gripping story you live in the Game. The logic of the game world around you asks for your understanding of the CONTEXT, and this is exactly what makes The Identity Quest unique on the current linguistic game market. This, and a complex system of the underlying theoretical principles.

на русском   en français


Our principal goal is to give ANY person an opportunity to acquire the world’s most learned languages. 

The studio will afford the game players the most interesting, engaging, personalized, motivating, and quickest way to obtain a fluent command of a chosen language.

We hope that players’ full satisfaction with the Game will stimulate the desire to continue with the playing-acquisition in other sequential games of the same and other languages, leading to their greater personal growth and more job opportunities.

The Identity Quest is a detective fantasy story about a teenage girl (the language speaker different from the one spoken in the Game) who is transported to an alternative world, a mixture of feudalism and striking number of modern and futuristic technologies provided by magicians. The magicians represent a small privileged group of people possessing the real power in the kingdom, guarding and multiplying scientific knowledge and artificially suppressing the nation’s development.

The player’s avatar, Claire, finds a book in her father's library. Attracted by its enigmatic shimmering, she reads its beginning, which is written in the language of the Game, and falls out of our present reality. 

The girl regains her senses in a weird forest, awoken by Clarissa, the witch, who also uses the language of the book but does not look very surprised to find a strange girl in a deserted place. Seeing Claire’s confusion and incomprehension, the witch takes the girl to live in her house. 

Clarissa assumes a guardian role toward Claire, constantly talking to her and gradually making the girl use the foreign language through completion of different challenges, including meeting new people and visiting necessary places. Clarissa, all in all, shows herself as an exceptionally caring individual. 

First, unselfishness of her motives is put in doubt at the beginning of the story when Claire finds a diary of Clarissa’s missing daughter. Further events of Season 1 don’t reveal the true nature of the witch’s behavior, keeping the player intrigued and making eager to find out what is going on. 

Following the game course, Claire needs to become a law-abiding citizen—she has to obtain documents, enroll to school, and find a job. Each part of the game approximates Claire to the solution of her mission in this world and her final returning home.

In The Identity Quest Season 1, there are three main characters:

--Claire, the player’s avatar, a girl from our reality, who is accidently transported to a fantasy world.

The game plot implies that at the beginning of the game she has no knowledge of the language spoken in the game. However, the player’s previous experience with the language (if there is any) allows them to regulate the input and number of Hints, thus varying the time needed for the tasks completion and points earned.

If there’s no such experience, the player simply guesses the answer and sees the reaction, shown in the comments to the answer and in Clarissa’s replies.

--Clarissa, the Royal witch, who runs into Claire on a forest clearing with a prominent oak tree.

Somehow, she seems more baffled than shocked to meet a girl in such weird clothes, and generously takes Claire to live with her. The witch, seeing that the girl doesn’t understand the language she speaks, offers to teach her. She also promises to take care of this complete stranger and to pass Claire off as her niece.

--And one more mysterious character, who remains hidden until half of the Season, but is omnipresent and pretty annoying. The player hears him at every possible and impossible moment.  Mr. X comments on her actions with encouraging or disappointed remarks, speaking his not-always-kind mind.

Apart from the main heroes, there are other 27 supportive and additional characters, some of whom appear only to say a few phrases.

The magical world—the suspicious blend of modern and fantasy elements—where Claire emerges is restricted to a part of the forest with Clarissa’s cottage and Kingstown, the capital of the kingdom.

The 12 locations (with 53 different screens and 9 interludes connecting the main locations) form 30 game levels, unevenly divided into 8 Episodes. Each level adds new mysteries and broadens the heroine’s perception of the game reality. 

Almost all the locations of Season 1 display typical surroundings a language beginner is supposed to get around:

1. Library

2. Forest

3. House

4. Town

5. Town Hall

6. Main Square

7. Restaurant

8. Boutique

9. School

10. Store

11. Jeweler’s Store

12. Town Market

Integrity. All in one game. You don’t need teachers, tutors, courses, and textbooks anymore. The Identity Quest gives you a full command of the language you’ve chosen to play in.

Fun. The Identity Quest is a fascinating game of its own value. It contains intrigues, mysteries, hidden identities, puzzles, and mini-games of different genres. Everything, which will give you the most pleasure and excitement. The detective story development entwined with comedy, thrilling and melodramatic situations gives the gamer a unique experience of being involved in genuine book/movie adventures.

Motivation. The game’s plot and its challenges give you the constant wish to go on with The Identity Quest, thus ensuring your progress in the language and lessening your chances of losing interest.

Interaction. You can interact with everything in The Identity Quest and get an appropriate response. Almost all the scenes, mini, and extra linguistic games are replayable with a possibility to choose differently and see the consequences. You easily pick up the names of things, clicking on them as many times as necessary.

Context. As children explore the world through interaction and learn concepts from context, going from concrete ideas to abstract ones, The Identity Quest gives you meanings, derived from the environment surrounding you.

Story-driven acquisition. Unlike other language learning means, The Identity Quest’s story dominates everything else. Lexical choices and grammatical structures  stem from the logic of the story, not vice versa. You live the heroine’s life and acquire the language of the game on the way.

Regulated input. You have a full control of the language input by asking other characters to repeat or reword the phrases, using any number of Hints, reading translations of the previous dialogs in the Journal, and having a nice magic ability to suspend the time. Your initial level doesn’t matter; by controlling what you get, you progress at your own speed.

Multiple languages. Originally written in English for the Russian-speaking audience, The Identity Quest is easily transferable into other languages. We have already started translating the Spanish and French versions for English-speakers, English and French versions for Spanish-speakers, English and Spanish for French-speakers, and English, Spanish, and French versions for Russian-speakers. If we spark your interest and get your support, we have Italian, German, and Portuguese in mind as the additional languages.

We would love to find out what languages you want most to satisfy your needs, so if you can spare a moment, please leave your comments for us to consider.

Natural acquisition & organized learning. The Identity Quest has taken the best from the natural language environment you would have just living in the country, and the organized learning process where the material is presented in the easiest to master form. This mixture allows the player to progress much faster than in either of these environments.

Theoretical basis. The holistic simulated linguistic environment of the Identity Quest is the result of the 6-year research carried out by the author of this Project. Linguistics, applied linguistics, sociolinguistics, psychology, pedagogy, pragmatics, and didactics all played their role in defining the best principles to simulate the consistent game world. Based on them, the Identity Quest imitates a wide range of social interaction and recreates authentic communication.

We’ve chosen Flexible Funding because even incomplete funding will make the project closer to reality. 

$200,000 is the money for the entire Season 1, 8 Episodes, but we realize that it is highly unlikely for a new, unexperienced team to gather that much.

However, if we are able to raise more than $5,500, we will be able to hire a freelance programmer, an artist, and a composer, who will help make the playable alpha version of Chapters 1&2 for the next attempt to collect the needed funds.

If we are lucky to attract more attention, each $20,000 will provide a month’s work on the project, and $60,000 will make Episode 1 possible.

In addition, the more subsidization we attract, the more real the game world will become with more 3d features, built-in speech trainers, advanced animation, console and tablet versions.

The ultimate (and initial) idea is (was) a virtual reality or an open-world 3d game (like GTA or Quake), but that would require a lot more money.


·  Taxes and Fees: profit tax, payroll taxes, IndieGoGo + bank transfer fees, administrative & legal fees, licensing & software;

·  Programming: in-game, server, & system programming;

·  Art: character art, interface art (menus, mini & extra games, animations, cut-scenes, visual effects)

·  Localization: translation into the chosen languages (English, Spanish, French, Italian or German), development of extra linguistic mini-games for each language, voiceovers. Each new language increases the Localization pie piece;

·  Music and Sound Effects

·  Other: marketing, social media, etc.

Because we can’t make the game without your help.

Our team, though proficient in other areas, lacks members with programming skills and an experienced Project Manager, who will see the Project to the smallest details we may have overlooked.

What’s more, we need a concept artist, who is capable of envisioning the entire game right from the start and intertwining the tiniest bits of art into a holistic, believable world.

Unfortunately, their services cost money. There are also the efforts of translators, numerous voiceover artists in different languages, game testers, accountants, and some other necessary specialists.

Nevertheless, we have built up the courage to put up the project at IndieGoGo not only to raise the necessary sum. Our first incentive is to see if the game meets the needs of a wider community. To check this interest or the lack of it with/without your comments, spreading the word, and supporting us. This is our little marketing and advertising campaign as well.

Although we are anxious to get your attention, we are well aware there might be none. In this case we will be devastated, but this will be our reality check. Thank you very much for reading this, anyway!

We are an internationally scattered team of language enthusiasts who would love to share their passion for languages with you. Unfortunately, there are no programmers or concept artists among us, so the project lacks playability.

Marina Latcko

The Identity Quest scriptwriter, theoretical researcher, developer. A teacher of English, applied linguist, writer.

Would love to finally know Spanish and Italian, playing The Identity Quest

Russia


Christa Wojciechowski

Consultant, Spanish translator and English/Spanish voiceovers, writer.

Would love to know Italian, playing The Identity Quest

USA/Panama


Julia Casado

French translator/teacher and a developer/adaptor of French linguistic Extra Games in the Project.

Would love to know Italian, playing The Identity Quest

France


Ekaterina Tomilina

French translator and voiceovers.

Would love to know German, playing The Identity Quest

France


Ilia Akimov

3d artist and animator.

Would love to know English, playing The Identity Quest

Russia


Andrey Kazanskiy

2D artist and flash animator.

Would love to know English, playing The Identity Quest

Russia

If you’ve read that far, you are our hero.

Thank you very much!

Risks and challenges

Frankly speaking, since our team is incomplete and unexperienced in video games development, we can run quite a few risks on the way even if we are able to raise a considerable sum.

The main issue is to find the right people to join us in our journey. The scouting/hiring process may put off the estimated delivery time.

However, we believe that if you consider the project as worthy, as we think it is, and support us, we will make sure to make it a reality.
