story:
Hi. I'm Dorian. I assume you know who I am, but if by some miracle this reaches further: I am 23 years old. I live with my wife and our 1yo son.

I started university when I was 19, and I had a nervous breakdown 3 months in. I failed university, ran out of money, and found out I was pregnant. I assumed I'd never be able to go back.

This year I went out on a limb and applied to do the course I've wanted to do since a child, Archaeology and Anthropology at Manchester. I got an unconditional offer. I dared to dream of a way to support my family, despite being severely disabled, and then Student Finance dashed those dreams again.

I now have an unholy number of diagnoses. I have Major Depressive Disorder, Generalised Anxiety Disorder, Panic Disorder, Borderline Personality Disorder, Joint Hypermobility Syndrome, Hypermobility, Chronic Fatigue, and a series of gastrointestinal problems caused by these other conditions and the medications I take for them. I am a wheelchair user and can't walk more than 50 metres. Because of how disabled I am, my wife is my full-time carer. She cannot work, and as such we live off a variety of state benefits designed to support families in our position. We have nothing left over at the end of the month – the safety net of the benefit state is hanging precariously low to the ground.

Student Finance have decided not to award me a tuition fee loan for this year. I have two years of funding remaining with them, but they are only willing to fund years 2 and 3 of my course. Their basis for this is the (incredibly ableist) assumption that I may, again, be thwarted by disability and then they'd have spent more money on me. I have appealed their decision, again and again, but they refuse to listen.

They have also assessed me as needing a £3,000 maintenance grant, but have since stripped me of it and sent me a bill for £800 to make up for my maintenance grant from the year I was 19. This is not money I have, and will make going to university incredibly difficult.

One of the ways to gain funding back is to prove that my previous failure was the result of ill health. Unfortunately, thanks to the horrible GP that I had at the time, my records are missing. I spent an hour going through them with my current GP. I sent them every piece of evidence I had, and they've declared it inadequate.

I'm supposed to be starting University, with appropriate support for the first time, in a month. At this rate, I will have to cut my losses on equipment deposits, books, and hope, and simply say I cannot afford to go and have the life I have dreamed about. I am so scared that I will lose any chance of this opportunity thanks to bureaucracy and ableism. My health is plummeting with the worry of it all. Everything hinges on this.

If you've been following the updates on our situation, you'll also know that in two weeks we will be homeless, as our landlady has discovered that we're gay and is now refusing to renew our lease. We have tried appealing to the council for housing, but they have blocked us at every turn – despite having had our application for over eight weeks, they still haven't assessed us as being eligible for help. We are going to have to leave the area that I know and love, that I grew up in, where I can see my mother's house from my front door, and move to an area where I will be terrified to step outside, simply because they are the only place that will take us.

There are so many stresses pressing down on us at the moment, that this is the only way I can see forward. If everyone who follows me on Twitter were able to chuck in a fiver, then I'd be able to pay my fees for this year. I wouldn't have to give up my dream. Even if they weren't, the more I'm able to get, the more likely I might be to persuade charities or the university to make up the rest.

The target here represents a replacement of the money that Student Finance have denied me for being disabled. If we can reach it, I can go to university. That would, at the moment, be more than I could ever imagine.

Any money raised in excess of this, tbh, is beyond my comprehension, but if the unthinkable occurs, it will go towards paying for my specialist equipment, my powerchair and our dire housing situation.

Thank you so much for even reading this.

Even if they weren't, the more I'm able to get, the more likely I might be to persuade charities or the university to make up the rest.The target here represents a replacement of the money that Student Finance have denied me for being disabled. If we can reach it, I can go to university. That would, at the moment, be more than I could ever imagine.Any money raised in excess of this, tbh, is beyond my comprehension, but if the unthinkable occurs, it will go towards paying for my specialist equipment, my powerchair and our dire housing situation.Thank you so much for even reading this.

story:
Update: Johnny Winn is stepping down from this project because of time pressure and family. Hal Fulton will continue it!

Short Summary

15 years ago, Ruby was considered exciting and new. Now a lot of people feel the same way about Elixir. Hal Fulton is a Ruby expert looking to help Rubyists learn functional programming with Elixir. Help us write a book!

Hal Fulton has more than 15 years' experience with Ruby and is the author of The Ruby Way. Johnny Winn (of "Elixir Fountain" fame) will continue to assist on a consulting basis.

We're doing this because the Elixir community is still new and exciting, and we want to support it and help it grow. Also we love coding.

What We Need & What You Get

Writing a book isn't easy, and it doesn't make much money. Self-publishing just makes it that much harder.

But we believe it's not only possible but worthwhile. And we believe this project can be crowd-funded.

In traditional publishing, there is the concept of an "advance." An author is paid a sum up front to help him stay alive while he writes, and it also serves for incentive and for accountability. (Most people prefer not to put in 600 hours of work for which they might get paid later, and it's hard to hold people to a commitment if they are not paid.) The publisher deducts that amount from whatever royalties the author might earn later.

So part of the money you contribute will be an advance for us. But if we self-publish, there will also be numerous costs and expenses that are normally the responsibility of the publishing house -- editing, setup, layout, creating an ebook, outsourcing the printing and distribution, handling the marketing and publicity. These things are also challenging and costly in their own way.

What do you get in return? Check out our perks. In a nutshell: You can get earlier and cheaper access to the material, and you can have the opportunity to provide feedback during the writing process.

Most importantly, you have the chance to help contribute something to a new and vibrant community. And you'll get recognition for it.

The Impact

This book attempts to bring Elixir to thousands of people who haven't been exposed to it before. We believe that as the industry changes, Elixir (and functional programming in general) will become even more useful and important than before.
It's our hope that we'll make the world (or at least the computing world) a slightly better place.


Risks & Challenges

We have the expertise needed to complete this project. Hal Fulton is a well-known expert in Ruby.

But things can still go wrong. Primarily these would be slips in the schedule. Neither author is doing this full-time! They both have day jobs (and lives!) that will compete for their time and energy.

Self-publishing also involves some complexity and uncertainty. Ebooks are actually easier to deal with than print books, but both have their challenges. Hal Fulton does have some experience in both those areas (as well as experience in traditional publishing).

Marketing and publicity won't be trivial. But both authors have literally hundreds of contacts in the computing field, as well as access to old-timers and heavyweights in the Ruby and Elixir communities. Above all, we're both resourceful enough to seek assistance when we get too far outside our own field. If something we're doing isn't working, we can find someone who can do it better.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, you can still help!
  • Mention this project on Twitter, Facebook, or elsewhere
  • Write a blog post and/or email three friends
  • Feel free to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
America is the most OBESE country in the WORLD.

                           


OBESITY and its related diseases are NOW the #1 cause of death in the United States.                     

                 


Coincidentally, Americans are COOKING LESS. It requires TIME to shop and prepare...time we all think we don't have.                           

                  


Americans are either eating out or buying prepared foods, and every time we do this we put our health in someone else's control.                       

                   


Eating out is an option that's very hard to ignore.         

Wouldn't you take an extra hour out of your day to prepare a home cooked meal if you knew it would prolong your life, prevent disease, improve your relationship with your kids and give them a brighter future?            

               

                                   

                         

 

and I believe that putting a home cooked meal on the table as often as possible is one of the best and most affordable ways to prevent disease. Plus, it makes you really happy and proud, to boot!

  I've been doing this for a while now, and the key is having confidence to cook at home with simple ingredients. Not only is it vastly more beneficial for your health, but it's a big money saver compared to eating out or on the fly. A recipe doesn’t have to be fancy or made with a huge number of ingredients. Honestly, it doesn’t! It just needs to be real food.  Plain and simple, real food tastes good and doesn't need much, if any, preparation to get there. For many years, I'd start my cooking classes by saying, “This will be easy, delicious, and nutritious.”

   My desire to educate has reached an all-time high as diseases like obesity, heart disease, Type 2 diabetes, Autism, ADHD, Alzheimer’s, cancer, colitis (its goes on and on) impact our country and the planet. I’m 41, and already I have way too many friends dealing with serious health conditions. Many of you know how personal it is for me, and I’m guessing that you, too, have a story of disease somewhere in your life right now.

   I’ve decided to produce a television show called YUM YUM about cooking and lifestyle. It’s going to be a lot of fun, because if it isn’t enjoyable, you just ain't gonna do it! We’re going to get your kids in the kitchen, liberate their hijacked taste buds, and demonstrate the power of food as fuel. 

  So I’ll educate you on what the right foods are and where you can buy them. I’ll teach you how to prepare delicious meals efficiently, because I know how busy life can be. Building confidence in the kitchen will not only help you to reclaim your health, but will also allow you to experience the joy in preparing a home cooked meal! 

  Additionally, I’ll introduce and interview nutrition experts who can help us to sort out the incredible number of opinions and approaches that exist. I want to support your effort to help you form your own belief system about what’s best for you and your family, because you need to believe in what you’re doing in order to be successful. That goes for anything in life, not just food.

I want to be a catalyst for change, and I deeply appreciate your support in helping me to reach this goal.

Rememeber: few ingredients, easy steps, and amazing results.

Let's get started, America! 

See you in the kitchen


MY MISSION

I am committed to repopulating the kitchens of America. Cooking has become a lost life skill and I'm going to teach it, in a fun way, to as many people as possible! Together we'll assume responsibility for our own health by preparing real food for ourselves and our families. I'll show you how combining a healthy diet and lifestyle are the key to prevention.  Let's ditch the fear and rebuild our confidence in the kitchen! You'll love being back in the kitchen with me...EASY NUTRITIOUS AND DELICIOUS!

The video below is about 5 minutes long and is a pictorial of why people stopped cooking and how I feel we can turn things around.


DEDICATION

I am dedicating this campaign to John Donovan; one of the wisest men I unfortunately never got to meet, and Kathryn Naficy, my sweet friend. They both inspire me daily to live life to the fullest, with no regrets, and to go forward despite fear of failure. John said "great achievement never comes without risk", and today I am honoring these words!


THE HEAL YOUR GUT COOKBOOK


In 2013 Hilary co-authored the best selling cookbook, "The Heal Your Gut Cookbook". A must have guide for those healing their guts through The GAPS Diet. The book chronicles Hilary's journey in healing herself and her family with food. It is now available in German and soon French and Spanish. 

          


After 2 years on the GAPS Diet, Hilary now pursues a life of balance - in all aspects. Her quest for knowledge is tireless as she works every day to empower her kids with the information they need to remain healthy and vibrant. Hilary makes it fun to learn about the power of traditions around food and the family dinner.

WHAT AM I PRODUCING?

Topics will include at least:

  • How to practically cook nutrient dense food.
  • Traditional recipes from kitchens around the world.
  • Using food as medicine.
  • The important role of community and eating together.
  • Stories of health and healers.
  • Important steps to happiness outside the kitchen.

I’m planning a televised series of ‘cooking adventure’ shows, simply titled 'YUM YUM'. In each episode, we'll explore the delicious and healthy flavors of our nation's vibrant, multi‐cultural appetite. Some shows will be filmed from ‘the road’, others with a guest in my kitchen; all of them will feature a meal at the family table! 
 
It is a light‐hearted yet focused cooking series inspired by the overwhelming feedback I got from my cookbook. I continue to receive emails from around the world telling stories of healing through food alone. Likewise, I often hear from people who grew up outside the US and say that my recipes remind them of home, where native populations thrive with far less disease. And of course, I also hear stories of heartache and helplessness from people who are struggling to regain their health. My series will dig deep into these issues and explore the power of food as medicine.
 
I am highly motivated by our country's staggering rates of chronic disease in children and adults. In fact, many of you know that the past couple of years have been focused on my family's own intense healing dietary protocols for treating illness. Now I am ready to do my part: to share what we've learned about nutrition, food prep, and most importantly, family togetherness, in hopes of helping others to avoid such 'diseases of civilization' as cancer. The more we can empower people to take control of their own health and make good choices, the better shot we have at a bright future for our children.
 
Let’s face it. This country has more cooking shows, cooking magazines and better access to food than ever before, yet as a country we are cooking less and less. I want to show viewers that it’s fun to be in the kitchen, to source great foods, and to prepare meals for sharing at the family table, as was done for generations until very recently. My bottom line: buy the best quality ingredients that you can afford, and cook real food.


TEAM YUM YUM

HILARY BOYNTON - CREATOR & PRODUCER

Hilary Boynton, certified holistic health counselor, received a BA in psychology from the University of Virginia and was trained at the Institute for Integrative Nutrition. The devoted mother of five young kids, Hilary has seen the power of nutritional healing firsthand. Inspired by her own experience of "food as medicine," she has dedicated herself to helping others on their path to wellness as a cook, coach, and professional educator. Hilary supports her clients by integrating "Paleo" and "Primal" philosophies with the wisdom of the Ancestral Health Movement and the Weston A. Price Foundation. Hilary is a Weston A. Price chapter leader, has run several local food co-ops, teaches cooking classes out of her house, and helped to open a farm-to-table restaurant in Concord, Massachusetts. She lives in Topanga, California with her family.

The success of her book, and the lessons she learned along the way, helped to fuel her new project. YUM YUM became a reality when she realized she just had to do more. The letters of pleas for help, from sick people all over the world, opened her eyes to this global problem of ill health. The passion and determination she has to empower people to take control of their own health and prevent disease is tireless. She and her family have battled many health issues themselves including cancer, epilepsy, infertility, eczema, and Alzheimer’s amongst others.

She understands what it’s like to be in the trenches. In talking with people from around the world, and listening to them recount the fond memories around the traditional foods they ate growing up, much the same as in her cookbook, she knew this information had to be shared. With a non-judgmental, non-threatening joi de vivre, Hilary travels and talks to the people who are doing things right and thriving. Uncovering not only the truths and mistruths, but the fun and pleasure of preparing a meal, she hopes to inspire people to get back in their kitchens and cook … simple, economical, real food.

NICK BOYNTON - CREATOR & PRODUCER

Nick has worked in commercial real estate development and management for many years. He has also raised money for several start-up companies. In 2013 he was diagnosed with throat cancer which he treated for in Los Angeles. His cancer was a wake-up call because he knew he had lost control of his health. Ensuring he's around for the next 50 years is his chief goal and is now regaining his health. 

He’s always been Hilary’s biggest fan and has witnessed her development over their 16 years of marriage. Nick has joined the team and wants to help others avoid the pain he has suffered and the risk of recurrence he now lives with. He can even cook a bit too but prefers not to follow recipes. 

MARIE ROONEY-HARDWICK 

Executive Assistant

Marie is a seasoned Executive Assistant with over seven years experience. Having held positions in the fashion and art world Marie is able to tailor her skills and meet the needs of her various clients. She has served as an assistant to Davis Factor, Kent Twitchell, and many more. Marie loves working with Hilary and finds her to be a true inspiration, and looks forward to working with her on The Yum Yum TV show.

MELISSA BOYCE - OWNER OF VOICE OF BOYCE

Social Media Management

Melissa has been in the field of advertising since 2009.  She has watched and learned as social media unfolded through the years from Myspace to SnapChat and everything in between. It has changed the way customers are obtained, relationships are built and brands are trusted. If you still think the point of social media is to post on your profile, then expect to see the same results as if you were on the corner handing out your business card. It's called social for a reason, the conversation matters. 



UPDATED RODUCTION BUDGET 11.23.15

The goal of this Indiegogo campaign is to produce one half hour pilot episode of YUM YUM, as well as a 1-2 minute sizzle reel, which will then be marketed to the many media outlets who are always looking for good content.

$60,000 Total Budget 

Funds received after the goal is reached will enable us to travel further and expedite brand development and production.

A SINCERE THANKS

I am honestly humbled and so very grateful for all the support I have received even before the official launch of this campaign. I can't thank you all enough for jumping in and supporting me in all different ways, from cheering me on to spreading my mesage to making financial commitments. It's all amazing and so incredibly awesome! I promise we will have a wild ride! Remember it's all about FUN and it's all about YUM!  

                             


PERKS & REWARDS

I spent a lot of time (outside the kitchen) researching the wide variety of Perks that have been offered in other campaigns. My "product" is EDUCATIONAL: having fun, sharpening your skills in the kitchen, improving your overall health, and in turn upgrading your lifestyle. This made it difficult to choose perks that you'd really appreciate and are eco friendly. I decided to keep it simple and offer perks that not only say thanks but are helpful in the kitchen, wearable, usable and/or educational. Your donations will allow me to realize my dream of improving your health and creating a brighter future for our children.  

Aside from cool t-shirts, hoodies, buttons, hanging with me at the farmer's markets and chit chatting on Skype we have some very cool other perks! Check out a few of our super exciting perks below! What a great way to give back and cross off a few holiday gifts at the same time!

Aside from cool t-shirts, hoodies, buttons, hanging with me at the farmer's markets and chit chatting on Skype we have some very cool other perks! Check out a few of our super exciting perks below! What a great way to give back and cross off a few holiday gifts at the same time!

story:
CCA Students Defy Stereotypes

Community colleges typically don't offer Model United Nations (MUN) programs...but the Community College of Aurora (CCA) does. Community colleges and their students typically can't swing the cost of attending the National MUN Conference...but CCA is making it happen. Community college students aren't expected to compete at the level of elite university students...but CCA students competed and won at the 2015 National MUN (CCA's first-ever delegation), receiving awards for Outstanding Position Paper, Honorable Mention Delegation to Ethiopia and outstanding video mini-documentary.  Help send our 2016 delegation to a life-changing experience.

The Next Generation of Global Leaders is Being Created Now

CCA's 2015 National MUN student delegation included two high school seniors concurrently enrolled in college courses, a student whose last time on an airplane was his flight out of a West African refugee camp 13 years prior, and a young woman whose interest in the UN grew from witnessing their essential peacekeeping role during Somalia's 20-year civil war.  These students are the face of CCA. The National MUN conference offers a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity for CCA students to debate, deliberate and craft positions on issues that are both real and personal.  This is the next generation of global leaders in the making.  Your contribution will change their lives and our world's future.

Individual Donations Make it Possible

How do we make this experience possible?  Through donations from people like you.  Help us by donating today!

CCA students don't come from wealthy families.  Finding $2,500 on their own to attend the MUN Conference is an impossible dream.  With your donation, you will help make this dream a reality.  $2,500 is a starting point, not an end goal. Every $2,500 we raise adds one more student to CCA's 2016 delegation.  Please donate.  And, please share this campaign with your family and friends and get us to a delegation of 18.

What's In It for You?

The thrill of supporting a winning team; a team that has earned, not been given, a seat at the table.  The feeling that comes from making a unique difference in a student's life.  The pride of knowing that you are supporting the creation of tomorrow's leaders -- smart, culturally astute, fair, bold leaders.  Give today!

story:
We exist to equip this next generation of leaders in Asia through holistic services so that they may be empowered to impact their societies. We accomplish our vision through the services of training, coaching, and mentoring. All of our services are holistic, meaning they cover all key areas of life: professional, personal, and spiritual.


We are raising $20,000 USD in order to send five members of our team to an International Coach Federation (ICF) certified training course in Singapore from January 25-29th 2016.

The course is called the Coaching Mastery Certificate Program run by Creative Results Management. CRM is a fantastic organisation that we've had the privilege of receiving training from before. By attending this intensive course, our team members will fulfill all of the training requirements to achieve their professional Associate Certified Coach (ACC) credentials from the ICF.


  1. While each member has received coaching training, the level of skill they will possess as a result of this training ensures that Empower Asia will be able to offer world-class coaching services to the next generation of leaders in Asia. As a result, we will be able to have a greater impact on these young leaders as we empower and mobilize them to make a positive impact for their community.

  2. The ICF is one of the world's leading accrediting bodies for professional coaching. Having more of our team achieve their ACCs give us the greater credibility as individuals and an organisation that our growing start-up needs. This will give us more and better opportunities to partner with institutions and impact the lives of students and young professionals.


Spread the word!

We also appreciate other forms of support! Simply forward our message to your network contacts to spread the word about Empower Asia. Remember to use the Indiegogo’s sharing tools!


Why do we have to raise funds for this?

We are raising funds because we are a non-profit organization and every staff member raises their own funds for salaries to serve the next generation in Hong Kong.

How much does it cost to accredit one member of the team?

We are raising $4000 (USD) per team member.

Where does that money go?

  1. $2897  - Creative Results Management Coaching Mastery Certificate Program (Early Bird Rate)

  2. $500 - Accreditation fee with the ICF

  3. $303 - Supplement for travel and accommodation costs to attend the course.

  4. $300 - Administration Fees for donations

What is actually included in the Coaching Mastery Certificate Program?

We think the course is incredibly good value for money. Some of the things this full package includes are :

  • A five-day intensive training course with experienced coaches and instructors

  • A total of75 ICF-approved training hours (60 hours are required for the ACC)

  • 10 mentor-coaching hours with qualified ICF coach

  • Access of CRM's downloadable worksheets, coaching tools, and other resources

For the full breakdown of the course content, see CRM's website here.

What is the Donor Wall perk and how does it work?

The Donor Wall will be a permanent collage of pictures and words from those who have donated to this campaign. We want to be able to put this up wherever EA has its head office in the future. As we continue to grow, we never want to forget this community - all of you - who have helped us get there!

What if I donated enough for the Donor Wall perk, what do I do now?

Please send a photo of yourself and/or a note from you to connect@empower-asia.org with the subject line: "Donor Wall". You can opt out if you want, but we would love to have something to remember your generosity by!

What is the VIP dinner and how does it work?

We want to thank those of you who have given so generously by inviting you all to a dinner with our team. After the fundraising period is completed, you will receive an email where we will ask you for information to help us coordinate the best time and place for this celebration.

What if I have tickets to the VIP dinner but do not live in Hong Kong?

If you live in another country, there are two main options :

  1. The next time a member of our team is in your area, we'll be happy to host you and any guests (depending on your perk) for a VIP dinner of your own!

  2. You can pass on your ticket(s) to others in Hong Kong who you think would benefit from coming to the VIP dinner. This could be a great opportunity to help others connect with us and our work (and who doesn't like a free meal?).

What happens if you go over the goal?

If we go over our project goal, the money will go into a coaching fund that will help to fund coaching training for incoming & future team members.


Have more questions? Email us at connect@empower-asia.org and we'll be happy to answer them.

story:
We are raising money for a small solar system that will accommodate the energy of one classroom.   If we over fund our campaign, we can solar power a whole grade level, maybe two grades, sky's the limit. Either way, the solar system has panel for panel monitoring which is connected to the internet so every student can access the solar production and use it for their new solar curriculum in math or science.

A local solar company is matching the funds raised and installing the solar system in early 2016.  The county is being very supportive and allowing this pilot solar project on the roof of the school so the students can learn about solar technology.  All the solar energy is being used directly by the school in real time, lowering their monthly bill, and showing the students they can change their future with the support of the community. 

The solar project is being championed by the 4th grade science classes with the help from teachers and parent volunteers.

story:
Short Summary

                          

                          The boat we want to build....12' Providence River Boat

Oarlock and Sail Wooden Boat Club was started 20 years ago by two women who wanted to build their own boats.  As the years went by the club grew to include boat builders, rowers, sailors, wood workers and other enthusiasts.  We work out of a floating workshop we built at the Maritime Museum’s Heritage Harbour Dock in Vancouver, BC. 

The club has built and restored several boats over the years including:                         7’ Fancy Pram, 9’ Gartside Pram, 12’ Gartside Riff, 16’ Derry Carter lapstrake rowboat, 12’ Vogler Brothers clinker-built and a 12’ Richard Kolin Heidi design.

                                
  

                           

                                         The Gartside Riff "Ragna"

As members got older, had families or moved away there were only a few old timers keeping it alive.  2013 brought new members to the club.  We now have the energy but are short on funds to start our next project.

We want to build a 12 foot Providence River boat in order to have another row boat that sails.  This was a boat documented by Howard Chapelle and built in 1875 by a man named Button Swan. It was once common at the head of Narragansett Bay, near Providence, Rhode Island.  The original boat was commonly used for crab fishing. It featured a live well and carried a huge gaff rig. The boat would be 12’ 4” long with a beam of 5’ 3”.  It’s got an unstayed cat rig with an optional head sail (jib).  The traditional type of building would be Lapstrake (Clinker) planks on steam bent hardwood frames (ribs).

This project will:

1.  not only replace one of our older boats but also provide a boat for members and their children to sail

2.  provide an opportunity for our members to build a boat in a very traditional way

3.  members will learn how to use tools and wood building skills

4.  carry on the Maritime heritage in Vancouver

                               


Funds for this project are needed for:

·  wood

·  rigging

·  shipping

This is our budget break down:

PROVIDENCE RIVER BOAT  12’ 4”

Boat plans                                $  0

Wood                                         $1000

framing                                     $  800

mast/spars sitka spruce    $  500

fastenings                                $  500

rigging                                       $  500

hardware (oars, cleats)       $  500

sail                                              $  500

paint                                          $  500 

shipping                                   $  300

mailing incentives                $  200

boat cover                              $  200

misc                                          $  500

 

Total                                      $6000

We have a few perks which you can see to the right of the home page.   Our t shirt is on several of our members in the video and here is a picture of the boat hook by Ed.

story:
ABOUT ME
Hi my name is Beckie, I'm 20 years old and I'm in London training to be an actor at The Poor School.

I've worked so incredibly hard to get to where I am, with help from others but it's been a huge struggle to keep myself in London. I love the course and I am trying to get as much as I can from everything we do there. The people I've met here and the opportunities have been incredible and I really do not want to have to leave. I've had a lot of people really go out of their way for me and help me in so many ways to keep me here, including so much support from a lot of you and I refuse to give up without trying everything and that's why I'm here...

WHAT I'M ASKING
To cut to the chase I'm unable to carry on into the final year without some financial help and because I do not get student finance or loans/grants anything like that I am now starting to struggle and need your help if possible. I took out a loan (stupidly) to pay for the first year fees and so with the monthly repayments of that, rent, travel etc, it's getting to a point where I'm having to think about moving back to Donaster.

WHY I'M ASKING NOW
I can't do it without you.
After having so much go wrong (here is brief overview of my past year in London.. getting scammed, turning up to my first day at work and it not actually existing, losing my phone, buying a phone, having that phone stolen then leaving my oyster, driving license and card on the bus before getting a train back home. Having to cancel and re-order my card twice (maybe three times), one reason being that some awful person rigged a cash point!) Luckily I have some amazing people in my life that let me share their bed, rent out their living room etc but I have a time limit now,

I need just under £5500 to pay for my final year, that's where all the money will be going.

anything from a penny could be a huuuuge help towards meeting my final goal. 

And of course, your help will not be forgotten and somehow I will return the favour!

ALTERNATIVE WAYS TO HELP
Obviously if you can't donate that is not a problem but you could still help by passing on the message and sharing with friends/family etc.
And if anyone knows of any job opportunities and what not, please let me know!

story:
Short Summary

Hi, I'm Sienna Nordquist and I am a 2015 Global Community Champion for Women's Economic Empowerment with Empower Women, an arm of United Nation Women! Through my Championship, I connected with RUWON Nepal, a Non-Governmental Organization that works towards the rights and social justice of rural women and children in Nepal and I am now an Ambassador to RUWON Nepal. RUWON Nepal advocates for gender equity, good governance, democratic practices, human rights, and volunteerism by promoting objectives such as increasing the quantity of economically independent women, empowering women through education, and providing health awareness. RUWON Nepal is also implementing projects to pay for the food, clothing, rent, and transportation of rural girls to receive an education, and supports local orphans. RUWON Nepal was registered in the Sindhuli district administration office, the Internal Revenue Office, and the Social Welfare Council.

I am leading a team of individuals, including Nicole Sturgis from the United States, Anne Lisberth from Haiti, and Dhruba Ghimire from Nepal to crowdfund the funds necessary to create a facility in Kathmandu that will provide free computer education classes to women and girls in Nepal. Dhruba Ghimire is the Executive Director of RUWON Nepal and is ensuring the implementation of our campaign. 

What We Need 

We are aiming to raise $25,000 USD to cover the costs of the facility to include 15 computers, 15 computer tables, 15 chairs, one printer, one projector, two computer teacher's salary for a year, one office table, a cupboard, carpeting, high speed internet, room rent, stationaries, and backup power.

The funds raised will be wired to RUWON Nepal (located in Kathmandu). 

The Impact

It is VERY important that YOU help us to create this facility in Kathmandu, Nepal, because it will help to revitalize Nepal after the disastrous earthquake they suffered last April. Nepal also ranks 157 out of 187 nations on the Human Development Index according to the 2013 Human Development Report, and therefore needs an influx of capital to advance its development.  When communities empower women, there is no limit to the success and growth that they culminate. Empowering these rural Nepalese women and girls to have a future through the computer skills they can learn and master at this training center provides them a livelihood to live economically independent and prosperous lives. You can be the change and help these women and girls change their world and become economically empowered by supporting our fundraiser!

Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word about our campaign to others who believe in women's economic empowerment and the difference that RUWON Nepal is making in the daily lives of Nepalese women and girls! We can all make a difference when we come together to empower ourselves and those around us!

story:
Help us raise money to continue improving postpartum health education among mothers in need at Hospital Evangelico in Ponta Grossa, Parana (Brazil). This money will go towards funding the costs of printing the handouts which are given to mothers once they are admitted to the hospital. We will be using printing services offered by a local store, Livraria e Papelaria Fenix, located just one block from the hospital. These handouts are one page each (front and back) and cover the basics of postpartum care for both the mother and baby.
 
Click here to read more about our story and this cause!

This money will go towards funding the costs of printing the handouts which are given to mothers once they are admitted to the hospital. We will be using printing services offered by a local store, Livraria e Papelaria Fenix, located just one block from the hospital. These handouts are one page each (front and back) and cover the basics of postpartum care for both the mother and baby.  Click here to read more about our story and this cause!

story:
Summary

"...Here we are. You have each come so far in so little time. Whether you pursue a career running a business or one day join the team of another organizations, you will now approach life with the mindset to try and then learn; and the resilience adapt and evolve. In other words approach life as entrepreneurs.

So the next time any of you need to know what an entrepreneur is, fear not, for you need only look into a mirror..."

~Lorenzo Somma, MIGHTY Pitch 2015

When I joined the IEC of Hamilton in 2013 to help bring together the MIGHTY (Mentors in Greater Hamilton Teaching Youth) Entrepreneurship Program, I had all the objectives and strategies laid out for how the IEC could bring this program together. Little did I know it would be the young creative minds of the Mighty Program who would demonstrate to me the true essence of entrepreneurship: the confidence to try; the resilience to fail.

Beyond the curriculum and mentorship of the program, it is the inspiring of confidence and resilience in the young minds of Hamilton that is at the core of what Mighty does. In a time of such uncertainty there is no better gift than to instill in the next generation than everything entrepreneurship can bring into a life.

It is the intention of this campaign to stoke the flames of youth entrepreneurship to bring the MIGHTY Program into a 3rd successful year of operation. 


What We Need & What You Get

Despite Mighty's past success The government has reallocated funds and is no longer supporting their Youth Entrepreneurship Partnerships model from which MIGHTY received its funding. Our goal is to raise $10,000.00 to maintain the operational cost of providing and coordinating MIGHTY.

Funds raised will go to:

·  Providing over 40 after school entrepreneurial sessions across both Hamilton school boards

·  Operation costs required to facilitate sessions and coordinate volunteers/contributors

·  Transportation (bus tickets) required by participating students who may otherwise been unable to attend sessions

·  Light healthy food and refreshments provided during after school sessions

 Perks:

Many local merchants have provided perks and more are expected to be added as the campaign progresses. Current perks include:

·  Gift certificates to Cake and Loaf

·  Gift certificates to Mavericks Hair Studio in Jackson Square

·  Custom business cards from Piranha Studios

·  Fine dining at The Mule

·  Creative works from Jelly Bros Studios

·  Start-up packages from CoMotion on King 

Should we be unable to fulfill our $10,000.00 goal, we will utilize the funds we do raise to provide the program as best we can, even if to fewer students.

The Impact

During the first two years the MIGHTY Program has been active, we have had the pleasure for working with over 65 students in 7 high schools across both Public and Catholic School Boards. (Parkdale, Delta, SHAE and Nora Henderson in the Public School Board. Cathedral, St. Thomas Moore and St John de BreBeuf in the Catholic School Board)

Also during MIGHTY's first two years it has achieved:

Over 60 bi-weekly "Munch and Learn" Entrepreneurship sessions provided

Issued 37 MIGHTY Entrepreneurship Program Certificates of Completion

Engaged with over 30 volunteer mentors who provided group and one to one mentorship with students

Hosted 2 annual finale event (MIGHTY Pitch) with a combined community attendance of over 150

A total of 18 students made final pitches to MIGHTY Pitch judges and audience

A total of 11 students accepted into Ontario Summer Company Program 


Risks & Challenges

Youth under the age of 17 are considered among the vulnerable sector of society making their safety paramount. In order to address this, all adults mentors and in house contributors working with MIGHTY must go through a screening process which includes an up to date police background check.

A focus this year will also be strengthening our program support within the Public School Board system by adding two new school location to where the program will be run.

In the past one of our greatest challenges has been recruiting suitable mentors. We are pleased to announce two new initiatives to address this issue. First, in schools that contain MIGHTY Alumni, previous MIGHTY Graduates are eager to join the ranks of mentors in peer to peer sessions. Second, MIGHTY has engaged with Mohawk Colleges Surge program to provide second semester Entrepreneurial Studies students the opportunity to "learn by teaching" as mentors when MIGHTY sessions commence in January of 2016.

Finally, MIGHTY's ever evolving experiential learning curriculum has been adapted to demonstrate and encourage the use of the Business Model Canvas. The Business Model Canvas will bring a new level of reflection, conceptualization and understanding to student's businesses beyond the textbook complexities of traditional business plan.

Other Ways You Can Help

Beyond direct contributions to the campaign, you can get involved in a variety of ways. MIGHTY and the IEC are always looking for volunteers to share experiences as mentors or speakers. Follow this link to get involved:  http://www.iechamilton.ca/getinvovled 

Another way to support the campaign is to share it on your social media or send it out to the trend starters, innovators and entrepreneurs in your social circles.

Finally, the campaign can always use new perks. If your organization would like to contribute a product or service to our MIGHTY perks, please contact us at: Lorenzo.somma@iechamilton.ca

story:
Why We Are Raising Funds

To this day, children of Haiti live lives of complete impoverishment.  With little to no way to help themselves recover from this poverty, hope arises from Education.  Sadly, thousands of Haitian children never have the opportunity to attend to school because they cannot afford it. Talented, smart Haitian children want to go to school.

School opportunities in Haiti are different.  The government provides no funding whatsoever to rural schools.  Any rural schools are private and run on student tuition fees only.

Costs

Friends of Haiti endeavors to support children in achieving their goals by sending them to school.  Your donations will help a child by:

    1. Paying school tuition; tuition varies depending on the age of the student

                      $25 USD per year for ages K-6

                   $50 USD per year for ages 7-9

                   $30 USD per month for high school

                   $100 USD per month for university

           2. purchasing required school uniforms;

                       $25 - $50 USD per year depending on the age of the student

           3.  purchasing required backpacks and school supplies

                      up to  $25 USD per year

98% of all our funding goes directly to our cause.   Minimal Administration fee of 2% is used to send funds and support Maxeau in administrative work in Haiti (gas, bank fees).

    100% of our humanitarian trips and costs in Canada are directly paid for by our team members.


    Who We Are

    Friends of Haiti is a small group of Canadians  who want to help our friends in Haiti with education, healthcare, sports, housing, entrepreneurship, and dreams.  Living in Canada, we have so many opportunities and an abundance of support to achieve goals.  To see others living in desperation is so difficult.  We now have a way to send direct help and support.  Living a life that is productive and meaningful all starts with education.

    Dave B.

    Dave is a Calgarian who has been involved with Humanitarian work locally and around the world.  He has made 5 humanitarian trips to Haiti alone. He has made significant contributions in housing, education, sport, entrepreneurship and health care.



    Mr. Gabe

    From Calgary, Mr. Gabe has made four Humanitarian trips to Haiti.  He spends the year refurbishing computers to take to Haiti.  On his 2015 trip, he was honored by having the computer lab in Lavanneau Haiti named after him.


    Paul L.

    A marketing director from Chilliwack BC, Paul is involved with several Humanitarian trips each year. 


    Carolin B.

    Involved in Humanitarian work for many years, Carolin has recently focused her efforts on supporting the development of a successful soccer league in rural Haiti.  Additionally, she sponsors a medical student, and has contributed significantly to the building of houses for many Haitians.


    Tony M.

    From Chilliwack BC, Tony is a tireless advocate and humanitarian for the people of Haiti.



    Lori C.

    An educator from Calgary, Lori focuses on supporting Haitian children to attend school.



    Maxeau P.

    Max, a law student from Marbial, Haiti is the Haitian Coordinator.



    Friends of Haiti (Canada)

    Our Mission

    Haiti, the poorest country in the Western Hemisphere continues to suffer from the earthquake of 2010.  Today many Haitians are living in extreme poverty with little or no way to help themselves.

    Since the earthquake, my Friends of Haiti has had the privilege of being involved in humanitarian work in Haiti.  The needs are vast and the situation is desperate.  We believe the way to help Haitians help themselves is through education.

    Homes in Lavanneau, Haiti

    Sadly, many families cannot afford to send their children to school.  Our initiative aims to provide funds to the poorest, most under privileged children of Haiti in order to attend school.   We know that by supporting youth in reaching their dreams of becoming nurses, teachers and lawyers we must get them to school.  

    Children of rural Haiti, they dream of going to school

    The future of Haiti

    Over the past five years, extensive humanitarian work has been done to develop Friends of Haiti (Canada).  Friends of Haiti is a small group of Canadians who want to help our friends in Haiti with education, healthcare, sports, housing, entrepreneurship and dreams.

    A new home for Ednor, with sponsors Carolin, Dave and Mr. Gabe 

    The main team of five are based out of Alberta and B.C.  The team travels to Haiti once a year to achieve our mission.  During the year however, the focus is on fund raising.  

    Heading to the goat market to purchase goats for schools.

    We are very privileged to have a Haitian coordinator who works tirelessly to bring hope to Haitians.  Maxeau Pierre, a law student living in Jacmel, coordinates our efforts from Haiti.

    Maxeau brings school supplies to the children of Marbial

    We are pleased to report that to date, 98% of all our funding goes directly to our cause.   Minimal Administration fee of 2% is used to send funds and support Maxeau in administrative work in Haiti.  We do this work because we care.  Help Haitians help themselves. Please join our Facebook page Friends of Haiti (Canada).

    Mission accomplished, all ready for Sept 7, 2015. First day of school.

story:
Who we are

We are a group of educators that have come together to seek ways of helping economically marginalized groups, such as women and the youth, earn a living. We seek and implement innovative approaches, which help people who have completely no source of livelihood. We are currently conducting a life skills training programme in school to help reduce pregnancy cases and retain girls in school.

Why Kisii girls

One of the obstacles for women empowerment in Kenya is lack of sound education and training. This stems from school dropout at a tender age due to pregnancy. Kisii County, with 17.3% of its residents having obtained secondary education (Commission of revenue, 2011), has one of the high school dropout rates of girls in Kenya. Socio-cultural practices and domestic roles make women and girls spend their time doing household chores. Often, due to poverty and lack of knowledge on reproductive health, girls conceive shortly after another pregnancy.We endeavor, through the life skills programme, to educate girls to avoid pregnancy and foster the re-admission into school of the girls who have dropped out due to pregnancy related cases.

Why we need your contribution

Besides the life skills programme which aims at retaining girls in school, we are intending to rehabilitate dropouts and help them resume school. For those who will not be re-admitted, we will help them learn a handwork training of their choice that can help them find a source of income. We now need to build a room that will be used as a seminar and training room for these girls. The seminar room will remain as an initiative to start a girl’s cultural centre, for networking and motivating the girls. The site for construction has been donated and we are now seeking to raise money for materials and the construction work.The seminar room accessories and furniture have been provided by a women and girls grant that we were awarded. Your contribution will help us find shelter to realize the goal of this project.

These are girls from families that are already burdened with other children to provide for. It is an added burden for the parents to take care of the children of their children. Your contribution will help us send the girls back to school, give them training that they can use to earn a living and give them life skills that will help them take control of their lives.

Other contributions

Thank you for taking time to read this and having interest on our project. Your contribution of any kind are greatly appreciated. In case you are not able to give monetary contribution, your time as a volunteer to motivate, mentor and and be part of the life skill training activities will be a precious gift to us. Please let us know if you would like to work with us as a volunteer.

You can also pass word a round about our activities a well as this campaign. We appreciate any contribution to our activities.
